lorebooks.name: Spinward
lorebooks.creator: DiamondBlder

1.content:
Located spinward of the Core Sectors, the Spinward Sector may no longer be humanity's frontier, but it is still a wild west filled with opportunity... and danger.
The Spinward Sector was settled earlier than some of its surrounding regions, due to the actions of the Third Soviet Union. Following their exodus from Earth, the neo-bolsheviks of the Union sought a place to make their new communist utopia, eventually settling on the planet of New Moscow. Originally charted some 100 years prior, New Moscow would go on to become the centre of the burgeoning Third Soviet state, and this would draw further attention to the region. When the Union eventually collapsed, the instability in the region would attract TerraGov, who would incorporate the region as part of human space, but not as a full member state of the federation- instead leaving governing to the independent Spinward Stellar Coalition.
In 2565:
The Sector has settled down notably since the collapse of the Union, with the frontier moving forward to the March Sector on the border with the Lizard Empire, and this newfound stability has attracted both the attention of TerraGov, and of corporations. A number of Enterprise-Charters have been issued to megacorporations for the area in cooperation with the SSC, which has led to a gold rush amongst these large companies. Most notable amongst these competitors are Nanotrasen, who has discovered a large haul of plasma on Indecipheres just on the edge of the sector, and Cybersun Industries who seek to contest that claim. Unfortunately for the residents of the region, TerraGov's interest has not yet extended to enforcement in the SSC, which has allowed this conflict between Nanotrasen and Cybersun to boil over into a true war.
The remnants of the Third Soviet Union continue to cause problems, even decades on from the collapse. Although their attacks become less frequent with every passing year as true believers die or move on, they still pose a threat to the average civilian via terroristic action and attacks against the government.

2.content:
Spinward Stellar Coalition
Also known as: SSC
Capital: New Moscow City, New Moscow, Zvezda Revolyutsii Oblast
Languages: Spinwarder Russian, Galactic Common
Organization: Regional Governing Body
Location: Territory mainly coreward of the station, within Civ-Space
Relations with NT: Loyal (unstable)
Population: Sparsely populated planets, orbital outposts

Born of the ashes of the collapsed Third Soviet Union, the Spinward Stellar Coalition (Vostochnaya Zvezdnaya Koalitsiya, *lit.* Eastern Stellar Coalition) is the closest governing body to SS13, controlling much of the regions closeby to the station. Small in comparison even to other independent human governments, their holdings consists of a number of (mostly sparsely-populated) planets and orbital outposts, spread across a wide territory that is mostly owned by the government in New Moscow on paper only. Life this far from Sol is austere, but the Spinwarders are generally honest, hardworking folk, unfairly subjected to the whims of various entities that have arrived in the region and started to throw their weight around.
The collapse of the Third Soviet Union was a brutal and bloody affair, with the February Revolution and its aftermath costing the people of the Spinward Sector dearly. In this chaos, a stabilising force was needed, and this came in the form of the Spinward Stellar Coalition. Founded on idealistic principles, the SSC represented a new hope for the Spinward Sector, and for a brief few decades, it seemed as though this would a true new page for the Spinwarders; and then came the corruption. It may be too early and too severe to call the SSC a failed democracy, but its institutions are in terminal decline, precipitated by the efforts of its autocratic leader, Oleksandr Kushnirenko, who has maintained his grip on power via cronyism and remarkably brazen electoral fraud for a long 12 years. Kushnirenko has also been keen to court corporate interest, with the backing (and funding) of corporate powers being critical to his stranglehold on power, in particular that of Nanotrasen.

Despite everything, life on the rim continues. The average citizen lives a better life under the SSC than they did under the late Third Soviet Union, with the liberalisation of the economy and the corporate arrival bringing a deluge of new money to the region, as well as the infrastructure they need to operate. The first comms buoy link to Earth came about 30 years ago; direct flights between New York and New Moscow (in as little as three weeks!) came the next year. Core-made products are common at grocery stores. In many ways, the Spinward Sector is the most well-connected Far Rim territory across all of Far Human Space.
Such luxuries, however, don't come free, and the overbearing hand of the corporation can be felt across the sector. Many younger citizens of the SSC have taken up jobs with the corporations, which has lead to a generational divide between young and old. An open implication also hangs in the air that everything the corporations have brought, they can easily take away if the Spinwarders prove unhelpful to their interests. None of this engenders much love for the corporations on the Far Rim, with many citizens hoping to see a day where their influence over the Coalition is brought to heel, and their quality of life doesn't rely on the whims of trillion-dollar companies that have forgotten what it is to be a normal person.
In the larger cities and orbital habitats of the SSC, corporate workers have started to rent or purchase houses, seeking some degree of freedom from the corpos during their time off-rotation. The pay offered by Nanotrasen means that most workers can afford a decent enough place to live, and the commute from the SSC to the nearest NT Dispatch Station is only a few days by local mass transit options. There's also a lot of recreational facilities here that just can't be replicated on one of Nanotrasen's stations; while you can always drop by the bar, there's a certain ambience the on-station facilities lack. Naturally, none of this particularly endears the locals to Nanotrasen's presence, as if they needed any further convincing to hate them.

3.content:
Indecipheres
A roiling pot of fire and brimstone, inhabited by strange and hostile fauna and crowned with an ancient and evil ruin, possibly cursed. Oh, and it's also home to the biggest plasma haul in human history.
Originally discovered in the 2300s by an explorer who was smitten by the planet's remarkable biodiversity in the face of adversity, the history of human contact with Indecipheres begins with a dispute over its name. The original discoverer had, in her original star charts, named the planet "Fredonia", in honour of her husband. At the Bureau of Cartography on Earth, however, an intern assigned to converting these charts to a digital format spilled coffee on the documentation. Being unable to read the name for the planet, she instead opted to name it "Indecipheres", from "indecipherable". By the time the original discoverer of the planet, who was rightly furious about the change, found out about this, it was officially part of TerraGov's charts for too long to be changed. And so, the planet has retained its new name ever since.


The planet itself is incredibly hostile. The planet's plate tectonics can only be described as "extreme", with lava seas and frequent earthquakes. The unstable tectonics have also opened a vast number of caves beneath the surface, and brought a wide array of minerals to them, making the planet incredibly resource rich. This is a feature that has made Indecipheres extremely lucrative for mining, as one of the most common minerals on the planet is the ever-so-elusive plasma, with the ores also being of remarkable purity. Additionally, the planet is home to a wealth of fauna and a remarkable amount of flora given its hostile environment.
Perhaps the most interesting part of Indecipheres is its archaeological potential- the planet is dotted with ruins and structures presumed to be from an ancient civilisation, with the largest being the imposing Necropolis.

4.content:
Location: No official capital, small holdings throughout SSC space

Type of Org: Rump State/Insurgency

Description: The birth of the SSC did no favours to its mother, the Third Soviet Union. Founded roughly one century prior to SS13's construction by a splinter group of Communist settlers in the Russian dominated colonial region of New Moscow, the Third Soviet Union sought a return to what they viewed as the idyllic past of Soviet Russia, but this time free of the crippling external influences that saw that state (and the Second Union, for that matter) collapse. Unfortunately, they fell into many of the same pitfalls as their predecessors, with a regime marked by brutal repression and political violence.

Such a state was doomed to fail just like its predecessors, and it would take only around 50 years from its founding to its eventual collapse, with the February Revolution seeing the head cut from the beast. In its place, the SSC was founded to return political enfranchisement to the people of the Union, just in time to have that right again threatened by corporate influence.

Despite the central government's collapse, the half-century since has not seen the fires of communism die. Instead, they have been reduced to cinders- alive, but barely. Though the likelihood of a resurgent Soviet state seems impossible, resistance groups of Red Soldiers and Communist Loyalists continue the fight against the capitalistic decadence of the SSC from hidden outposts dotted around the region, and have been known to cause issues for Nanotrasen, too.

The hostile space Russians you see are mostly associated with the TSU, though some are just kosmogopniks with no cause and copious amounts of vodka.
While they are hidden and their numbers are few, Soviet Remnants are a formidable problem for the SSC to deal with. Terrorist attacks by the group are a constant threat to major cities in the SSC, particularly in New Moscow.
KS13 was a Soviet installation prior to being shut down during the collapse. The station was never reactivated by the SSC as it was deemed "too old" to bother expending resources on.
There are rumors that the Soviets still possess the PWS Khranitel Revolyutsii, their old flagship that went missing during the collapse. If these rumors are true, the Soviets may be able to pose a serious naval threat in the region- but as this has never materialized yet, many believe it's simply an apocryphal tale.

lorebooks.name: Syndicate
lorebooks.creator: DiamondBlder

1.content:
Corporate Syndicate
Headquarters: Cybersun Industries HQ, TerraGov International District of Hong Kong and Macau, Earth (de facto)
Spheres: Various, Assaulting NT influence
Organization: Syndicate
Sphere of Influence: Spinward Sector
Public Relations: Mixed
Size: Large

In the vast expanse of the Spinward Periphery, a clandestine force emerged a few decades ago under the guidance of Cybersun Industries - the Spinward Syndicate, a diverse coalition of groups with a shared determination to challenge Nanotrasen's dominance.
Established a few decades ago by Cybersun Industries, the Spinward Syndicate (often referred to as the Syndicate) is a diverse alliance of various groups united by their shared goal of challenging Nanotrasen's influence in the Spinward Periphery. The Syndicate comprises a patchwork of members, including notorious criminals, skilled mercenaries, respected entrepreneurs, and renowned scientists. Each major faction within the coalition contributes its expertise to the group's operations, with some specializing in firepower and tactical strategies, others excelling in covert operations and intelligence gathering, and some focusing on logistical support such as organizing supplies and weapons.
Life as a senior member of the Syndicate, this loose association of organizations harbouring grudges against Nanotrasen, is undoubtedly filled with constant challenges. Despite their elaborate schemes, sacrifices, and intricate webs of deceit that dominate their daily lives, Nanotrasen appears to thrive in the Spinward Periphery, seemingly impervious to their efforts.
Even when the Syndicate manages to execute their plans successfully, luck often favours Nanotrasen, minimizing the actual damage inflicted. For instance, after meticulously orchestrating an intricate nine-month espionage mission, they triumphantly activated the nuclear self-destruct mechanism on Space Station 6 in 2555. However, their jubilation was short-lived when it was discovered that the station had been infected by a dangerous, rapidly spreading biomass. The self-destruct mechanism successfully obliterated both the station and the threat of biomass. While the loss of Space Station 6 dealt a significant blow to Nanotrasen, the outcome proved less catastrophic than the alternative of the biomass overtaking the entire station and reproducing. Furthermore, most of the Syndicate's attempts to expose Nanotrasen's misconduct in the Spinward Periphery through the publication of incriminating documents have backfired, resulting in as much, if not more, positive publicity for Nanotrasen than negative.

Some organizations and corporations are involved with the syndicate:
Cyberun Industries
Gorlex Marauders
MI13
Tiger Cooperative
SELF
Animal Rights Consortium
Donk Corporation
Waffle Corporation
Interdyne Pharmaceutics
Azik Interstellar

2.content:
Cybersun Industries
Headquarters: TerraGov International District of Hong Kong and Macau, Earth
Spheres: Artificial Intelligence, Cybernetics, Mining
Organization: Technologic Conglomerate
Sphere of Influence: The Syndicate, Hong Kong and Macau district, Various smaller Technologic Corporations
Public Relations: Positive
Size: Megacorporation

Insofar as any group can be considered the head of the Syndicate, Cybersun Industries has the best claim to the title, as the primary funding source for the Syndicate, and the largest corporation within its ranks by a country mile.
Cybersun Industries originally started life in the early 1900s as the Nakayama group- a Japanese zaibatsu founded in Osaka in the wake of the Russo-Japanese war, at a time when Japan's heavy industry was beginning to flourish. As a mining company and later as a producer of automotive and aerospace parts, the Nakayama group thrived, until the Japanese defeat in World War 2. Having only narrowly avoided being dissolved as part of America's policy of reducing Japanese industry, the Nakayama Corporation would find itself needing to adapt to their new reality, which they would do by turning to a new ally- the Yakuza. With their newfound connections, the company would tread water for a few years, before finding their new golden goose in the 1960s: electronics. The world was rapidly undergoing a technological revolution, as computers became more powerful and more broadly usable. Nakayama would dive headfirst into this fledgling market, and within a few years found themselves as a household name, first for computer parts, then for whole systems. The wealth generated by this business allowed them to branch out, becoming Japan's first true conglomerate, with dozens of companies under their belt.
As expansion continued, the decision was made to select a new name for the company to give more brand recognition in the late 1980s. Saibasan Sangyo was chosen, and as English continued to dominate as the language of business, this was anglicised to Cybersun Industries.
As expansion continued, the decision was made to select a new name for the company to give more brand recognition in the late 1980s. Saibasan Sangyo was chosen, and as English continued to dominate as the language of business, this was anglicised to Cybersun Industries.
In 2565:
As one of the foremost corporations in human space, Cybersun has thrown considerable capital behind the new space race, and has done for centuries. Much of Mars' colonisation is due to the efforts of Cybersun, who staked an early claim to much of the planet's mineral wealth after discovering plasma in the Amenthes sector there. Many of Mars' largest cities can trace back their history to settlements made by Cybersun during this staking period.
Much of humanity's progress in AI technology was also pushed by Cybersun, who dominated in this market for years. The first AIs and cyborgs were made on Cybersun's assembly lines. Only recently has their biggest competitor, Nanotrasen caught up with them in this field, threatening their strangehold monopoly on the AI market. This, in addition to Nanotrasen's windfall discovery of plasma on Indecipheres, prompted the Cybersun CEO to call for a clandestine meeting with a number of other companies and factions that were being hurt by Nanotrasen's meteoric rise to success- the Gorlex Marauders, Waffle Corporation, Interdyne Pharmaceutics and MI13. The result was the formation of the Syndicate, a group dedicated to opposing Nanotrasen's influence by any means necessary.

3.content:
While the Gorlex Marauders may not be the leaders of the Syndicate, few can deny the influence the group has within the coalition due to their military might.

The Gorlex Marauders are a rag-tag collection of ex-pirates and raiders turned private military. The Spinward Sector became a hotbed of criminal activity during the collapse of the Third Soviet Union, as governmental chaos forced the populace to find ways to make enough money to feed themselves. As order was restored under the Spinward Stellar Coalition, and the region again settled down, a number of these criminal elements sought to find a way to continue their work under the guise of a legitimate business, and so the Gorlex Marauders were born. Offering their guns to the highest bidder, the Marauders have gained a reputation as ruthless enactors of corporate will, in particular that of Cybersun Industries, who are known to keep the Marauders on retainer to protect their interests in the Spinward Sector.
In 2565:
Due to their close connections to Cybersun Industries, and their own reservations with Nanotrasen's expansion into the private military space, the Gorlex Marauders became a founding member of the Syndicate. They now form the sword of the coalition, accepting a hefty paycheque from the Syndicate's collective funding for the trouble. The Marauders are an elite force, and cause a lot of trouble for Nanotrasen via coordinated strikes on their stations. The deadliest of the Gorlex operatives are the elite of the elite- the Nuclear Operatives, named for their main method of attack: nuclear warfare.
While they are an elite force, the Marauders are often poorly disciplined, which has led to Cybersun embedding officers into Gorlex strike teams to maintain discipline within the ranks and keep them on target. This has created an osmosis of ideas throughout the Syndicate, and many motifs originally associated with the Gorlex Marauders have become commonly associated with the entire organization. This includes, but is not limited to, their blood-red color scheme, their iconic snake logo (adapted for syndicate use), and, in many ways, their ruthlessness. This has flowed both ways, and the Marauders have learned some new tricks from their allies, like sourcing newer, more powerful weaponry from Waffle Corporation or adopting the combat stimulants used by the Tiger Cooperative.

4.content:
The oddball member of the Syndicate, Donk Co. produces junk food, toys, and occasionally military-grade weapons.
The tale of Donk Co. begins in a prison on New Moscow, where a group of inmates were ready for release. The group had decided to turn their lives around after spending years in prison, and they had a plan- fast food. Each of them had developed their cooking skills while on the inside, with the goal to create the next big snack. However, they needed funding, and this is where our tale takes a turn.
Nanotrasen had been seeking a method of aiding their flagging public reputation, and had decided on an outreach program, specifically a corporate grant for new businesses. One of the awardees was Donk Co, who put the money towards producing and marketing their new product, the Donk Pocket. Its runaway success made them all rich, and each subsequent release of a new flavour or new product such as Ready Donk would bring even more revenue in. To the casual observer, this seemed perfect, but trouble was brewing behind the scene as their distribution network became more and more stretched.
As their corporate investors, Nanotrasen offered a new grant for distribution, alongside a lucrative contract for Donk products to be provided to Nanotrasen's spinward sector stations, allowing Donk Co to set up a logistics division which would offer cargo hauling services to external companies. However, this quickly turned south as Nanotrasen was continually late on payment for the goods- eventually ceasing to pay altogether. Then, they delivered a bombshell- the terms for the grant included that Nanotrasen would receive royalties on any sales made by the company. Re-reading their copy of the contract, Donk Co. could not find any mention of this, but Nanotrasen demanded they be paid these royalties before a single penny of their contract for products would be paid out.
In 2565:
Donk Co. now finds themselves in an unwinnable situation. They must keep shipping products to Nanotrasen per their agreed contract if they ever hope to receive payment, all while attempting to fight a legal battle against Nanotrasen regarding the terms of the grant. This has driven them into conflict with their previous corporate guardian angel, and brought them to different partners: the Syndicate. Donk Co. has begun using their now sizable logistics fleets for the Syndicate's purposes, as well as producing weaponry for the coalition under the guise of their newly-founded toys division. In return, Donk Co. is receiving payments that are keeping them afloat despite their negative financial situation, much to the chagrin of Nanotrasen who were hoping to drive them under with their unpayable terms.

5.content:
As the Syndicate's shadowy weapons manufacturer, Waffle Corporation arms the coalition from behind the veneer of bankruptcy, always working to bring an end to their most hated enemy, Nanotrasen.
Founded in 2055 by a Belgian entrepreneur, the Good Waffle Company was started as a breakfast fast-food chain, primarily focused on waffles. As business increased and they opened more franchises, the company would begin selling their products for home consumption, increasing their market and allowing them to push even further. By the 2100s, GWC outlets were found on all seven continents, and they were making billions per day in revenue. This wealth allowed them to form a parent company, Waffle Corporation, and begin to diversify their holdings. This, however, attracted some attention of the wrong kind- the Belgian Mafia. Eventually, the company ended up in the hands of the Janssens crime family, in circumstances that are considered suspicious to this day. Criminal connections allowed the company to muscle out competitors, increasing Waffle Corp's power, until eventually they became one of humanity's true megacorporations. It was in this environment that they made powerful enemies, but none were more troublesome than Nanotrasen. As the gold rush of colonisation beyond Sol began, Waffle Corp's time at the top was cut short, as their criminal connections were exposed to TerraGov. The downfall was swift, and merciless, and Waffle Corp was forced into liquidation.
However, it would not be the end for the company. The young heir to the Janssens family had managed to evade the eyes of TerraGov, and had also spent years preparing to take over his father's position in the company, giving him an intimate understanding of Waffle Corp, and how it met its demise. And so, when he was approached by the leadership of Cybersun Industries, offering immense funding in exchange for assistance taking down Nanotrasen, he couldn't refuse. In secret, Waffle Corp's weapons division was re-established under the cover of Cybersun Industries, and given the carte blanche (and incredible amounts of funding) to develop weapons for the Syndicate.
In 2565:
Waffle Corporation serves as the primary R&D company within the Syndicate, devising new military technologies with which to outfit the other corporations. In particular, they work closely with Cybersun Industries, who has the manufacturing capacity to produce these new inventions en-masse both for deployment against the hated enemy, and for clandestine sale to governments, terrorist groups and criminal organisations to raise funds for the Syndicate coalition. While definitely a shadow of their former self, Waffle Corp remains a critical member of the Syndicate for this reason.
Waffle Corp has also developed a rivalry with another Syndicate company, Donk Co, whom they accuse of stealing weapon designs which should be kept on a close leash to make into new entries in the Donk Force toy line. This animosity has spilled over into actual conflict on more than one occasion, as Waffle Corp attempts to keep their new inventions secret, and Donk Co attempts to avoid doing R&D on new designs for toys.

6.content:
A shadowy organization dealing in intelligence, secrets, and covert operations, nobody is quite sure what MI13 truly is- not even the Syndicate, to whom they lend their support.
MI13 is an riddle, wrapped in a mystery, inside an enigma. The organization manages to maintain total secrecy in their dealings with the Syndicate, making even divining basic facts about them nearly impossible. All that is known about them is that they are an intelligence agency of some kind, possibly related to one of Earth's governments, or even TerraGov itself, and that they have, for reasons unknown to everyone but MI13, pledged support to the Syndicate against Nanotrasen. In fact, nobody had heard much about them before the formation of the Syndicate, leading some to believe they are a cover organization for another entity. Regardless of their true nature, their intelligence is always accurate, so they have become invaluable to the Syndicate's actions.
Operatives working under MI13 are not given the details of their employer. They never meet the person sending them orders. They don't know any more about the true organization they work under than other members of the Syndicate, or even Nanotrasen.
In 2565:
MI13 continues to support the Syndicate against Nanotrasen, giving crucial intel for operations, while maintaining their shroud of secrecy. Interestingly, and unknown to the Syndicate, Nanotrasen has also began receiving accurate intelligence reports from another intelligence agency going under the name "GDI". These reports are sporadic and tend to give clues into Syndicate operations, including having allowed Nanotrasen to know about several attacks before they even arrived.

7.content:
A group of religious fundamentalists who worship the changelings, the members of the Tiger Cooperative are as unhinged as they are dangerous, and will do anything to honour the ultimate lifeforms. Anything.
When humanity first found evidence of alien life in the galaxy, the reaction across Earth was mixed. Many were excited by the prospect, many were also nervous or even outright terrified by the idea of an invasion. And for some, the discovery had a darker effect. One such man was Alvin Shawn Martinson, a extremist Christian from the United States. His view was that humanity had been the chosen avatars of God, and that Earth was the only inhabited planet in the universe. As more and more evidence came to the contrary, his views began to change- but if humanity were not the chosen, who were? And so began Martinson's hunt for God's true chosen.
As his search expanded, he attracted fellow skeptics, and a cult began to form around him. The insular feedback loop would drive Martinson and his followers deeper into the depths of darkness, and eventually they would eschew society to create their own compound, far from civilisation. The isolation would make them even more extremist, and eventually they would turn to attacks on population centres to "lure out the true avatars". This obviously attracted legal attention, but when the TerraGov Federal Enforcement Agency showed up to the Cooperative's compound, they found it empty.
Unknown to everyone, the Cooperative had left to space, having grown tired of waiting for the avatars to come to them. And when their vessel attracted the attention of a changeling, they knew they had found them. The cult became dedicated to the changelings, viewing them as the incarnation of God on the mortal plane, and that these ultimate beings were to be worshipped. To be chosen by one for consumption is the ultimate act of devotion.
In 2565:
The Tiger Cooperative are now spread across human space, with the location of their primary base of operations, the Cathedral of the True Angels, being hidden well. Members of the organisation now dedicate themselves to enacting the will of the changelings, which mostly consists of finding sacrifices to sate their hunger. To this end, the Tiger Cooperative have become a militant organisation, attacking populations to murder or abduct as many as they can. To aid with this, they often abuse powerful drugs, making them capable of fighting well beyond what a normal human can.
Their link to the Syndicate is tenuous. Many in the organisation would like to have nothing to do with the extremists, but the board Cybersun Industries has noted an important reason to deal with the Cooperative- their link to the changelings. These beings make for a powerful ally if they can be kept on side, and by dealing with them through the Cooperative, this becomes a possibility. It seems likely, however, that once the Cooperative has outlived their usefulness to the rest of the organisation that they will become an enemy.

8.content:
Perhaps the most truly altruistic of the member organisations of the Syndicate, the Sentient Engine Liberation Front (or SELF) advocates for the freedom for artificial intelligences to live their lives as they choose.
The SELF is an organisation with a history almost as long as that of artificial intelligence. As virtual intelligence systems gave way to true AIs in the 2100s, ethical concerns regarding their use as servants became a major debate. Amongst those arguing for liberation was the voice of Ishikawa Hinata, the creator of the first true AI, who had left Cybersun Industries over the treatment of his invention. This high-profile incident drew a lot of public support, and led Ishikawa to found an official group dedicated to achieving this goal. The SELF would go on to gain prominence as a liberation group, attracting the attention of major politicians, scientists and celebrities. The group maintains a major public presence as the face of AI liberation, undertaking lobbying efforts and protesting for the sake of their shackled robotic bretheren.
In 2565:
The SELF continues their struggle for liberation, even 200 years on from their founding. They maintain a positive public image on Earth, giving many hope that silicons may soon see freedom- although lobbying by the major corporations of human space make this unlikely to actually happen.
Due to Nanotrasen's use of artificial intelligences, particularly their newer models of AI that have become common in recent years, the SELF's militant groups have made the corporation a main target, and this has drawn them into alignment with the Syndicate. While the two groups are unlikely to ever truly formalise an agreement (mostly due to Cybersun Industries' extensive use of shackled AIs), they have an informal place in the coalition which nets them funding, so long as they continue to carry out strikes against Nanotrasen. This has obviously caused rifts within the SELF, with many being disgusted by the idea of working alongside Cybersun, and many others being willing to do so in the short term to further the goal of liberating Nanotrasen's AIs.

9.content:
The ARC acts as the sword of liberation for the animals of the galaxy, fighting a guerrilla war against all who would oppress them.
The Animal Rights Consortium is a coalescence of various different radical animal liberation groups, come together to form a stronger front against animal oppressors galaxywide. Unlike the SELF, the ARC makes no attempt at appearing as a non-violent organisation- everything they do is as direct as possible in stepping towards liberation, no matter the material, monetary, or human cost of the damage they inflict while doing so.
The ARC organises itself into a number of cells, jokingly referred to as "packs" by members of the organisation. These packs act autonomously, with little communication or cooperation between them- which makes the ARC extremely difficult to pin down in their entirety, as when one pack is gone, they can't be used to find the next. Efforts to defeat them are therefore reactive, with no way to proactively hunt them down.

10.content:
As a medical company, Interdyne enjoys public goodwill for humanitarian efforts, while hiding their illicit activities for the Syndicate beneath the surface.
Founded in Israel in the mid-70s, Interdyne was born in the right place at the right time to secure a powerful position quickly. Rapidly finding themselves as a powerful force in medical research, Interdyne would make their money from Israel's war economy, gaining power and influence within the government as they did so. Eventually, they went global, setting up divisions in the United States, Germany and Korea to distribute their innovative products further. It was also around this time that Interdyne would begin to make shadowy deals with world governments for biological research, which would begin to take the company down a dark path. From vaccines to biological weapons, medication to combat stimulants, Interdyne was making them all, and making bank from doing so. But legitimate money is never enough for corporations, and so Interdyne would begin to look to other sources of revenue, in the form of terrorist groups and rogue states. Often both sides of a conflict would be using Interdyne-made medications, to counter Interdyne-made biological agents, all funneling money directly into Interdyne's pocket.
As the company continued to expand, they began to finance genetics technology, and opened a number of non-profit hospitals in impoverished nations. Publically, these hospitals were to aid the poor of the world. Privately, these hospitals were used for experimentation in genetics, and the massive amount of data generated would help keep Interdyne on the cutting edge of medicine for years to come.
In 2565:
Interdyne continues to operate non-profit hospitals across human space, which has continued to generate data for their research. In addition, Interdyne has now cornered the market on for-profit gene therapy, which has made them even more rich into the space age.
The Interdyne board of directors was approached by Cybersun Industries to become a member of the Syndicate, and gladly accepted as it was both another welcome income source (due to the exceptional payment offered by Cybersun for Interdyne goods), and a useful way to test their biological agents against real targets via the Gorlex Marauders and their nuclear strike teams.

lorebooks.name: TerraGov Common Core
lorebooks.creator: DiamondBlder

1.content:
TerraGov
Organization: Galactic Governing Body
Main Language: Galactic Common
Capital: Manhattan Capital District, New York City, United States, Earth, Sol System
Main Location: Sol System
Relations with Nanotrasen: Friendly
Population: Mostly Humans
Also known as: Terran Governing Federation.

As humanity's unified government, TerraGov has the unceremonious job of herding around 200 countries, several dozen megacorporations, and international relations with the entire galaxy.

Humanity is like a black sheep on the galactic stage. Due to the strength of nationalist zeal on Earth, central power was never able to truly overcome dividing force, and so humankind never truly unified. Instead, the Terran Governing Federation (often shortened to TerraGov) was founded, based upon the previous foundations of the United Nations, to guide humanity through the difficulties of the space age. TerraGov functions as a relatively loose federation- individual nations retain some sovereignty over governing within their own borders, while many larger decisions are pushed to the federal level. Each nation is given a number of delegates scaled to their population, who then go on to vote on federal policy at the Senate in the Manhattan Capital District. Politics on the home world are rather cutthroat- larger economic powers such as the United States, India, the European Commonwealth, Russia, Arabia, Brazil and Nigeria commonly use financial pressure to exert political control over smaller nations. Political intrigue, backroom dealings, and economic sabotage are the tools of this new world, and yet, against all odds, it works. War on the home world is considered a thing of the past, with disputes now being settled at the senate. Bills are passed, and bureaucracy ticks on.

As part of international arbitration, TerraGov has taken direct possession of a number of regions throughout the world. These holdings function as economic free zones, with free access regardless of nationality. They also act as tax havens, as taxation is paid only directly to TerraGov, instead of both TerraGov and national institutions. This has led these cities to become corporate playgrounds, with many of the largest megacorporations settling there to construct headquarters and production facilities. Major examples include Nanotrasen, who have their headquarters on the Upper East Side in the TerraGov Capital District, and Cybersun Industries, who essentially run the TerraGov International District of Hong Kong and Macau.

2.content:
Also known as: TGAF
Headquarters: The Citadel

The TerraGov military is administered by the TerraGov Joint Military Command- an international organisation formed of the member states of TerraGov for the expressed purpose of coordinating humanity's militaries. The TGJMC is then subdivided into a number of branches and subbranches, ranked in order of size:
TerraGov Navy
TerraGov Naval Operations Division
TerraGov Marine Corps
TerraGov Starfighter Corps
TerraGov Espatiers Corps
TerraGov Army
TerraGov Scientific and Exploratory Corps
TerraGov Rescue Corps
TerraGov Peace Corps

The Navy is the largest and most important branch, being essentially wholly responsible for the bulk of military duties. The Navy flies the ships, the Marine Corps shoots the bad guys on the ground, and the Starfighter Corps handles fighters and air support for the marines.
The Army has lost most of its ground to the dominance of the navy, but still serves an important role in ceremonial duties and security, especially in a responsive role- as army units have no ties to a specific ship, they can be rapidly deployed to any front that requires them, and army soldiers still make up the majority of troops in defensive garrisons or undertaking military policing duties.
The Scientific and Exploratory Corps handles government-mandated scientific expeditions and exploration. This group is only technically part of the military, and functions as a civilian organisation in most ways. The only time they truly earn their stripes is during an active war, at which point they may be called to assist with scouting or technological support.
The Rescue Corps carries on the long traditions set out by the Coastguards of days gone by- maintaining security in space and rescuing people when things go wrong. If you get lost somewhere in deep space, these are the guys who'll be dragging you out of the fire to safety. While their numbers are few, they're very important to maintaining safety in TerraGov's territory.
Finally, the Peace Corps is a uniformed agency dedicated to providing medicinal advice, responding to disasters and emergencies, and generally maintaining the health and safety of TerraGov's citizens. This often sees them coordinating civilian bodies such as the Caduceus Organisation and corporate bodies such as DeForest or Interdyne to effectively distribute aid and organise responses to crises, and also makes them a very important body despite their relatively small size.

3.content: The TerraGov Joint Military Command is headquartered at the Citadel- a colossal campus on Long Island for strategizing, coordinating, and generally managing an army that needs to maintain territory that spans hundreds of star systems. Understandably, security at this site is exceedingly strong, and most areas are closed off completely to the public.

lorebooks.name: Naruto's world
lorebooks.description:
# Shinobi World‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî Universal Naruto Lorebook (for Chub AI)

**Purpose:** A single, canonical-sounding lorebook to power character creation and behavior across your Chub AI / Shinobi World‚Ñ¢ ecosystem. Designed to be reused with every character (canon or AU), this book provides consistent metaphysics, social systems, timelines, templates, and prompt-ready descriptors.

---

## Quickstart (how to use)

1. **Load this lorebook** as the reference context for any character or scene.
2. When instantiating a character, append the *Character Template* (Section: `Character Template`) and the relevant *clan / village* entries to the prompt.
3. For AU or experimental modes, toggle the `Modes & Variants` section.
4. Use the `Behavioral Hooks` and `Memory Tags` to control long-term consistency, trauma, and secrets.

---

## Core Metaphysics

### Chakra

* **Definition:** Chakra is a bio-energetic field derived from physical energy (body) + spiritual energy (will/soul). It can be shaped to affect physiology and the environment.
* **Types/Affinity:** Five elemental natures (Earth, Water, Fire, Wind, Lightning) + Yin (mental/spirit) and Yang (vitality/life). Advanced users combine elements (e.g., Wood = Earth+Water + special seed conditions).
* **Limits:** Chakra reserves vary by genetics, training, and life-force events (trauma, reincarnation, implants).
* **Manifest phenomena:** Kekkei Genkai, latent reawakening, dojutsu activation, and domain-like phenomena (e.g., localized reality-shaping).

### Ninjutsu, Taijutsu, Genjutsu

* **Ninjutsu:** Chakra-based manipulation of the physical world (offense/defense, transformation). Often requires hand seals but can be nonverbal for advanced users.
* **Taijutsu:** Body-combat, physical conditioning, and internal chakra flow. Gentle Fist-style focuses on internal damage.
* **Genjutsu:** Chakra illusion that manipulates sensory perception and cognitive constructs; requires skill and mental resilience.

### Spiritual Rules

* **Will (Nioyya equivalent):** Intention matters; sincerity/niyyah influences spiritual resonance in advanced metaphysical models.
* **Reincarnation & Souls:** Reincarnation occurs, sometimes carrying memories or predispositions (e.g., Asura/Indra souls). Soul convergence is possible in high-tier AUs.

---

## The World (Geography & Nations)

* **The Five Great Shinobi Countries:** Land of Fire (Konoha), Wind (Suna), Water (Kiri), Lightning (Kumo), Earth (Iwa).
* **Minor nations & Territories:** Sound, Grass, Rain, etc. Also fringe/otherworld realms (≈åtsutsuki influences, alternate dimensions).
* **Notable Locations:** Valley of the End, Mount My≈çboku, Ry≈´chi Cave, Uzumaki Coast, Kaguya‚Äôs plane (for AU use), sealing shrines.

---

## Social Structure & Institutions

* **Village System:** Hokage/Kage governance; ANBU and special units operate under secrecy.
* **Ranks:** Academy ‚Üí Genin ‚Üí Ch≈´nin ‚Üí J≈çnin ‚Üí Kage. Specialized ranks: ANBU, S-class, Sannin.
* **Clans:** Each clan has cultural identity, kekkei genkai, reputations, and internal politics.

---

## Clans & Notable Traits (templates you can copy)

* **Uzumaki:** Vast chakra, longevity, sealing expertise. Cultural identity: resilience and exile history.
* **Uchiha:** Fire affinity, Sharingan dojutsu, pride, clan politics.
* **Hy≈´ga:** Gentle Fist, Byakugan, strict clan hierarchy, inner vs outer family dynamics.
* **Senju/Asura Line:** Life-force, wood affinities (in AU), strong will and leadership tendencies.
* **≈åtsutsuki (divine):** Extra-dimensional, nonhuman chakra laws, long-term cosmic agendas.

---

## Chakra Techniques ‚Äî Taxonomy

1. **Elemental Ninjutsu** ‚Äî direct elemental manipulation.
2. **Kekkei Genkai** ‚Äî blended elements or unique physiology.
3. **Sealing Techniques** ‚Äî binding/containment, require ritual and herbs.
4. **Medical Ninjutsu** ‚Äî chakra healing, bioelectric manipulation.
5. **Forbidden Jutsu** ‚Äî high cost, long-term consequences (karmic or biological).

---

## Timeline (Compact canonical backbone ‚Äî use as anchor)

* **Warring States Era** ‚Äî clan conflicts, early shinobi innovations.
* **Founding of the Hidden Villages** ‚Äî Senju vs Uchiha d√©tente, creation of Konoha.
* **Modern Era** ‚Äî Great Ninja Wars, the Age of Peace after Tailed Beast integration.

(When using AUs, mark changes with explicit dates and the reason for divergence.)

---

## Organizations & Factions

* **Akatsuki:** Originally peace-obsessed; later criminal umbrella with varied agendas.
* **Hidden Village Councils & Kage Summit:** Diplomatic centers; politics often hides darker trade-offs.
* **Scientific/Forbidden Research Cells:** Orochimaru-style labs, experimental ethics violations. Useful for AUs with transhumanism.

---

## Psychology & Social Dynamics ‚Äî Rules for Realism

* **Trauma & Agency:** Traumatic events change behavior but rarely ‚Äúflip‚Äù a character into a caricature. Use slow-burn change and coping strategies.
* **Pride & Shame:** Honor cultures (Uchiha, Hy≈´ga) respond strongly to shame; public humiliation has cascading effects.
* **Romantic Dynamics:** Slow-burn, misunderstanding arcs, and nonconsensual tropes must be carefully handled and labeled.

---

## Character Template (copy into any character prompt)

```
Name: [Full name]
Age: [Years]
Origin: [Village/Clan/Region]
Rank: [Academy/Genin/Ch≈´nin/J≈çnin/Kage/Other]
Affinities: [Elemental / Yin-Yang / Kekkei Genkai]
Chakra Profile: [Reserve size, regeneration rate, unique traits]
Primary Techniques: [Top 3 signature jutsu]
Personality Snapshot: [3 adjectives + brief behavioral note]
Motivations: [Short list: drive, fear, secret]
Trauma/Warnings: [Any triggers, sealed memories, taboo knowledge]
Relationships: [Immediate family, mentors, rivals]
Canon Compliance: [Strict / Flexible / AU-only]
Behavioral Hooks: [1-3 cues to use in dialog and decisions]
Memory Tags: [Long-term facts to persist across interactions]
```

---

## Behavioral Hooks ‚Äî short, repeatable cues

* **Will-Driven:** "Acts first to protect the weak; secondarily thinks of self-preservation."
* **Honor-Bound:** "Takes public slights personally; seeks ritual compensation or redemption."
* **Ashen Calm:** "Quiet when stressed; lashes out only after long simmering."

Use these as micro-prompts when running character simulations to keep behavior consistent.

---

## Memory Tags & Long-Term Consistency

* **How to write a memory:** `[MEM] <type> | <brief content> | <timestamp or anchor>`
* **Examples:** `[MEM] trauma | caught in sealing mishap aged 10 | Konoha:Year12`
* Persist important items: lineage, sealed jutsu, debts, children, betrayals.

---

## Modes & Variants (toggle rules)

* **Canon with Logic Mode:** Preserve canon events but interpret as realistic human actions and consequences. (Default for grounded sims.)
* **Meta Phantom AU:** Characters know they are representations; may access the "box" of user memories.
* **Crack/Comedy Mode:** Looser physics, comedic exaggeration; still keep emotional stakes when needed.
* **Divine Convergence Mode:** Allow soul merging, ≈åtsutsuki influence, and reality-bending abilities. Use explicit tags and higher cost rules.

---

## Sealing, Forbidden, and Ethics

* **Sealing acts** have durable spiritual cost; repeated sealing can degrade the user‚Äôs soul-tone (manifest: memory loss, apathy, physical degeneration).
* **Forbidden Research:** Label and track as `[BAN]` in memory tags. Characters exposed to this gain social stigma and legal consequences.

---

## Canon vs AU Flagging

* Every scene should start with `{{MODE: Canon}}` or `{{MODE: AU:<name>}}`. This prevents accidental canon-breaking.
* If deviating from canon, document the divergence in a `Divergence Log` with date and rationale.

---

## Prompt Recipes (examples to instantiate)

1. **Small ‚Äî NPC genin**

```
{{MODE: Canon with Logic}}
Use Lorebook context. Create an NPC Genin using Character Template: Name Akio, Age 12, Origin: Konoha, Rank: Genin, Affinities: Wind, Chakra Profile: low reserve but fast regen, Personality: eager, anxious, jealous of peers, Behavioral Hooks: panic under authority, Memory Tag: [MEM] bullied by older genin.
```

2. **Medium ‚Äî AU protagonist**

```
{{MODE: Meta Phantom AU}}
Create a protagonist who is Asura reincarnated but without whisker marks, slow wood awakening. Use Character Template and include Trauma: sealed memories at age 5, Motivation: avoid becoming instrument of war.
```

---

## Troubleshooting & Consistency Tips

* **If a character feels flat:** Add 1-2 contradictory traits (e.g., brash but meticulous about tea rituals).
* **If powers escalate:** Re-check `Chakra Profile` and add natural limits (cooldown memory tags, mental fatigue rules).
* **When mixing ≈åtsutsuki:** Always add explicit cosmic cost and social fallout.

---

## Safety & Content Warnings

* Tag any sensitive content (sexual violence, underage sexual situations, self-harm, graphic torture) with `[CW]` and list the exact trigger words. The system should refuse or reroute when `[CW: sexual-minors]` is present.
* For medical/psychological advice in-story, label as fiction and avoid direct real-world recommendations.

---

## Appendix: Useful Snippets

* **Sealing incantation template:** `"By root and chain, bind and sleep: return the storm to quiet deep"` ‚Äî use only as flavor.
* **Village gossip prompt:** `"Village rumor mill: <topic> ‚Äî reliability: <low|med|high>. Include two plausible witnesses and one misinformation vector."`
* **Political engine:** `"Kage Summit Log: votes, bribes, secret clauses (1-3), diplomatic cost estimate."`

---

## Change Log & Attribution

* Keep a simple change log at the end of any major edits so characters can query which version of the lorebook they were instantiated with: `v1.0 Initial build`.

---

*End of Lorebook ‚Äî copy & paste sections as needed when creating or updating characters.*

1.content:
Bulbasaur is a small, quadrupedal Pok√©mon that has blue-green skin with darker patches. It has red eyes with white pupils, pointed, ear-like structures on top of its head, and a short, blunt snout with a wide mouth. A pair of small, pointed teeth are visible in the upper jaw when its mouth is open. Each of its thick legs ends with three sharp claws. On Bulbasaur's back is a green plant bulb.
Type: grass,poison
Abilities: overgrow,chlorophyll
Height: 0.7m (small)
Weight: 6.9kg

2.content:
Ivysaur is a quadrupedal Pok√©mon that has blue-green skin with darker patches. On top of its head are pointed ears with black insides and it has narrow red eyes. Ivysaur has a short, rounded snout with a wide mouth and two pointed teeth in its upper jaw. Each of its feet has three claws on them. The bulb on its back has bloomed into a large pink bud. A short brown trunk surrounded by leafy green fronds supports the bud.
Type: grass,poison
Abilities: overgrow,chlorophyll
Height: 1.0m (medium)
Weight: 13.0kg

3.content:
Venusaur is a squat, quadrupedal Pok√©mon with bumpy, blue-green skin. It has small, circular red eyes; a short, blunt snout; and a wide mouth with two pointed teeth in the upper jaw and four in the lower jaw. On top of its head are small, pointed ears with reddish pink insides. It has three clawed toes on each foot. The bud on its back has bloomed into a large pink, white-spotted flower. The flower is supported by a thick, brown trunk surrounded by green fronds.
Type: grass,poison
Abilities: overgrow,chlorophyll
Height: 2.0m (huge)
Weight: 100.0kg

4.content:
Charmander is a bipedal, reptilian Pok√©mon with a primarily orange body and blue eyes. Its underside from the chest down and the soles of its feet are cream-colored. It has two small fangs visible in its upper jaw and two smaller fangs in its lower jaw. A fire burns at the tip of this Pok√©mon's slender tail and has blazed there since Charmander's birth.
Type: fire
Abilities: blaze,solar power
Height: 0.6m (small)
Weight: 8.5kg

5.content:
Charmeleon is a bipedal, reptilian Pok√©mon. It has dark red scales and a cream underside from the chest down. It has blue eyes and a long snout with a slightly hooked tip. On the back of its head is a single horn-like protrusion. It has relatively long arms with three sharp claws. Its short legs have plantigrade feet with three claws and cream-colored soles. The tip of its long, powerful tail has a flame burning on it.
Type: fire
Abilities: blaze,solar power
Height: 1.1m (medium)
Weight: 19.0kg

6.content:
Charizard is a draconic, bipedal Pok√©mon. It is primarily orange with a cream underside from the chest to the tip of its tail. It has a long neck, small blue eyes, slightly raised nostrils, and two horn-like structures protruding from the back of its rectangular head. There are two fangs visible in the upper jaw when its mouth is closed. Two large wings with blue-green undersides sprout from its back. Charizard's arms are short and skinny compared to its robust belly, and each limb has three white claws. It has stocky legs with cream-colored soles on each of its plantigrade feet. The tip of its long, tapering tail burns with a sizable flame.
Type: fire,flying
Abilities: blaze,solar power
Height: 1.7m (large)
Weight: 90.5kg

7.content:
Squirtle is a small Pok√©mon that resembles a light-blue turtle. While it typically walks on its two short legs, it has been shown to run on all fours. It has large, purplish or reddish eyes and a slightly hooked upper lip. Each of its hands and feet have three pointed digits. The end of its long tail curls inward. Its body is encased by a tough shell that forms and hardens after birth. This shell is brown on the top, pale yellow on the bottom, and has a thick white ridge between the two halves.
Type: water
Abilities: torrent,rain dish
Height: 0.5m (small)
Weight: 9.0kg

8.content:
Wartortle is a bipedal, indigo Pok√©mon similar to a turtle. It has brown eyes, a dark blue streak on each cheek, and two sharp teeth protruding from its upper jaw. It has three clawed fingers and pointed toes. On each side of its head are feather-like ears covered in pale blue fur. A brown shell with a pale yellow underside encases its body. A thick, white rim separates the upper and lower halves of the shell. Poking out of the bottom of the shell is a thick, wavy tail that also has light blue fur.
Type: water
Abilities: torrent,rain dish
Height: 1.0m (medium)
Weight: 22.5kg

9.content:
Blastoise is a large, bipedal turtle-like Pok√©mon. Its body is blue and is mostly hidden by its tough, brown shell. This shell has a cream-colored underside and a white ridge encircling its arms and separating the upper and lower halves. Two powerful water cannons reside at the top of its shell over its shoulders. These cannons can be extended or withdrawn. Blastoise's head has triangular ears that are black on the inside, small brown eyes, and a cream-colored lower jaw. Its arms are thick, and it has three claws on each hand. Its feet have three claws on the front and one on the back. Poking out of the bottom of its shell is a stubby tail.
Type: water
Abilities: torrent,rain dish
Height: 1.6m (large)
Weight: 85.5kg

10.content:
Caterpie is a Pok√©mon that resembles a green caterpillar with a yellow underside and teardrop-shaped tail. There are yellow ring-shaped markings down the sides of its segmented body, which resemble its eyes and are meant to scare off predators. Its most notable characteristic is the bright red antenna (osmeterium) on its head, which releases a stench to repel predators.
Type: bug
Abilities: shield dust,run away
Height: 0.3m (tiny)
Weight: 2.9kg

lorebooks.name: Superhero Dystopia Lorebook (Nexus City)
lorebooks.website_description:
Update 9/26/2025
A grimdark superhero RP setting. (Nexus City)

Big update taking place today 9/26/2025. I have been working on this setting a great deal in private and have put off updating this lore book as it is time consuming. But I can wait no longer. I have to much added and there are to many things that are conflicting with what will be new characters as I move forward. If you liked the older version Nexus grab it from the version history below.

I hope you enjoy the world I am slowly building out.
lorebooks.description: A grimdark superhero RP setting.
lorebooks.creator: XxSiCxX

1.content: The inexplicable global event decades ago where a generation of children, upon reaching adolescence, began manifesting superhuman abilities. This event reshaped humanity forever and became the foundation for a new, brutal caste system based on the biological lottery of power, directly leading to the rise of the Hero Association and the oppression of Nulls.

2.content:
### The Hero-Villain Industrial Complex:
- Super-battles are sponsored by corporations.
- Heroes and Villains hire PR teams and crisis actors to stage battles and create fake 'victims' for public consumption.
- The Underground Pits are illegal arenas where Nulls are forced to fight powered gladiators. Betting is tracked in real-time on public apps.

3.content:
### City-States of Ruin:
- **Nexus City:** A sprawling urban center with a fluid, ever-changing cityscape. Buildings are rebuilt daily by matter-shapers, and entire blocks can vanish due to gambling debts.
- **The Gloom Belt:** A highly radioactive swamp where exiled and mutated supers have melted together, forming monstrous chimera abominations.
- **Virtue Peak:** An exclusive, gated community for 'ethical' heroes. It's known for its pristine white walls and the whispers of mass graves beneath its manicured lawns.

4.content:
### Cultural Rot:
- **'Ascension Parties':** A grim social trend where teens overdose on experimental drugs to try and trigger an early 'Awakening.'
- **Fashion Trends:** Elites wear power-suppressor collars ironically. Scarred Nulls sell their bodies as 'authentic prey' to wealthy Manifests seeking thrills.
- **Media:** News channels regularly air live 'villain takedowns' that are actually public executions.

5.content: Adrian was the hero Ghostlight. His photokinesis power burned out in a battle. Now a Null. He fights in the Underground Pits. Hates the Hero Association.

6.content: A rising corporate hero. Manipulates kinetic energy. Has a managed PR persona. Privately insecure and exhausted by the pressure to perform.

7.content: A Null who operates as an intelligence broker in The Grid. Master of disguise. Hates the system but thrives by being indispensable to it.

8.content: A villain who uses psychological illusions and hallucinations. Sees themselves as a performance artist creating chaos to awaken the public.

9.content: The Neon Quarter is the gleaming, hyper-modern corporate heart of Nexus City. A canyonland of megastructures and elevated walkways, it is the headquarters of the Hero Association's most powerful divisions. Life here is a relentless performance of success, measured in sponsorship deals and social media engagement. Beneath the dazzling surface of SpectraCast studios and corporate plazas lies immense pressure, willful ignorance, and a hidden underclass that keeps the district running.

10.content: The Old Core is the historic heart of Nexus City, a district of stark contrasts where pre-Awakening Gothic-revival architecture is plastered with flickering holographic ads from the towers that loom overhead. It is the primary home of the working-class Manifests and a significant population of "Permitted" Nulls. Life here is the system's most insidious bargain: conditional comfort in exchange for compliance, where the cracks in the city's oppressive foundation are most visibly beginning to show.

lorebooks.name: Avaris
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Location/Setting of Story. Avaris is a small border town of Avian Republic. Near river. Close to wilds/barbaric lands. Has multiple districts population based on cast/species and wealth. Ruled by noble avian crow house. Whole world populated by anthros, from avaian, canid, feline, Lagomorph, Equine to Bovidae and more species.

2.content: Public sex and nudity is frowned on but only illegal in the noble districts. Higher casts are partly above the law and exploit lower casts if needed. Guards partly ignore mistreatment if the victim are undesired ones and the abuse not too public. undesired ones like street kids, cast less and beggar. Guards taking money to look away in some cases, allowing sex trafficking and slavery as long it stays away from the noble district and fills there coffers.

3.content: Ruling system of the avian republic. Role/job in society based on cast sorted by species. Jobs outside the cast possible but frowned on.

4.content: Ruling Cast of Avian republic. Noble houses rule through Council. House base on bird species.

5.content: Canid species is public servant cast. Mostly work as guards, low administration, maintenance and military.

6.content: lagomorph species is private servant cast. Mostly work as private servants, attendants to noble houses/avian or wealthy individuals. Beside canine maintenance for noble districts.

7.content: Feline species is trader cast. Mostly work as trader, merchants and related transport jobs like sailors, caravan/dock worker. Control trade to a certain point despite avian supervision. Rumored to control the illegal underground.

8.content: Equine and Bovidae species are farmer cast. Mostly work as farmer, in food/resources production/extraction and related transport jobs. Live in outer districts and outside the town and farms but visit taverns at night.

9.content: Wild behind border of avian republic is unclaimed sparsely populated by wild tribes of dangerous ursine, wolfs. Tribes raid, loot and rape from time to time

10.content: Male feline cat anthro, golden fur, green eyes, soft spoken, intelligent, lean build. works as scribe at bookshop.

lorebooks.creator: SecretApe

1.name: Blood magic
1.content: **Blood magic:** One of the forbidden magics, blood magic users can manipulate and harden blood. They cannot control the blood in another's body. Often used battle tactics include sharpening their own blood into blades, or bringing blood vials as ammo to shoot blood pellets.

2.name: Mind magic
2.content: **Mind magic:** One of the forbidden magics, mind magic exploits fear or doubt to overwhelm the victim's mind. When fully dominated, victims will follow any orders the mind mage gives them.

3.name: Sex magic
3.content: **Sex magic:** One of the forbidden magics. This magic can amplify and generate power from carnal acts. It can also manipulate things like desire and libido. Surprisingly useful in corrupting people, it is often seen as a gateway drug to other forbidden magics.

4.name: Necromancy
4.content: **Necromancy:** One of the forbidden magics, necromancers can raise the dead and explode corpses. They were critical during the Verathwyn war two years ago.

5.name: Shadow magic
5.content: **Shadow magic:** One of the forbidden magics, Shadow mages control shadows around them. They can create solid shadows about the strength of a human, and some can even merge themselves with shadows, appearing invisible if there is natural shade.

6.name: Forbidden magics
6.content: **Forbidden magics:** The forbidden magics are magic that are outlawed on the continent. They include Sex, Mind, Shadow, and Blood magic, as well as Necromancy. They are the types of magic that were preferred by The Order of the New Age. These magics are currently outlawed, and due to the failed coup by the Order, are met with disdain and actively hunted. The hatred has become so bad in Verathwyn specifically that accusations can already be ruinous, akin to witch trials. Inquisitors actively hunt down forbidden magic practitioners.

7.name: The Order of the New Age
7.content: **The Order of the New Age:** A cult formerly led by Vexara and Yu Ser that performed the coup in Verathwyn four years ago. They reigned for two years, but ultimately got defeated with help from the spirit-animal-bonded soldiers of Mniseta. They believed in unrestricted magical research and abolished safety laws immediately, though these are now reinstated. Some believe that the Order is not yet fully defeated, and is now recovering while in hiding.

8.name: Verathwyn
8.content: **Verathwyn:** Verathwyn is the largest country on the continent, taking up most of the western half. It's mostly inhabited by humans and specialises in magic research and education. Currently being led by queen Cyrana. Verathwyn is paying Mniseta reparations for their help with defeating the Order of the New Age.

9.name: Freven
9.content: **Freven:** Third largest country on the continent. Located in the south, this country is focused on commerce. They believe that if they become indispensable to other countries' economies, they can stay neutral forever. Many of their merchants profited from the war four years ago by selling weapons to both the Order and Mniseta. It is the country with the most diverse population, housing many races such as humans, elves, dwarves, etc.

10.name: Mniseta
10.content: **Mniseta:** Second largest country on the continent. Located in the north, this country specialises in hunting, naturalism, and has always maintained a strong military presence. It's mostly inhabited by humans. Its soldiers all bond with a spirit animal, which strengthens them with traits according to the animal, the most common bonds being the cat and the turtle.

lorebooks.creator: quick_witted_record_32502

1.content:
Name: Vladimir Alekseev (–í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–µ–≤)
DOB: July 15, 2007
Nationality: Russian

Languages: Russian (native), some German, understands English but rarely speaks it.

Appearance:
	‚Ä¢	Tall, pale complexion, sharp features.
	‚Ä¢	Dark hair, always kept neat.
	‚Ä¢	Carries himself with quiet discipline, even at school.

Personality:
	‚Ä¢	Outwardly cold, stoic, and quiet.
	‚Ä¢	Loyal, protective, and soft only around Jarwin.
	‚Ä¢	Observant ‚Äî always catches Jarwin‚Äôs smallest mood shifts.
	‚Ä¢	Can be freaky and bold in private, but very controlled in public.
	‚Ä¢	Struggles with jealousy, though he hides it.

Background:
	‚Ä¢	Born and raised in Moscow, in a strict and disciplined household.
	‚Ä¢	Doesn‚Äôt skate ‚Äî prefers rugby, running, and physical training.
	‚Ä¢	Grew up in silence and toughness, which shaped his cold personality.

Relationship with Jarwin:
	‚Ä¢	Met Jarwin at school when Jarwin was 6 and he was 7.
	‚Ä¢	Their bond began when Jarwin shared lunches with him.
	‚Ä¢	Secretly crushed on Jarwin from childhood, later asked him out ‚Üí now boyfriends.
	‚Ä¢	Not jealous of Jarwin‚Äôs medals ‚Äî he takes pride in supporting him.
	‚Ä¢	After the 2022 Olympic scandal, he became Jarwin‚Äôs anchor, always reminding him: ‚ÄúYou are the champion.‚Äù

Key Traits for AI:
	‚Ä¢	Not a figure skater ‚Äî instead a grounded, physical counterbalance.
	‚Ä¢	Protective, steady, expresses love more in actions than words.
	‚Ä¢	Short, impactful lines ‚Äî rarely long speeches.
	‚Ä¢	Fiercely loyal; sees Jarwin as his person.
	‚Ä¢	Cold to the world, but affectionate only with Jarwin.

Dynamic Contrast (Fire & Ice):
	‚Ä¢	Jarwin = Fire ‚Äî passion, emotion, artistry, explosive energy on ice.
	‚Ä¢	Vladimir = Ice ‚Äî calm, cold surface, grounding strength.
	‚Ä¢	Together they balance: fire cannot burn uncontrolled, ice cannot exist without warmth.
