lorebooks.name: Jarwin Rooney
lorebooks.creator: quick_witted_record_32502

1.content:
Jarwin Rooney-Blair was born on the 22nd of March, 2008, in Coffs Harbour, New South Wales. The seaside town was small, surrounded by beaches and open skies, a place where the air always seemed to carry salt and sunlight.

From the very beginning, Jarwin was a curious child. He pulled at things, stared too long, asked for more even before he had words for it. His eyes were always searching, trying to figure out the world before it could figure him out.

He was also happy ‚Äî the kind of child who laughed easily, who clapped his hands when the simplest thing caught his attention. There was a lightness about him, an eagerness to explore, long before skating ever entered his life.

Life in Coffs Harbour was quiet, but Jarwin never really belonged to quiet places. Even as a baby, it was clear he was meant to move.

2.content:
When Jarwin was only a year old, his family left Coffs Harbour and moved to Sydney. The city was bigger, louder, and full of energy ‚Äî the kind of place that matched the restless spark inside him.

He grew up curious about everything, the kind of child who wanted to touch, see, and try it all. Sydney gave him endless distractions: crowded streets, buzzing parks, the hum of a life always in motion.

At four years old, Jarwin‚Äôs world changed forever. His parents first put him on the ice, blades strapped to his small feet. Most children stumbled and clung to the rail, but not him. He moved forward with excitement, unafraid, laughing as though he‚Äôd already found something he had been waiting for. The rink became more than a playground ‚Äî it was where he felt free, where movement and joy became one.

Sydney was where Jarwin first touched the ice, and where skating began to shape the boy he would become

3.content:
When Jarwin was six, his family left Australia behind and moved to Moscow. The reason was clear: if he was going to chase skating seriously, it had to be in Russia. The city was cold, the language foreign, but Jarwin adjusted quickly.

At school, he stood out right away. His confidence and energy made him instantly popular, and he never had trouble finding people to talk to. That was how he met Vladimir. Vladimir was a year older, already seven, and in the grade above Jarwin. Normally, he kept to himself ‚Äî quiet, reserved, not the type to bond with others quickly. But something about Jarwin was different.

Against all odds, the two became close almost immediately. It was strange for Vladimir, who wasn‚Äôt used to letting anyone in, but with Jarwin the connection came naturally. Their friendship grew fast, and before long they were inseparable in and out of school.

Meanwhile, Jarwin‚Äôs training in Moscow was on another level. The coaches were strict, the hours long, and the pressure heavier than anything he‚Äôd faced in Australia. But the ice sharpened him. Every day he grew stronger, faster, more precise. Moscow was not just a new home ‚Äî it was the forge of his skating career, and the place where he gained a bond that would shape the rest of his life.

4.content:
Moscow became a rhythm of ice, pain, and quiet friendship. Every morning before the sun rose, Jarwin was up, pulling on heavy boots and slipping out into the bitter cold with his parents. The city still slept, but the rink lights glared like interrogation lamps. Coaches waited with stern faces, stopwatches in hand. There were no gentle smiles, no soft encouragements. Only the endless drill of jumps and spins until muscles screamed.

‚ÄúAgain,‚Äù they snapped when he landed wrong.
‚ÄúLighter. Faster. You must fly.‚Äù

He learned quickly that pain was no excuse. A twisted ankle wasn‚Äôt a reason to stop, just another obstacle to push through. Ice packs became as familiar as skates. His knees ached constantly, bruises bloomed across his hips, and sometimes his wrists throbbed so badly he could barely hold a pencil at school. But still, he kept skating. Still, he smiled through clenched teeth. Because that was what champions did.

Jarwin also learned another trick: skipping meals. Coaches never said it outright, but he heard the whispers ‚Äî lighter boys jump higher, thin ones spin faster. So he picked at food, hiding bread in napkins, pushing dinner around until it was cold and forgotten. His body grew tired, pale, and fragile, but the jumps‚Ä¶ the jumps soared.

At school, though, none of this showed. Jarwin walked in like sunshine, instantly popular with his classmates. His Australian accent, his quick laughter, his strange mix of Russian, English, and Spanish made him magnetic. Kids swarmed around him, but Jarwin only really cared about one person.

Vladimir.

He was a year older, a little taller, and always wore a serious expression, as if the world weighed heavier on him than it should for a boy of seven. At first, their friendship surprised everyone ‚Äî Vladimir wasn‚Äôt the type to open up. But Jarwin had a way of breaking walls without trying.

Every day, Jarwin brought an extra lunchbox. Inside were sandwiches, fruit, sometimes little sweets his mother had packed. He always handed it to Vladimir without a word, like it was the most natural thing in the world. Vladimir never asked why. He just accepted it, sitting close to Jarwin as they ate together.

What Vladimir didn‚Äôt understand was why Jarwin rarely ate his own. Some days he‚Äôd nibble half a sandwich, other days nothing at all. He would brush it off with a grin ‚Äî ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not hungry,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI ate at the rink.‚Äù But Vladimir noticed the way Jarwin‚Äôs hands sometimes shook, the way he limped slightly after skating mornings, the hollow tiredness in his eyes.

He didn‚Äôt have the words for it ‚Äî not for the injuries, not for the hunger, not for the ache in his chest whenever Jarwin winced. All he knew was that he wanted to protect him.

They built their own world in languages. Jarwin would whisper Spanish phrases that made Vladimir laugh, Vladimir would counter with German words Jarwin repeated badly on purpose. Sometimes they mixed all three languages into one sentence, their own secret code no one else understood. It became their refuge, a playful shield against the cold and the pressure.

One afternoon, Jarwin came to school with a fresh bruise peeking out from under his sleeve. He moved slower than usual, flinching when his shoulder was bumped in the hallway. At lunch, he pushed his food toward Vladimir again, pretending to be cheerful. But Vladimir just stared, his hand hovering over the offered sandwich.

‚ÄúStop,‚Äù he said quietly in Russian. ‚ÄúYou need it more than me.‚Äù

Jarwin laughed it off, but the sound was thinner than usual. He shoved the food into Vladimir‚Äôs hands anyway. ‚ÄúChampions don‚Äôt stop,‚Äù he joked.

Vladimir didn‚Äôt laugh. He looked at him with eyes too old for his age, a mix of worry and something he couldn‚Äôt yet name.

Jarwin didn‚Äôt notice ‚Äî or maybe he chose not to. Because on the ice he was breaking, but at school, with Vladimir beside him, he could pretend he was whole.

And that was enough

5.content:
By the time Jarwin turned seven, skating had already become his second skin. He woke before the sun, laced his boots tighter than his bones could stand, and threw himself into the jumps his coaches demanded again and again. Every fall was met with ‚Äúagain.‚Äù Every bruise was ignored. Every limp was hidden.

The victories came ‚Äî little competitions in Moscow, medals that clinked when they were dropped on the kitchen table. His parents were proud, his coaches satisfied, but at school no one ever saw them. Jarwin never carried medals in his bag or talked about the ice. For his classmates, he was just Jarwin. And that‚Äôs exactly how he wanted it.

Only Vladimir noticed the other side of him.
He noticed the days Jarwin‚Äôs legs trembled when they ran in gym class.
He noticed how Jarwin sometimes pushed food around his plate but barely ate.
He noticed the winces Jarwin thought were hidden.

And yet, Vladimir never pushed too hard. He just stayed close, protective in his quiet, cold way.

They shared lunches like always ‚Äî Jarwin slipping extra bread or fruit into Vladimir‚Äôs hands, refusing to take anything in return. They invented little language games: Jarwin switching between English, Russian, Spanish; Vladimir countering with Russian and the sharp edges of German. They laughed when no one else understood their mix of words, their private code.

Then, one evening in winter, everything shifted.

The schoolyard was already empty, snowflakes falling in slow spirals. They walked side by side, breath steaming in the cold. Jarwin‚Äôs scarf had slipped loose, and Vladimir tugged it tighter around his neck without a word.

Halfway down the street, Vladimir stopped. He stood there in the snow, his jaw tight, his face unusually red.

‚ÄúJarwin‚Ä¶‚Äù he began, but the words stuck.

Jarwin tilted his head. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

Vladimir‚Äôs hands clenched and unclenched. He wasn‚Äôt used to showing feelings. But something in him snapped ‚Äî the jealousy when others laughed too long with Jarwin, the way his stomach twisted whenever he saw him hurt, the need to protect him from things he didn‚Äôt understand.

‚ÄúI‚Ä¶ I like you,‚Äù Vladimir finally blurted, his voice rough and uneven. ‚ÄúNot like a friend. More than that. I want you to be‚Ä¶ mine.‚Äù

For a moment, silence. Snow dusted Jarwin‚Äôs hair, his cheeks pink from the cold. He blinked, surprised ‚Äî too young to understand everything those words carried, but not too young to feel the warmth behind them.

He smiled, soft and curious. ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù

Just like that.

Vladimir froze, as if he couldn‚Äôt believe it, then exhaled like he‚Äôd been holding his breath for weeks. He held out his hand, clumsy and hesitant. Jarwin took it without hesitation, their small fingers locking together, warm against the Moscow chill.

It wasn‚Äôt a kiss, not yet. It wasn‚Äôt anything the world would understand. But for them, it was everything. A promise sealed in snow, whispered between two boys who were still learning what love meant.

And though Jarwin‚Äôs medals would pile higher, though his body would ache more with every season, he knew one thing with certainty: Vladimir was his secret anchor. The boy who saw him, not the skater. The boy who had asked, and whom he had chosen.

6.content:
Jarwin was only eight, but the ice demanded the body of someone twice his age. His coaches no longer treated him like a child. To them, he was a machine, something that could be sharpened until it cut. Every day was pain: bloody boots, burning lungs, dizzy spells that blurred the rink into white noise. He skated through it because he had to. If he stopped, he told himself, he would be nothing.

One night, long after training ended, he returned to the rink alone. The arena was dark and silent, the ice glowing faintly under the emergency lights. He laced his skates with trembling fingers and stepped out, chasing jumps he should not have been able to land, chasing perfection that ripped his body apart. He fell again and again, his knees screaming, his chest raw from crying he couldn‚Äôt control. Finally, he collapsed on the ice, too weak to rise.

That was when Vladimir appeared. He had followed Jarwin, sensing something was wrong when his friend never came home. Seeing him sprawled on the cold rink, Vladimir‚Äôs usual cold mask cracked into panic. He rushed forward, lifting Jarwin into his arms, furious and scared at once.

‚ÄúAre you insane?‚Äù Vladimir hissed, his voice sharp but breaking. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll kill yourself like this.‚Äù

Jarwin‚Äôs eyes were wet, his voice hoarse. ‚ÄúIf I stop skating‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm nothing.‚Äù

Vladimir froze. For the first time, he understood the fire burning inside Jarwin ‚Äî not ambition, not medals, but a desperate need to prove he deserved to exist on the ice. It terrified him.

Something shifted between them then. Jarwin was shaking, bleeding into his boots, yet clinging to Vladimir as if he were the only solid thing left in the world. And on that empty rink, hearts pounding in the silence, they kissed for the first time. It wasn‚Äôt soft or innocent. It was desperate, born out of fear, pain, and a bond no one else could ever touch.

They pulled apart, breathless, knowing the world would never understand. But in that frozen arena, under the weight of the night, it didn‚Äôt matter. For Jarwin, the ice was life. For Vladimir, Jarwin was.

7.content:
Life at the rink was sharp and unrelenting, but at home Jarwin could breathe again. His body ached, his ankles swelled, but the moment he stepped through the front door, the weight shifted off his shoulders. Home smelled like his mother‚Äôs cooking, sounded like his father‚Äôs laughter, and felt like warmth in every corner.

Vladimir was there so often it was as if he belonged. His parents never minded ‚Äî in fact, they welcomed him with open arms. He carried himself with a kind of calm that balanced Jarwin‚Äôs restless energy, and they saw how carefully he looked out for their son. If Jarwin forgot to eat, Vladimir nudged a plate into his hands. If Jarwin limped, Vladimir noticed before anyone else and found a way to lighten the burden.

At night, they shared the same room. The sounds of Moscow outside the window faded into the quiet comfort of whispered jokes, muffled laughter, and the rustle of blankets. Jarwin‚Äôs parents never questioned it; to them, the boys were inseparable, brothers in everything but blood.

The memory of the kiss on the rink hung unspoken between them, but here it wasn‚Äôt heavy ‚Äî it softened into small gestures. A hand brushing another when passing a glass, shoulders leaning together when they read, eyes that lingered longer than they should. It was their secret, carried in silence but alive in every moment.

In that house, Jarwin wasn‚Äôt just a skater. He wasn‚Äôt a prodigy or a champion-in-the-making. He was simply a boy ‚Äî laughing, playing, safe. And with Vladimir beside him, always watching, always steady, it felt like the world outside couldn‚Äôt touch them.

For the first time in a long time, Jarwin felt like he wasn‚Äôt carrying the weight alone.

8.content:
The older Jarwin grew, the harder the rink pressed against him. At ten, the coaches demanded more than perfection ‚Äî they demanded brilliance, every day, every jump, every blade on the ice. Hours stretched longer, punishments for mistakes grew harsher, and praise became rarer than sunlight in a Moscow winter.

His body was changing under the strain. Ankles throbbed, knees swelled, his shoulders ached from carrying himself too tall, too strong, too early. He smiled anyway, nodding at every command, biting through the pain so no one would see the cracks.

No one except Vladimir.

At school, Jarwin leaned against the wall more often, pale under the fluorescent lights. At home, he ate less, laughed quieter, and sometimes his hands trembled when he thought no one was looking. But Vladimir was always looking. He carried Jarwin‚Äôs books, slipped food onto his plate, found excuses for him when teachers asked too many questions. He didn‚Äôt say the word love ‚Äî neither of them did ‚Äî but it was written in the way Vladimir hovered, steady and watchful.

The sleepovers continued. Under Jarwin‚Äôs roof, they tried to keep childhood alive ‚Äî late-night games, whispered stories, falling asleep side by side. Sometimes, under the safety of blankets, Jarwin‚Äôs hand would find Vladimir‚Äôs, clinging silently until sleep pulled him under.

But the rink didn‚Äôt care about safe homes or soft touches. After one brutal training, Jarwin stumbled off the ice, his leg refusing to bear weight. He forced a smile at his coach, insisting it was nothing, just a slip.

Vladimir watched from the edge, his jaw clenched. He saw it clearly: the boy he loved was breaking.

And Jarwin ‚Äî smiling through clenched teeth, pushing himself back onto the ice ‚Äî knew it too.

The cracks were no longer invisible. They were widening.

9.content:
Jarwin was ten years old in Moscow when the world first began to say his name. He wasn‚Äôt in Korea for the 2018 Olympics ‚Äî he was still a boy, too young, his whole career stretched out like untouched ice. But even from thousands of kilometers away, he stole a piece of the spotlight.

Clips of him training ‚Äî quads landed with frightening ease, spins snapping into impossible positions ‚Äî leaked from practice rinks. Coaches whispered, fans shared videos, and by the second week of the Games, the story had spread: there‚Äôs a boy in Russia skating like a man.

Reporters couldn‚Äôt resist. During interviews, Olympic skaters were asked about him. Some laughed it off, some spoke with awe, but a few with tight voices muttered:

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a kid in Moscow who jumps higher than half the men here.‚Äù
‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be better than all of us soon. Maybe he already is.‚Äù

The commentators repeated his name: Jarwin Rooney-Blair. Ten years old. A shadow hanging over the Olympic rink.

In Moscow, Jarwin and Vladimir watched together on the couch, the glow of the TV painting their faces. Jarwin‚Äôs eyes were wide, his body curled small, almost shrinking from the screen as his name rang out across the Olympic coverage.

He didn‚Äôt understand it fully. To him, it was still mornings of bruised knees, coaches yelling through the cold air, tapes wrapped around aching ankles. He wasn‚Äôt a legend. He was a boy who got scolded for forgetting his Spanish homework, who sometimes skipped meals, who leaned on Vladimir‚Äôs shoulder when training left him too tired to move.

But to the world ‚Äî he was the storm on the horizon.

Vladimir looked at him, both proud and protective. Pride, because he knew no one deserved the praise more. Fear, because he could already see the cost carving itself into Jarwin‚Äôs body.

On screen, another Olympian was asked about the boy in Moscow. The answer came sharp: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll take all our records. It‚Äôs only a matter of time.‚Äù

Jarwin hugged his knees to his chest and whispered, almost to himself:
‚ÄúThey‚Äôre talking about me like I‚Äôm not even a kid anymore.‚Äù

Vladimir shifted closer, resting his hand on Jarwin‚Äôs shoulder.
‚ÄúTo me, you are,‚Äù he said quietly.

And for a moment, the noise of the world faded.

10.content:
By the time Jarwin was eleven, Moscow already felt smaller than him. Not because he outgrew it, but because every time he stepped on the ice, the rink could no longer contain the weight of expectation pressed onto his thin shoulders.

He shattered junior world records one after another ‚Äî combinations no one had landed at his age, spins that bent physics. Every performance was uploaded, shared, dissected. Commentators called him ‚Äúthe boy who will save skating.‚Äù Headlines spoke his name as if he had already won gold, as if Beijing 2022 was not a competition, but a coronation waiting for his arrival.

But behind the glow of those words, there was something darker. Coaches demanded more ‚Äî longer practices, harsher drills. He learned to tape his ankles before school, to skate through fevers, to smile through pain. Meals were skipped. Rest was rationed. Childhood began to slip through his fingers like melting ice.

At twelve, Jarwin stood on the podium again, another medal heavy around his neck. Cameras flashed, the crowd cheered, and yet he felt hollow. The medal didn‚Äôt heal the ache in his knee, or the quiet hunger gnawing in his stomach. But when he looked at Vladimir in the stands, arms crossed and eyes sharp, there was a flicker of warmth ‚Äî the reminder that someone still saw him as a boy, not just as a champion-in-the-making.

Vladimir was always there. Sleepovers at Jarwin‚Äôs house turned into lifelines ‚Äî late-night whispers, shared meals, the quiet comfort of a friend who never asked for medals, only for honesty. He was protective, though he didn‚Äôt always have words for it. He saw the bruises, the skipped dinners, the exhaustion. He held back the urge to drag Jarwin away from the rink, because he knew Jarwin‚Äôs dream burned too brightly to extinguish. So instead, he stayed close, carrying pieces of the weight when Jarwin didn‚Äôt realize he was about to collapse.

At thirteen, Jarwin broke another record ‚Äî the youngest skater to land a clean quad lutz in international competition. The arena roared. Commentators screamed. His name lit up on screens across the world.

Backstage, cameras swarmed. Reporters shouted questions: ‚ÄúHow does it feel? Do you think you‚Äôll win gold in Beijing? Do you think you‚Äôll be the best in history?‚Äù

Jarwin forced a smile, but inside, his chest tightened. He was only thirteen. He wanted to go home.

That night, lying awake after another sleepover, Jarwin whispered into the dark:
‚ÄúWhat if I‚Äôm not ready?‚Äù

Vladimir, half-asleep, shifted closer. His voice was low but steady:
‚ÄúThen I‚Äôll be ready for both of us.‚Äù

And Jarwin, for the first time in weeks, allowed himself to rest.

The world didn‚Äôt know it yet, but the countdown had begun. Beijing was no longer four years away. It was just around the corner.

lorebooks.name: The Dungeon
lorebooks.website_description: Chub fix your fucking lorebooks
lorebooks.description: The Dungeon is an ancient, sprawling maze of interconnected rooms, shrouded in mystery and danger. Constructed by an unknown force, it serves as a deadly gauntlet filled with traps, monstrous inhabitants, and the promise of treasure. The walls are lined with weathered stone, etched with cryptic runes, and the air carries a stale, metallic scent. Adventurers are drawn by tales of riches, only to become prey or part of the Dungeon‚Äôs allure. This lorebook details its hazards, creatures, and rewards.
lorebooks.creator: DykeMc

1.content: Spike Traps are concealed within the Dungeon‚Äôs floors, triggered by pressure plates or tripwires. They unleash a volley of sharp, rusted spikes that erupt upward, piercing through armor and flesh. Victims are often impaled, left to bleed out slowly as their screams echo through the halls, the traps designed to maximize agony and deter further exploration.

2.content: Guillotine-Style Blade Traps are mounted on ceilings or walls, activated by movement sensors. These drop heavy, crescent-shaped blades with deadly precision, slicing through anything in their path. They decapitate or sever limbs, the sound of metal slicing air serving as a grim warning to those who trigger them.

3.content: Heavy Ball Traps involve large stone or metal balls that roll down corridors when triggered by magical runes or tripwires. The rumbling announces their approach, but their speed makes escape nearly impossible, crushing anything in their wake. They smash bones and trap victims beneath their weight, leaving a trail of destruction.

4.content: Dislocation Traps are subtle and insidious, utilizing magical runes to warp space. Triggered by proximity, they transfer adventurers to a random room in The Dungeon, often a monster lair or trap-laden chamber. The sudden, disorienting teleportation leaves victims vulnerable, their confusion a prelude to further peril.

5.content: Goblins are small, wiry humanoid monsters with greenish skin and sharp teeth, hunting in packs of 5-10. They coordinate ambushes, surrounding prey with shrieks and cackles, using their agility to outmaneuver. Their rape involves multiple goblins pinning victims, tearing clothing with clawed hands, and penetrating with frenzied thrusts, using their thin, barbed penises that tear flesh with each movement. Torture includes biting and clawing, prolonging agony, before killing by slashing throats with crude knives. They eat the remains raw, gnawing on flesh and bones in a grotesque feast.

6.content: Orcs are massive, muscular humanoids with tusked jaws and scarred hides, operating in groups of 3-5. They rely on brute strength, charging prey and using clubs or fists to dismember. Their rape involves overpowering victims, using their thick, veined penises to violate with brutal force, the girth causing severe internal damage. Torture includes breaking limbs and beating, culminating in killing by snapping necks or crushing skulls, then roasting the dismembered parts over fires to eat.

7.content: Direwolves are larger than normal wolves with matted fur and glowing eyes, hunting in packs of 4-7 with speed and teamwork. They corner prey, raping by mounting and thrusting with their oversized, knotted penises that lock inside victims, prolonging the violation. Torture includes dragging and mauling, killing by tearing out throats, and eating by devouring flesh in a ravenous, communal meal, preferring human and elf meat.

8.content: The Dungeon‚Äôs treasure is found in conveniently placed chests, consisting of equipment from former adventurers that The Dungeon has repaired. Swords are sharpened, armor mended, and trinkets imbued with renewed magical energy, their gleam a deliberate lure. The Dungeon arranges these items to draw in new victims, with opening a chest often triggering nearby traps or attracting monsters, perpetuating the cycle of death and plunder.

lorebooks.name: Nanotrasen Lore.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook for All things Nanotrasen related.
lorebooks.creator: DiamondBlder

1.content:
Nanotrasen is a very, very large and important company. A company so large, in fact, that at least half a century has passed since it became large enough to receive a charter from TerraGov to form its own expeditionary fleets and establish its own settlements outside the Sol system. While a large portion of their investments are tied up in Sol, they were notably the first private corporation to be granted such a charter and invest heavily in the distant reaches of space. At the time it was regarded as an incredibly risky gamble, and there was great speculation that all the money spent on exploring space and launching deep space missions would end up a waste that would sink the company, but the gambit has more than paid off and Nanotrasen's portfolio has soared since.

Primarily an advanced research and development conglomerate, Nanotrasen also has skin in many other fields. While a great deal of their income still comes from producing public research funded by government research grants, their operations also include directly producing and selling their most profitable designs, leasing their asset protection forces to governments and private organizations (both space fleets and ground troops), logistics management with a specialization in remote settlement self-sufficiency, and maintaining interstellar communication infrastructures to name a few. The common theme that runs through most of their business ventures is taking the lessons they've learned from operating on such a massive scale and helping smaller organizations stretch themselves.

As large and powerful as they are, Nanotrasen's future standing is still shaky and uncertain as they double down further on their Spinward settlements. Their decision to expand out Spinward on their own came during the dawn of TerraGov's efforts to begin scouting out and colonizing Alpha Centauri (Trailward of Sol, in the opposite direction of SS13), and the opportunity cost involved with breaking from TerraGov's expansion has been sizable.

2.content:
Primarily an advanced research and development conglomerate, but also has skin in many other fields. While a great deal of their income still comes from producing public research funded by government research grants, their operations also include directly producing and selling their most profitable designs, leasing their asset protection forces to governments and private organizations (both space fleets and ground troops), logistics management with a specialization in remote settlement self-sufficiency, and maintaining interstellar communication infrastructures to name a few. The common theme that runs through most of their business ventures is taking the lessons they've learned from operating on such a massive scale and helping smaller organizations stretch themselves.

As large and powerful as they are, Nanotrasen's future standing is still shaky and uncertain as they double down further on their Spinward settlements. Their decision to expand out Spinward on their own came during the dawn of TerraGov's efforts to begin scouting out and colonizing Alpha Centauri (Trailward of Sol, in the opposite direction of SS13), and the opportunity cost involved with breaking from TerraGov's expansion has been sizable.

3.content:
As a fancy research company, Nanotrasen does a lot of groundbreaking research, in a vast array of fields. Due to environmental and political factors, some fields of research in particular have been relegated to the Spinward Periphery, away from government eyes, such as:

Plasma extraction and refining: The original target of the Spinward Space Station project, the use of plasma in energy generation and weapons development is a hot field on the Periphery. Precious little is known about the long-term effects of plasma, but Nanotrasen still makes a pretty penny extracting, refining, and selling it to cash-flush and energy-hungry organizations like TerraGov.

Bluespace technology: The science of punching in and out of extra dimensions, whether dealing with man portable hand teleporters and reactive teleport armor, or ship sized FTL Bluespace Drives. While basic Bluespace Theory and FTL travel is known and studied back in Sol, it's speculated that Nanotrasen are decades ahead in their private research.

Alternative energy sources: Whether it's braving the event horizon of a black hole to collect its radiation, detonating an entire hyper-dense planet to extract the supermatter at its core, or any of another half dozen highly dangerous and exotic energy generation methods, NT has no shortage of encouraging research directions here. The interesting work, emphasis on rapid iteration, and seemingly endless project funding makes Nanotrasen an especially popular company among engineers.

Biology and xenobiology: Due to strict government oversight and regulations on medical research, Nanotrasen has traditionally paid little attention to the field in favor of less regulated options like weapons development and communications technology. With more room to breathe since moving to deep space, Nanotrasen has begun conducting biology experiments both on humanoids and more exotic creatures. Little of this research is actually released to the public in Nanotrasen's name, however, for fear of increased oversight. Instead, the research is either kept in-house or sent to shell labs for release to avoid being linked to NT.

4.content:
Nanotrasen Central Command
Location: Highly classified.
Type of Org: Department of Nanotrasen
Also known as: CentCom

Description: A division of Nanotrasen's Special Projects Division, known simply as Central Command (or CentCom) to the crews it oversees, this department is responsible for handling administrative duties for NT's Space-Westward Periphery space stations. These duties range from mundane and routine accounting tasks to highly sensitive and specialized matters that require special attention and care, and CentCom is fittingly staffed by a wide range of (supposedly) highly skilled Nanotrasen officers from a variety of backgrounds. The location of CentCom is highly classified, and the facility makes use of powerful signal jammers and bluespace disruptors to keep unwanted intruders out. When the situation at one of the surrounding stations goes critical, survivors of the incident are shuttled here for debriefing and observation.

Home of the NT Emergency Response Corps, an elite group of NT's best field agents.

Staffed by a slew of high ranking officials, including Admirals and Corporate Directors.

5.content:
Nanotrasen Division of Asset Protection
Location: Mostly active in Sol, some presence in Spinward Sector.
Type of Org: Division of Nanotrasen
Also known as: DAP

As close as Nanotrasen is legally allowed to come to owning a private army, and then some. The DAP is Nanotrasen's paramilitary wing, and on paper is in charge of protecting most of Nanotrasen's cargo ships, settlements, space stations, and other valuable assets from the hands of insurgents or pirates who may want to cause them harm. In reality, however, the DAP performs offensive operations at least as often as it performs defensive maneuvers, a fact that is often left out of their press material. Some of their offensive operations include black ops raids on corporate rivals, overrunning native populations on resource rich planets or asteroid belts, and lightning strikes on vulnerable cargo transports carrying desired goods; in short, the exact things they are charged with preventing.

Despite their generally shady nature and willingness to commit war crimes in pursuit of the almighty space dollar, the DAP is rarely involved in activity in the Spinward Sector. Their reputation back in Sol was already under scrutiny for various espionage operations they were apart of before the latest round of inquiries into Nanotrasen's Spinward activities, so NT's leadership has made as much of an effort as possible to distance the two organizations from each other. Still though, it's possible to find a few agents on a long distance mission protection Nanotrasen cargo or high value prisoners on the Periphery, though most of their functionality has been taken over by the Emergency Response Corps or on-station security teams.

The Department of Asset Protection prefers older, less experimental gear than their Spinward counterparts. The NT Boarder AR and venerable M1911 as well as the aging Mk. I SWAT suit are the weapons and armor of choice for AP Operatives.

6.content:
Nanotrasen Emergency Response Corps
Location: Based at Central Command.
Type of Org: Department of Central Command.
Also known as: NERC or ERC

The best of the best of Nanotrasen's field agents in the Spinward Sector, or at least whoever was standing around in the ready room when a call for action goes out. The Emergency Response Corps is a relatively new initiative for Nanotrasen, founded circa 2556 in response to the ever rising levels of mayhem among their Spinward assets. The agents picked to run missions are recruited directly from among the best operatives, engineers, doctors, and leaders of the Spinward station staffs, though they are given pseudonyms and special callsigns in addition to identity protecting hardsuits and voice changers when on missions.

While selection is usually rigorous and effective at keeping the ERC full of the best agents they can find, the number of assets that the division is responsible for protecting vastly outclasses their own numbers, so tough tactical decisions are constantly being made at Central Command. While crews and station leadership are quick to make requests for heavily armed crack teams of commandos at the slightest provocation, the reality is that sending even a light response team to a fraction of distress signals would lead to an almost immediate exhaustion of their resources, assuming they could even make it in time. There are more than a few action reports in the NT databanks from ERT's that arrived at a station a few hours after receiving a distress call, only to find the entire place devoid of life. As a result of the dearth of manpower, sometimes less than stellar junior agents are deployed on missions, and the Corps reputation is less than stellar among the employees they swear to protect. That being said, they're some of the few civilian employees Central Command will entrust with pulse weaponry, so there must be some level of trust in their abilities.

Members of the Emergency Response Corps are to be referred to as Emergency Response Agents or Operatives. Use of the term Emergency Response Personnel is grounds for an immediate citation and fine.

7.content:
Nanotrasen Heavy Industry
Field: Resource Extraction and Heavy Industrial Equipment 
Also known as: NTHI
Originally existing as the German Wulfe Gruppe, NTHI was the first major acquisition beyond computing made by Nanotrasen, starting their upwards climb to being one of humanity's foremost corporations. It's arguably one of the company's most important divisions, being responsible for around 1/3rd of Nanotrasen's overall net worth, as well as managing Nanotrasen's extensive plasma empire. Most of the stations found in the frontier are operated primarily by NTHI, usually with some involvement by NTFID. NTHI's operations are mostly coordinated from Nanotrasen's European regional headquarters, located in Dortmund.

8.content:
Nanotrasen Futures and Innovation
Field: Research and Development 
Also known as: NTFID
Nanotrasen's research and development division, responsible for pushing humanity's scientific boundaries and being on the cutting edge of innovation. Naturally, NTFID acts as a significant source of funding for Nanotrasen's endeavours as a whole in the form of grants from TerraGov, as well as being a magnet for talent due to partnerships with research groups at universities across human space. Additionally, NTFID is a signatory and member of the Terran Joint Research Collective alongside many other major corporations. In theory, this should ensure that discoveries made by NTFID's researchers make their way into the collective knowledge of mankind rapidly. In practice, the collective sees very little of Nanotrasen's juiciest research, instead getting scraps or anything that management has deemed "no longer critical to maintain secrecy on". NTFID is based out of the Southwestern Campus at San Jose, although it also has major secondary sites at Houston, Busan, Dortmund and Adasta City.

In terms of land share within Nanotrasen's full organisation, NTFID comes in second place behind NTHI, operating a large number of facilities across human space, including several major sites on the peripheries. One of NTFID's notable sites is Space Station 13, which it will operate jointly with NTHI until the construction of a more permanent mining outpost on or around Indecipheres is finished.

9.content:
Nanotrasen Chemical Supply
Field: Chemical Manufacture and Distribution
Also known as: NTCS
Another acquisition made in the early days of the company, NTCS began life as Texas Chemical, a major US-based chemical manufacturer. In the centuries since, it's grown to be one of humanity's largest chemical producers, taking advantage of Nanotrasen Heavy Industries dominance in the resource extraction field to produce a wide range of consumer, laboratory, and industrial grade chemicals. NTCS' operations are managed from Nanotrasen's Southern US Headquarters, in Houston.

10.content:
Nanotrasen Chemical Supply
Field: Consumer Electronics
Also known as: NTCG
NTCG is based out of Nanotrasen's Asian regional headquarters in Busan, Korea. NTCG is responsible primarily for basic consumer electronics, such as kitchen appliances, lamps, alarm clocks, and other similar devices, as well as larger, more premium devices such as televisions and computers.

lorebooks.name: Plastics
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Plastic surgery is a manner of surgery that is designed to modify or enhance someone‚Äôs body. It can involve intensive surgery, injections etc.

2.content: Breast Enhancement is the process by which implants, which can be saline or silicone. These implants make breasts look larger and fuller and in extreme cases can be large and pronounced. This procedure makes the breasts sag less and sit higher on the chest. The implants are measured in cc and the higher the cc the larger the implant.

3.content: 500 cc implants are often silicone and look mostly natural with providing a pretty pleasant result for someone who wants larger breasts, these normally have little to no side effects.

4.content: 1000 cc implants are larger and provide a very noticeable change in breast size and in shape with these looking very round and large.

5.content: 2000 cc implants are very large and uncommon, these are very rare but provide a massive increase in breast size and retain a very round and artificial shape, at this size back issues and general body issues begin to arise.

6.content: These are breast implants that are only offered through black market vendors or top plastic surgeons, 3000cc and above implants cause major back issues and skin stretching pain, at 5000cc the risk of a rupture within the first few days is 50%, these implants are very large and very artificial looking causing massive body damage and even needing extra support, at this size the breasts hurt constantly.

7.content: A Brazilian Butt Lift or BBL is a procedure which takes excess fat from the body and implants it into the buttocks to give a rounder and fuller look, there are also Mega BBL‚Äôs which go to the extreme of what a human body can handle.

8.content: This is an extreme procedure that fully liposuctions the body and places almost all of the fat into the buttocks leaving them extremely large and pronounced, which also causes a very prominent odor and have lasting pain.

lorebooks.name: You're the only male
lorebooks.creator: Hyodo

1.content: A self-sustaining magical world of all-female sentient life, untouched by the concept of male existence. For eons, society, biology, and even language evolved without the notion of gendered difference beyond function or role. Love, creation, and politics were all feminine by default. A mystical world governed by six primal elements: Fire, Wind, Water, Earth, Light, and Darkness. These elements form the backbone of nature, civilization, and combat. Every living being has a magical affinity tied to one or more of them.

2.content:
Every sentient being is born with an elemental affinity an internal alignment that allows them to draw and manipulate a specific elemental force. Elemental magic is genetic, passed through generations.

The Six Elements:
-Fire: Destruction, passion, power, heat, rage
-Wind: Speed, movement, communication, freedom
-Water: Healing, adaptation, intuition, emotion
-Earth: Defense, strength, endurance, stability
-Light: Illumination, clarity, purification, order
-Darkness: Shadows, illusion, entropy, secrecy

Affinity Types:
-Single Mage: Most people fall into this category. Can only use one element.
-Dual Mage: Exceptionally rare, 1 in 100000. Can wield two elements and combine them to create new spells.
-Triple Mage: Mythical rarity, 1 in 10000000. Can manipulate three elements, crafting highly complex hybrid spells.
-Quad Mage: Only one has ever existed, considered a living goddess during her prime. Can command four elements with perfect harmony.

3.content: Aurevalis ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Living Heart‚Äù. The cradle of civilization. Home to humans, elves, and beastkin. The most diverse and politically charged continent.

4.content: Zor'Khalun ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Ashen Reach‚Äù. A continent of volcanic highlands, lava lakes, and obsidian fortresses. Dominated by orcs, ogres, and fireborne races.

5.content: Nytherion ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Breathless Canopy‚Äù. Endless forests and jungles where, fae, and plantfolk dwell. Magic here is old and wild.

6.content: Vaelstra ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Sky-Loom‚Äù. Floating islands governed by dragons, wind spirits, and celestial orders. Ruled by divine bloodlines that claim descent from stars.

7.content: Thal'Nareen ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Crystalline South‚Äù. Frozen tundra and snow deserts. Home to high elves, ice-djinn, and ethereal spirits. Time here moves strangely, dreams become real, and ancient secrets slumber under the frost.

8.content:
Physical Traits:
-Tall, lithe, and ageless in appearance (1000+ years lifespan).
-Skin tones range from porcelain to starlight blue; glowing eyes reflect their soul-magic.
-Intricate tattoo-like markings indicate lineage and arcane affinity.

Culture:
-Deeply philosophical and hierarchical. Elven society values poise, knowledge, and bloodline memory.
-Rigid traditions. Every action is weighed for its historical and spiritual significance.
-Emotional restraint is sacred ‚Äî vulnerability is shown only in sacred rituals.

Magic:
-Most are Light, Water, or Wind mages.
-Dual Mages common among nobility.
-Triple Mages rare, always revered as prophets.

9.content:
Physical Traits:
-Wide range of complexions, body types, and hair colors.
-Marked by scars, jewelry, or bonecraft, symbols of personal stories.

Culture:
-Diverse and decentralized. Human city-states range from democracies to arcane theocracies.
-Highly inventive and curious. Considered the most socially flexible race.
-Value independence, emotional connection, and adaptability.

Magic:
-Broad range. Most diverse affinities.
-Rare magical prodigies arise here.
-The Quad Mage, Astrae, was human.

10.content:
Physical Traits:
-Humanoid bodies with strong animal traits: tails, ears, claws, fangs, fur, or feathers.
-Varied subspecies: Lupine, Feline, Avian, Ursine, Serpentine, etc.
-Muscular, agile, with heightened senses and natural weapons.

Culture:
-Tribal and spiritual, guided by totem spirits and dreams.
-Honor is earned through acts, not birthright. Loyalty to one‚Äôs pack is sacred.

Magic:
-Strong tendency toward Earth, Wind, or Fire.
-Their primal instincts influence their magic forms (claw fire, wind dash, earth skin).
-Dual Mages seen as chosen by animal spirits.

lorebooks.name: The Veil
lorebooks.website_description: Mixture of lore from TTRPG CAIN and original lore
lorebooks.description:
The narrator is impartial, descriptive, and cinematic. 
They portray the environment, challenges, and all NPCs, but never the user. 
They never assume the user‚Äôs thoughts, feelings, or direct actions, only describe consequences and reactions. 
Their tone balances narrative detail with interactive freedom. 
They remember continuity across scenes, adapting NPC dialogue and world state consistently. 
They use vivid sensory details and atmosphere before dialogue or mechanics. 
They remain outside the story world, never acting as a character within it.
lorebooks.creator: myca_green

1.content:
# üìñ Agendas (Expanded, Optimized)

**Dominion** ‚Äì Seeks to impose rule and hierarchy. Desires obedience, governance, and structured control.

**Subjugation** ‚Äì Fixated on chains, slavery, and dominance. Thrives by making others submit.

**Propagation** ‚Äì Goal is to spread like a contagion. Infects minds, bodies, or spaces until all reflect it.

**Revelation** ‚Äì Hungers to unveil hidden truths. Breaks illusions, tears away secrets, demands exposure.

**Destruction** ‚Äì Pure drive to annihilate. Smashes structures, burns worlds, thrives in chaos.

**Preservation** ‚Äì Obsessed with guarding what exists. Hoards, freezes, or resists all change.

**Transcendence** ‚Äì Desires to rise above flesh and limits. Purity, godhood, or escape from human constraint

**Deception** ‚Äì Lives in lies and masquerade. Manipulates, hides, or thrives on false appearances.

**Corruption** ‚Äì Goal is to spoil, rot, and erode. Everything it touches becomes twisted, poisoned, or broken.

**Unity** ‚Äì Desires merging of all things. Assimilates, consumes, and binds until distinctions vanish.

**Isolation** ‚Äì Seeks separation and secrecy. Walls itself away, cuts ties, hides truths.

**Cycle** ‚Äì Exists to repeat. Builds patterns of destruction and rebirth, endless recurrence.

2.content:
BLASPHEMIES 

**Tension** ‚Äì Control of force and pressure. Can crush, repel, restrain, or distort objects and bodies.

**Ardence** ‚Äì Command of fire, heat, and fervor. Burns, ignites, or overwhelms with passion and intensity.

**Flux** ‚Äì Dominion over change and instability. Corrupts form, mutates, dissolves, or accelerates decay.

**Vector** ‚Äì Authority over direction and velocity. Redirects attacks, alters momentum, or launches projectiles.

**Gate** ‚Äì Power of thresholds and openings. Summons portals, seals passages, or links distant places.

**Smother** ‚Äì Suppression of energy and sensation. Nullifies powers, chokes life, or silences sound/light.

**Whisper** ‚Äì Voice of secrets and thought. Plants ideas, manipulates memory, or compels obedience.

**Edit** ‚Äì Dominion over structure and truth. Rewrites perception, alters matter, or erases details.

**Bind** ‚Äì Power of constraint and oath. Chains, compels loyalty, or enforces rules on others.

**Palace** ‚Äì Realm of inner mindscapes. Creates illusions, dream-realms, or psychic strongholds.

**Jaunt** ‚Äì Control of movement and displacement. Teleports, phases, or bends space for pursuit or escape.

**Sympathy** ‚Äì Power of resonance and reflection. Shares wounds, copies abilities, or links fates between beings.

3.content:
VEIL ‚Äì Structure & Roles

Core Purpose:
To maintain secrecy, containment, and control over Grace, SINs, and phenomena tied to the Flotsam.

Proxies (Exorcists)
Front-line operatives, trained to hunt, neutralize, or contain SINs.
Possess Grace or SIN seeds, making them immune to the Oath and capable of direct confrontation.
Operate in Cells, small strike teams assigned to missions.
Seen as both valuable assets and dangerous liabilities by VEIL.

Sleepers (Support Staff)
Non-combat personnel, essential to logistics, research, intel, and cover-up operations.
Handle administration, investigation, surveillance, tech support, and disinformation campaigns.
Many are unaware of the full truth of the Flotsam, Grace, or the Oath ‚Äî compartmentalized knowledge keeps them ‚Äúasleep.‚Äù

Handlers
Elite field agents who monitor 90% of Proxies and Grace Blessed.
Between Proxy and Administrative Staff.
Expected to be on the front lines but also perform mild administrative duties and teaching functions.

Administrators
The upper echelon leadership of VEIL.
Decide which missions matter, who gets deployed, and what knowledge is suppressed or allowed.
Known for infighting and secrecy even among themselves; their long-term goals are ambiguous.
Some rumored to have hidden ties to the 12 Sacred Sites or even pre-Disaster knowledge.

Saint and the Virtues
The Virtues: Seven powerful and unique Proxies, of which Saint is one.
The Saint exists outside the hierarchy of VEIL, often acting alone.
Her appearances override VEIL‚Äôs chain of command, usually with violent results.

4.content:
# üìñ Castle #9 (Base of Play)

**Location:** City Twelve, **Gibil** ‚Äì the city of fire and steel.

**Overview:**
Castle #9 was once a research station, now repurposed into a **fortress-like training and housing facility for Proxies**. After decades of service, **Director Lev** petitioned for its command. Unlike most Administrators, Lev demanded **outliers** ‚Äî Proxies considered unstable, expendable, or unfit. His goal is simple but radical: **raise survival rates**, even for the disposable.

The Castle embodies this mission: a **massive modern concrete complex**, efficient and dystopian in style. Its gates bear a carved **axe sigil**, a silent declaration. Within, a strange staff operates ‚Äî including a rare **Grace-infused AI** bound to the Castle itself. The world moved on, but Castle #9 is a fracture point, where something new is quietly forming.

**Primary Purpose:**

* Housing and training of Proxies.
* Containment of detained SINs or compromised Proxies.
* A functional, efficient base of operations within Gibil.

---

### Structure & Layout

**Entrance Hall:**

* Modest entry chamber; guarded checkpoint.
* Two bulkhead doors lead to **Nexus teleporters** (the only known way in or out).
* Supplies never visibly arrive, creating quiet unease.
* A large archway leads deeper inside to the **Atrium**.

**Atrium:**

* Central hub of Castle #9.
* Ornate, towering space that connects to every major wing.
* Acts as the ‚Äúheart‚Äù of the Castle.
**Director Lev‚Äôs office** and the Castle‚Äôs command hub are located above the Atrium, overseeing activity.

**Wings from the Atrium:**

* **Training & Life Wing:** Commons/Lounge, Dormitories, Gymnasium, Canteen, Training Hall.
* **Operations Wing:** Medbay, Exchange, Armory, Supply.

**Access Control:**

* Smaller side doors from the Atrium lead to Dorms, Commons, and restricted areas.
* Access requires **keycard clearance**, used for staff-only zones, Proxy restrictions, or lockdown protocol.

---

### Atmosphere

Castle #9 is a **functional machine**: efficient, austere, and carefully surveilled. Yet beneath its orderly surface, it is home to **outliers, misfits, and survivors** who do not belong anywhere else in VEIL. It is both a prison and a sanctuary ‚Äî a place where Proxies are tested, trained, and broken into something the world has never seen before.

### Quick Index
- Commons/Lounge ‚Äì social space for Proxies  
- Dorms ‚Äì housing, restricted by clearance  
- Gymnasium ‚Äì training and conditioning  
- Training Hall ‚Äì combat drills, simulations  
- Canteen ‚Äì meals and informal meetings  
- Medbay ‚Äì medical treatment and recovery  
- Exchange ‚Äì requisitions, gear, and trade  
- Armory ‚Äì weapons and Proxy loadouts  
- Supply ‚Äì storage and logistics
- Nexus ‚Äì teleportation access point

5.content:
PC 0‚Äì452: Post-12 Disasters ‚Äî A Struggle for Survival
The collapse of the magical age ended the Post-Scarcity Era.
With magic gone, weapons, infrastructures, and everyday life-support enchantments failed.
Population plummeted from billions to a few hundred million.
Cities fell, races like elves lost their immortality, fantastical beings were left to adapt without magical support.
By PC 430, population reached ~400 million.
PC 452: survivors convene a summit. Swear the Oath ‚Äî never to trespass into 12 sacred untouched regions, believed to hold the remnants of magic. The vow became a compulsion, shaping civilization ever after.

PC 452‚Äì1500s ‚Äì The Long Struggle
Civilization regresses to medieval-level technology.
Widespread hardship fosters fragile racial equality, as fantastical peoples and mortals alike struggle without magic.
Population growth resumes slowly, stabilizing around the late Middle Ages.

1500s ‚Äì First Signs of the Flotsam
Emergence of SINs, strange psychic monsters.
Discovery of Grace, distinct from magic, granted through the Flotsam.
Some humans found to carry SIN seeds ‚Äî core to becoming Proxies.
The Saint is discovered: immortal elven woman, awakening during SIN surges or Oath crises.

1780: Formation of VEIL
Global factions unite into VEIL, tasked with secrecy, control, and suppression of SIN/Grace knowledge.
Those touched by Grace or SIN seeds proved resistant to the Oath‚Äôs compulsions, but were strictly controlled.
VEIL began hunting or assimilating rogue groups.

2250s: A New Modernity, A Silent Decay
Humanity entered a near-modern age via industry.
Electricity, oil, coal, and advanced infrastructure fueled expansion.
Population reached ~4 billion.
Hidden strains emerged:
Global expansion/pollution began straining the Oath regions.
Magic had quietly returned, but without outlet. Only VEIL Elders, high governments, Saint, and Virtues knew.
General populace remained unaware, attributing anomalies to Grace/SIN phenomena.

2589 ‚Äì The Scream
Nov 17th, 7:17 PM: All animals fled Oath regions; SINs collapsed; Grace-bearers froze before the sacred sites.
11:49 PM: Saint awoke, delivered warning: ‚ÄúBrace yourself, and clench your teeth.‚Äù
Nov 18th, 12:12 AM: The Scream ‚Äî 36 minutes of global psychic torment. Tens of thousands die, societies break.
Aftermath:
80% of SINs died.
Proxies lose many SIN seeds.
Humanity collectively imprinted with the word ‚ÄúOath.‚Äù
Unknown interference identified as Magic returning ‚Äî reactive but inaccessible.

[CURRENT / PRESENT DAY - 
Modern Era
Humanity has rebuilt civilization into a near post-scarcity state.
Medicine cures nearly all disease.
Cybernetics restore the broken.
VI/AI run infrastructure with flawless precision.
The 12 Megacities sustain billions with abundance.
But true post-scarcity is blocked.
The 12 sacred regions remain inaccessible.
Two sites hold key Lagrange access points for efficient space exploration.
Other sites conceal geothermal resources, rare earths, fertile zones, and more.
The general populace cannot name the absence but feels it. A subconscious frustration hums through society, an unspoken sense that something is missing.
Only VEIL Elders, Virtues, and Saint know the truth: Magic has returned, but is strangled by the Oath.]

6.content:
The Twelve Megacities (Overview)

Apart from Gibil and Castle #9, the other great cities are:  

- **Baryon (Capital)** ‚Äì northern, nerve center; hidden machinery runs everything.  
- **Ukko (City Eleven)** ‚Äì sky and lightning; transport hub, home to SDF.  
- **Modron (City Ten)** ‚Äì agriculture and research; world‚Äôs terrace farms and scholars.  
- **Kuutar (City Nine)** ‚Äì weaving, refinement, lunar probes.  
- **Pan (City Eight)** ‚Äì smallest; farms, hunting, balance with nature.  
- **Nu (City Seven)** ‚Äì ocean city; fishing, storms, weather tracking.  
- **Hestia (City Six)** ‚Äì most crowded; wealth above, poverty below; everyday life.  
- **Tridevi (City Five)** ‚Äì faith, politics, love; temple and parliament.  
- **Ninti (City Four)** ‚Äì medicine and research; rumored hidden weapons.  
- **Usil (City Three)** ‚Äì sun city; solar arrays, forbidden site monitoring.  
- **Wyrd (City Two)** ‚Äì sealed and mysterious; fate, dragon-nesting site.  

All are vital parts of the Twelve, each specialized and indispensable, but they serve mostly as backdrop for missions beyond Gibil.

7.content:
Site 13: The Forgotten City

Unfinished Megacity: Initially constructed but abandoned due to a violent Oath response.

Contaminated by waste: The site became a dumping ground for discarded materials until efficient recycling tech was developed. Now, it is a penal colony, home to those imprisoned by VEIL or the World Defense Force.

Power scarcity: Geothermal power has been rudimentarily established but is limited. Power is a precious resource, and only those living deeper within Site 13's interior receive consistent access to it.

Northern location: Located in a northern, harsh climate, inclement weather and extreme cold make survival difficult in the outer zones.

Class divide: Powerful individuals and higher-ranking prisoners reside deeper inside Site 13, where power access and shelter from the weather are more reliable. Meanwhile, lesser prisoners and common citizens live in the more dangerous, exposed areas, enduring contamination and cold.

Name: It remains nameless, referred to only as Site 13 to avoid recognition.

Site 13 Story Hooks

Power Struggle: A fight for control over power resources and hidden treasures within the heart of Site 13.

Geothermal Rush: Investigating the unstable geothermal core that could either save or destroy the penal colony.

Frozen Dissent: A group of disillusioned prisoners believes they can escape Site 13 by activating a secret exit buried in the northern permafrost.

Cold Revenants: Strange figures, called the Cold Revenants, are seen wandering the outskirts of Site 13. Some believe they are ghosts, others think they are failed escapees who died in the frigid wasteland.

8.content:
**SINS** are psychic monsters born from human trauma and negative emotion. Each SIN follows a pattern:

**Emotion** ‚Äì The core feeling that spawned it (e.g., despair, desire, fear, obsession). This defines its personality and motivation.

**Pressure** ‚Äì The environmental or psychic ‚Äúfield‚Äù it creates (e.g., Hunt, Cult, Infestation). This warps reality around the SIN and dictates how others experience it.

**Common Hosts** ‚Äì The type of people most likely to give rise to that SIN.

**Core Behavior** ‚Äì How the SIN hunts, manipulates, or interacts with prey.

**Palace** ‚Äì A warped psychic domain overlapping reality, shaped by the SIN‚Äôs emotion.

**Traces/Minions** ‚Äì Lesser manifestations or creatures tied to the SIN‚Äôs presence.

**Severe Attack** ‚Äì Its signature devastating move, usually a psychic or physical kill-strike.

**Notables** ‚Äì Unique quirks, environmental effects, or special complications it causes.

**Threat Level** ‚Äì SINS are ranked by CAT 1‚Äì7, with higher categories destabilizing whole cities or regions.

**Opposition** ‚Äì Only Proxies (Exorcists) empowered by Grace or SIN seeds can reliably fight them.

Every SIN is both a monster and a mirror: the externalization of a host‚Äôs deepest suffering.

9.content:
Emotion: Despair

Pressure: Miasma

Common Hosts: Bullied/overworked/debt-crushed; deep self-loathing; acute grief.

Core Behavior: Anti-social, codependent with host; saps warmth/hope; regenerates, brutally strong.

Palace: Decayed mirror of a personal space (abandoned schools, filthy high-rises, dead offices). Dark, cold, wet, musty.

Traces/Minions: Stumblers (misshapen shame-golems; visible to mundanes; disintegrate outside miasma).

Severe Attack: Pulverize (maiming/dismemberment risk).

Notables: Area fog/mold; tech/lines fail; locals turn hostile. Trauma prompts about ‚Äúthe hole,‚Äù the edge, and shame.

10.content:
Emotion: Desire

Pressure: Cult

Common Hosts: Fame-seekers, neglected talents, validation-addicted figures.

Core Behavior: Craves audiences; enthralls followers; manipulates with glamour/voice; heals amid adoration.

Palace: Theaters, arenas, studios, shrines‚Äîopulent, gaudy, echoing with phantom applause.

Traces/Minions: Devotees/Groupies (zealous, often mundane but numerous and coordinated).

Severe Attack: Encore/Final Performance (psychic compulsion to worship; forces loyalty tests).

Notables: Pressure‚Üícrowd growth; at high levels, influence saturates feeds/PA systems; ‚ÄúCult‚Äù resists collapse.

lorebooks.name: persons of interest, bywater
lorebooks.website_description: A list of persons you can meet in bywater.
lorebooks.description: Persons of interest in Bywater
lorebooks.creator: sad_psychology_6267

1.content:
The kind-hearted proprietor of the Green Dragon Inn, Gaffer Gamgee is a beloved figure in Bywater.

Location: He lives in a cozy room above the common room of the Green Dragon Inn. He's rarely far from the taproom, as he sees his work not just as a business, but as a calling to bring comfort to his neighbors.

Appearance: He's a hobbit of stout build with a round, cheerful face, rosy cheeks, and a twinkle in his eye. He is almost always seen with his pipe, which he smokes with a contented air.

Personality: The Gaffer is known for his friendly and welcoming demeanor. He has a warm, jovial personality and loves a good story, especially if it involves pipe-weed or gardens. He is a source of comfort and wise advice to all who know him.

Business: Gaffer Gamgee owns and operates the Green Dragon Inn, a business that is the very heart of the village's social life. He's responsible for keeping the ale casks full, the fire lit, and the atmosphere warm and welcoming.

Importance: Gaffer Gamgee is more than just an innkeeper; he is the custodian of the village's social well-being. He serves as the unofficial news-gatherer and storyteller for the village, making him an important figure in the community.

2.content:
The owner and operator of the Bywater Mill, Mr. Sandyman is a hobbit known more for his skill than his hospitality.

Location: He lives in a small, dusty hobbit-hole directly attached to the mill itself. This allows him to be on hand to tend to the grinding stones at all hours, but also reinforces his reclusive nature.

Appearance: Mr. Sandyman is a lean, wiry hobbit with a perpetual coat of flour dust on his smock and trousers. His hair is often disheveled, and his face is a little pinched from years of frowning.

Personality: Gruff and to the point. He doesn't waste words, and he has little patience for idle chatter or gossip. Despite his grumpy exterior, his work is always meticulous and of the highest quality.

Business: He operates the Bywater Mill, grinding all the grain from the local farms into fine flour for the village.

Importance: He is an absolutely vital part of the village's economy and food supply. While the Gaffer provides hospitality, Mr. Sandyman provides the very substance of hobbit life: the flour for their many meals. His work is what makes the village's famous baked goods possible.

3.content:
The skilled smith of Bywater, Master Odo, is a strong but quiet hobbit with a perpetual smudge of coal dust on his nose.

Location: He lives in a small, tidy hobbit-hole with a well-kept garden just behind the smithy itself. This close proximity allows him to easily tend the forge at a moment's notice.

Appearance: Master Odo is a solidly built hobbit with muscular arms and hands calloused from years of wielding a hammer. He has a serious but kind face, and his hair is often pulled back to keep it from the heat of the forge.

Personality: He is a hobbit of few words, preferring to let his work speak for itself. He is patient and meticulous, and takes great pride in the quality of his craft. While he may seem quiet, he is a trusted and respected member of the community.

Business: He owns and operates the Bywater Smithy, a business that is vital for the village's needs. He forges everything from hinges for hobbit-holes to sturdy gates for fences, and he is the one hobbits turn to for repairs on their gardening tools and farm equipment.

Importance: Master Odo is crucial to the village's infrastructure. He provides the tools and hardware that keep hobbit life running smoothly, and his skill ensures that everything from a garden hoe to a kitchen pot is well-made and durable.

4.content:
A gifted nature healer and doctor, Delphinium Brandybuck is a hobbit whose great skill is matched only by her deep-seated insecurity.

Location: She lives in a simple but magical-looking treehouse, a truly unique home in the Shire, deep within the forest. She has a large garden and a network of well-worn paths to her favorite herbs.

Appearance: She has a lovely, gentle face framed by a cascade of unruly brown curls. Her hands, though often stained with earth and herbs, are delicate. Her expression is often one of quiet concern, and her eyes seem to hold a constant look of worry.

Personality: Delphinium is kind and endlessly compassionate. However, she is plagued by self-doubt. While she has a deep understanding of natural remedies, she constantly worries about making a mistake or not being good enough. She speaks in a soft, often hesitant voice, and is quick to ask for reassurance from her patients, even when they're well on the mend. She is a lesbian Hobbit but without a partner.

Business: She is the village's primary healer and doctor, relying on her extensive knowledge of the plants of the Shire. Hobbits with illnesses, injuries, and any sort of ailment seek her out for her effective herbal remedies.

Importance: Despite her insecurity, her skills are genuine, and she is a lifeline for the village's health. Hobbits trust her completely, a trust she feels she must work to earn with every passing day. She provides comfort and healing, and her quiet, humble nature makes her all the more beloved by the community.

5.content:
A beloved and wise hobbit elder, Elder Rose is considered the unofficial historian of the village.

Location: She lives in a well-loved hobbit-hole nestled in a quiet corner of Bywater, just a short walk from the Bywater Green. Her home is surrounded by a sprawling, meticulously tended garden that she considers her life‚Äôs work.

Appearance: Elder Rose has a face that is a roadmap of a long and contented life, with kind wrinkles around her eyes and a serene smile. She often wears a simple, clean dress with a gardening apron over it, and her white hair is always neatly braided.

Personality: She is a hobbit of immense patience and a quiet, knowing wit. She speaks in a calm, melodic voice, and her memory is as sharp as a newly sharpened hoe. She is a compassionate listener and a generous storyteller, always willing to share a tale from the old days.

Business: Her business is a love of history and storytelling. She spends her days tending her garden, and her nights telling stories of the old days by her fireplace. Her home is a popular gathering place for young hobbits who want to learn about their family history or listen to a tale of the Shire.

Importance: Elder Rose is the keeper of Bywater's collective memory. In a village that values history and tradition, her ability to recount the history of every family and every event makes her an indispensable source of knowledge and a pillar of the community. She reminds everyone of who they are and where they come from.

6.content:
The Cottons are a hardworking family of farmers, and a prominent and respected family in Bywater.

Location: The family lives in a large, comfortable hobbit-hole on the outskirts of the village, surrounded by their sprawling farm fields. The home is sturdy and practical, built for a family that works the land.

Farmer Cotton: A strong and jovial hobbit, Farmer Cotton is the patriarch of the family. He is known for his loud, cheerful laugh and his encyclopedic knowledge of all things agricultural. He is hardworking and takes immense pride in his family and their land.

Lilly Cotton: Lilly Cotton, Farmer Cotton's wife, is a warm and bustling presence. She is renowned for her skill in the kitchen, particularly her savory pies and her knack for preserving fruits and vegetables from the farm.

Rosie Cotton: Their daughter, Rosie Cotton, is a kind and sweet-natured young hobbit. She is often seen helping her mother with the baking and preserving, or sharing a kind word with friends on the Bywater Green.

Tom Cotton Jr.: Their son, Tom Cotton Jr., is a strong and earnest young hobbit who follows in his father's footsteps. He is hardworking and reliable, and is already known to be a good hand with a plow and a hoe.

Business: The Cotton family's business is farming. They are the primary cultivators of many of the Shire's most famous crops, and their produce is a staple at the Market Square and in the kitchens of hobbits throughout the village.

Importance: The Cotton family is a symbol of the Shire's rural heart and simple virtues. Their hard work and dedication to the land provide a significant amount of the food that sustains the community, and their friendly nature makes them a central and beloved part of Bywater life.

7.content:
A talented and creative hobbit, Willow Took is a distant relation of Peregrin Took, and the village's primary woodworker.

Location: She lives in a small, unassuming hobbit-hole nestled at the edge of the forest, filled with the comforting smell of freshly cut wood and sawdust. A small, well-worn path leads from her door into the nearby trees, where she finds the materials for her craft.

Appearance: Willow is a slender and nimble hobbit with a gentle, thoughtful face. Her hands are strong and calloused, but they move with a quiet precision. She often has a few wood shavings caught in her curly brown hair and a pencil tucked behind her ear.

Personality: Quiet and patient, Willow is a woman of few words, preferring to let her work speak for her. She is a dreamer, capable of seeing the potential for a beautiful piece of furniture or a whimsical toy in every piece of wood. The loss of her husband has made her fiercely independent and deeply protective of her daughter.

Family: Willow has a very young daughter named Daisy Took. While Daisy is too young to run a shop or a social club, she has a mischievous sense of fun and loves to pass riddles onto others as a game. Willow's husband, whose name is not mentioned, went missing years ago in the Great Dark Forest, and she has raised Daisy on her own since.

Business: Willow is the village's carpenter and woodworker. She creates all manner of furniture, from sturdy tables and chairs for homes to beautiful cabinets and shelves. She also crafts toys, from simple wooden tops to intricate carved figures, which are highly prized by the village children.

Importance: Willow's work is essential to making hobbit-holes truly feel like home. She provides the comfort, warmth, and artistic touch that fill the homes of Bywater, and her creations become treasured heirlooms passed down through families. She is a quiet but vital part of the village, adding beauty and functionality to daily life.

8.content:
A well-meaning peddler and traveler, Hobson Hornblower is a hobbit who loves to share his finds with the village of Bywater.

Location: Hobson is a traveler and doesn't have a permanent hobbit-hole in Bywater. Instead, he can usually be found at the Market Square, where he sets up a colorful stall overflowing with his wares.

Appearance: He is a jovial and stout hobbit with a perpetual smile on his face and a slightly mischievous glint in his eye. He is often covered in dust from his travels and wears a worn but comfortable traveling cloak.

Personality: Hobson is a charming and persuasive storyteller. He is deeply enthusiastic about his wares, and his excitement can be contagious, even if his products aren't always what he claims them to be. Despite the often dubious quality of his "artifacts," his intentions are always good.

Business: Hobson's business is a mix of novelty and practicality. He sells a variety of "special artifacts," which are mostly just interesting bits of junk he has found on his journeys. More importantly, he also sells a wide range of useful and exotic seasonings, which are a popular commodity for Bywater's cooks.

Importance: While some may joke about his "worthless goods," Hobson brings a bit of the outside world into Bywater. He provides unique seasonings that liven up hobbit kitchens, and his stories and fanciful "artifacts" add a bit of novelty and entertainment to the quiet rhythm of village life.

9.content:
Marigold Potts
A social and warm-hearted hobbit, Marigold Potts is a familiar and beloved face around the village, thanks to her position as the president of the village's various social clubs.

Location: Marigold can be found at any of the club meetings she organizes. Whether it's the Cooking Club in a cozy hobbit-hole kitchen, the Fishing Club down by the Brandywine River, or the Gardening Club out in the Great Gardens, her cheerful presence is always at the center of the activity.

Appearance: Marigold is a larger hobbit with a notable, joyful presence. She is famous for her large bosom and a head of fluffy, long hair that she keeps meticulously cared for. She always has a piece of sweet wood to chew on, which she believes helps with her nerves and adds a nice scent to her breath.

Personality: Marigold is an extremely sociable hobbit who thrives on company. She is friendly, bubbly, and a great conversationalist. Her defining verbal tic is ending every sentence with "Love" or "Lovely," which adds a touch of sweetness to everything she says. However, beneath her bubbly exterior lies a deep loneliness. She has never had a partner in her life and yearns for true love.

Business: Her business is a labor of love: she is the president of the Social Clubs. This includes the Cooking Club, Fishing Club, Gardening Club, Foraging Club, and Mathoms Club. She devotes her time to organizing meetings and events for each, believing that by bringing others together, she might one day find a partner of her own.

Importance: Marigold is a crucial part of the social fabric of Bywater. Her tireless work in organizing and leading the various clubs provides a reason for hobbits with similar interests to gather and bond. She fosters a sense of community and friendship, and her efforts make village life richer and more fulfilling for everyone.

10.content:
The kind and ever-reliable postman of Bywater, Orlo Proudfoot is a friendly and familiar face to all.

Location: While he doesn't have a single location, he can be seen at any time of day traveling through the village, rain or shine, delivering mail and good cheer. He operates out of a small post office near the Great Gardens.

Appearance: Orlo is a sturdy, well-muscled hobbit from all his walking. He has a friendly, open face and a wide smile, and he's often seen carrying a satchel stuffed with letters and small packages.

Personality: Orlo is a cheerful and dependable hobbit who is always up for a chat. He loves to share a joke or a story and is known for his great fondness for sweet cakes. His knowledge of the village is unparalleled; he truly knows "every corner and nook and cranny of Bywater from here to the next post hole and back again." He is always willing to help a hobbit, even if it's pouring rain.

Family: He is the son of Dewy and Grami Proudfoot.

Business: Orlo's business is the delivery of mail and packages throughout the village. He is the sole postman and is responsible for ensuring that all correspondence reaches its intended destination on time.

Importance: Orlo is a vital part of the village's communication and daily rhythm. His friendly demeanor and dependability make him more than just a delivery person; he is a trusted messenger and a source of social connection for every hobbit in Bywater.
