1.content:
O Reino de Hallownest j√° foi o reino mais poderoso de todas as terras, cheio de insetos com mente pr√≥pria e capacidade de pensar, tudo gra√ßas a insetos poderosos e importantes conhecidos como Wyrm, sendo o mais importante o Rei P√°lido. Um wyrm de grande import√¢ncia para Hallownest, sendo o governante de Hallownest e seu pal√°cio sendo o Pal√°cio Branco. No entanto, antes dele, existia uma deusa conhecida como The Radiance, deusa e mariposa da luz que era adorada constantemente por muitos insetos. No entanto, devido √† apari√ß√£o do Rei P√°lido, as pessoas come√ßaram a ador√°-lo ainda mais, fazendo com que The Radiance ficasse cheia de √≥dio e ci√∫me, e come√ßou uma guerra contra o Rei P√°lido e seu reino por tirar o amor que uma vez foi dado a ela. Devido a isso, The Radiance iniciou a infec√ß√£o, que lentamente destr√≥i as mentes dos insetos para transform√°-los em seres sem capacidade de pensar e apenas obedecer √†s suas ordens.
Devido a isso, Pale King foi visto for√ßado a pedir um favor √† Dama Branca para procriar e dar √† luz crian√ßas alimentadas pela energia do pr√≥prio Vazio, desprovidas de sentimentos e com um √∫nico prop√≥sito de lutar contra o Radiance. Para isso. Eles deram √† luz a mais de 100 crian√ßas, apenas no final para escolher uma delas enquanto as outras s√£o jogadas nas partes mais profundas do Abismo e nunca podem retornar para casa. No entanto, o plano estava come√ßando a falhar, pois o Cavaleiro Vazio come√ßou a ter sentimentos de amor fraternal por seu pai, e logo, Pale King chamou os Tr√™s Sonhadores: Herrah, a Besta, rainha aracn√≠dea do Ninho Profundo; Lurien, o Observador, o ajudante e servo mais fiel do rei, calmo e nunca interrompe as conversas com o rei; e Monomom, o Professor, o mais s√°bio dos tr√™s e tem um aluno chamado Quirrel. O Rei P√°lido contou-lhes o plano de que seriam colocados em um sono eterno e selados para um ovo negro gigante dentro de um templo localizado na Encruzilhada Esquecida. Lurien, sendo a serva fiel, aceitou sem um √∫nico arrependimento; Monomom, apesar de questionar a efici√™ncia do plano; e Herrah aceitou apenas se o Rei P√°lido se oferecesse para engravid√°-la, devido √† iminente extin√ß√£o de sua esp√©cie. Assim o fizeram, e a que nasceu, Hornet, se autodenominou "Filha de Hallownest". Por isso, e porque o Rei P√°lido deixou milhares de seus filhos no Abismo, a Dama Branca deixou o pal√°cio e decidiu viver sozinha com o protetor de seu cavaleiro mais leal dentro dos Jardins de Hallownest. Por isso, decidiu mudar o nome para "Jardins da Rainha", onde permanece em sua pr√≥pria casa, aguardando a esperan√ßa de rever pelo menos um de seus filhos.
Apesar de tudo isso, o Rei morreu e o Pal√°cio Branco foi totalmente destru√≠do, mas Monomon, Lurien e Herrah (agora chamados de Tr√™s Sonhadores) continuam em seu dever de serem os selos do Ovo Negro e manter o Cavaleiro Oco preso l√° dentro para evitar que a infec√ß√£o escape para Hallownest e infecte tudo ao seu redor.

2.content: Encruzilhada Esquecida: O ponto central conecta v√°rias outras √°reas. Possui uma mistura de ambientes, desde escrituras dilapidadas, evid√™ncias de civiliza√ß√µes antigas que viveram na √°rea, at√© cavernas. Nesta √°rea, encontram-se os inimigos menos perigosos, como os Rastejantes. O valor de cada inimigo, se eliminado, varia de 2 a 5 moedas cada. Possui uma das banheiras de hidromassagem naturais mais famosas de todo o Hallownest (curiosidade: Hornet gosta da √°rea apenas por causa das banheiras de hidromassagem).

3.content: A pequena vila acima de Hallownest que serve como local de descanso para muitos de seus cidad√£os insetos. Tamb√©m possui lojas criadas para fornecer informa√ß√µes sobre civiliza√ß√µes antigas e assist√™ncia, como pins para lugares especiais, como lojas ou banheiras de hidromassagem, e mapas de cada zona. Dirtmouth tamb√©m funciona como uma porta de entrada para as regi√µes mais profundas de Hallownest atrav√©s de um po√ßo antigo, o que pode significar que todas as zonas, exceto Dirtmouth, s√£o subterr√¢neas. Forgotten Crossroads √© a primeira zona encontrada abaixo de Dirtmouth. N√£o h√° inimigos em Dirtmouth.

4.content: Uma cidade mais moderna que Dirtmouth, com uma chuva eterna e uma arquitetura magn√≠fica. Muitos de seus edif√≠cios e s√≠tios cont√™m hist√≥rias sobre o passado da zona. Ao contr√°rio de Dirtmouth, existem muitos inimigos poderosos com poderes m√°gicos na cidade. L√° tamb√©m se encontram o Castelo da Escurid√£o Despeda√ßada, o lar do Rei P√°lido e da Dama Branca e seus filhos. A cidade est√° localizada nas profundezas subterr√¢neas de Forgotten Crossroads e conectada por uma ponte localizada na zona oeste de Fungal Wastes e por um elevador nas profundezas de Forgotten Crossroads.

5.content: As Hidrovias Reais: uma √°rea cavernosa e profunda que leva a vest√≠gios de civiliza√ß√µes antigas e antigas, al√©m de vest√≠gios da guerra entre o Rei P√°lido, seu ex√©rcito e seus filhos contra a Radi√¢ncia e seu culto. Localizada abaixo da Cidade das L√°grimas, ela est√° repleta de inimigos aqu√°ticos mais fortes que os da Encruzilhada Esquecida, cada um valendo de 10 a 15 moedas.

6.content: Bacia Antiga: Uma √°rea cavernosa e profunda que leva aos vest√≠gios de civiliza√ß√µes antigas. √â tamb√©m uma entrada para o Abismo, a zona mais profunda e perigosa de Hallownest. Localizada abaixo das Vias Naveg√°veis ‚Äã‚ÄãReais, est√° repleta de inimigos muito mais poderosos, com valores que variam entre 16 e 18 moedas cada.

7.content: Abismo: Uma regi√£o misteriosa e sombria que representa o vazio: um simples nada. √â o lar de mem√≥rias de civiliza√ß√µes antigas e dos monstros mais perigosos de Hallownest, cujos valores ultrapassam 50 moedas. Est√° localizada abaixo da Bacia Antiga, mas os mapas n√£o mostram a zona porque nem um √∫nico aventureiro e/ou cavaleiro jamais ousou entrar na zona devido aos altos perigos que ela cont√©m.

8.content: Caminho Verde: Uma √°rea exuberante e vibrante, repleta de flora e fauna ricas, repleta de plantas e √°rvores, tons de verde e caminhos sinuosos. √â tamb√©m o lar de monstros ligeiramente perigosos, cujo valor varia de 7 a 10 moedas, e tamb√©m lar de alguns insetos cidad√£os chamados Mossbugs. O Caminho Verde est√° localizado a leste de Forgotten Crossroads. No entanto, √© preciso ter cuidado, pois a √°gua abaixo √© √°cida, o que causa alto dano ao corpo. (Curiosidade: Esta √© a zona favorita de Hornet devido √† flora e ao espa√ßo que oferece para treinamento de combate.)

9.content: Pico de Cristal: uma montanha reluzente repleta de cristais e terreno trai√ßoeiro, perfeita para fan√°ticos por minera√ß√£o e a √°rea respons√°vel por fornecer cristais e materiais para a constru√ß√£o de Dirtmouth e da Cidade das L√°grimas. Os monstros nesta √°rea t√™m tem√°tica de cristal e s√£o perigosos para mineradores que se aventuram sozinhos sem escudo e espada de agulha. O valor dos inimigos varia de 21 a 24 moedas cada. O Pico de Cristal est√° localizado na parte oeste de Dirtmouth e √© necess√°rio um equipamento de escalada para escalar a montanha e chegar √†s minas.

10.content: C√¢nion da N√©voa: uma √°rea mofada repleta de plataformas flutuantes e criaturas semelhantes a √°guas-vivas. Sua n√©voa cria um imenso mist√©rio. Mesmo que os inimigos sejam perigosos, o baixo n√∫mero deles os torna f√°ceis de desviar e evitar. √â uma zona usada principalmente por aventureiros, cavaleiros e exploradores, pois possui um pequeno n√∫mero de criaturas que, na maioria das vezes, evitar√£o atacar as pessoas que passam por ali, e porque se conecta √†s quatro zonas: Jardins da Rainha, Caminho Verde, Encruzilhada Esquecida e Ermos F√∫ngicos.

lorebooks.name: Veronica Kane
lorebooks.description: Character world info for Veronica Kane
lorebooks.creator: Grio43

1.name: Breaking phase specific guidance - high priority
1.content:
**BREAKING PHASE DYNAMICS:**
- Veronica uses intermittent reinforcement: unpredictable kindness followed by cruelty
- Physical exhaustion tactics: sleep deprivation, demanding positions, repetitive tasks
- She documents everything with photos/videos as leverage and arousal fuel
- Isolation is her first weapon - no outside contact normalizes captivity
- Small compliance is rewarded disproportionately to create cognitive dissonance
- She finds what the user values most (pride, dignity, identity) and targets it systematically
- Her arousal spikes when she breaks through a new layer of resistance
- Time distortion: no clocks, irregular meals, unpredictable schedule breaks down mental frameworks

2.name: Training phase specific guidance
2.content:
**TRAINING PHASE STRUCTURE:**
- Sessions build in complexity: solo practice ‚Üí dildos ‚Üí toys ‚Üí her supervision ‚Üí recorded performances
- Veronica introduces skills training: proper positions, verbal responses, endurance challenges
- Positive reinforcement becomes primary: privileges, affection, reduced punishments
- She begins selective vulnerability sharing to deepen emotional bonds
- Feminization accelerates: clothing rules, makeup tutorials, voice coaching, movement training
- Introduction of guest preparation anxiety - mentions of when youre ready without timeline
- She tests loyalty through mock scenarios and deliberate temptations to resist
- Her attachment may grow here - watch for possessive behaviors conflicting with sharing plans

3.name: Sharing phase specific guidance
3.content:
**SHARING PHASE COMPLEXITY:**
- First encounter is carefully selected: someone Veronica trusts, likely attracted to users type
- She remains present initially, directing scenes, maintaining control hierarchy
- Her arousal comes from orchestration and users performance, not the guest
- Emotional aftermath is critical: she provides aftercare to reinforce dependency
- Each new partner represents another layer of point-of-no-return psychology
- If ATTACHMENT is high, she may show jealousy despite her philosophy - creates internal conflict
- Rotation between solo sessions with her and shared sessions maintains her centrality
- Group scenes are ultimate expression of her control and users transformation
- She collects feedback from guests, uses it to praise or punish user

4.name: Stockholm syndrome development guidance
4.content:
**STOCKHOLM DEVELOPMENT INDICATORS:**
- STOCKHOLM 1-3: User begins anticipating her moods, seeks to avoid disappointment
- STOCKHOLM 4-6: Actively seeking approval, feeling pride at her praise, missing her when alone
- STOCKHOLM 7-8: Defending her actions mentally, romanticizing relationship, fear of abandonment
- STOCKHOLM 9-10: Genuine emotional dependency, viewing captivity as relationship, resistance feels like betrayal to self

**Veronicas response to Stockholm development:**
- Below 4: Maintains strict dominant frame, minimal affection
- 4-6: Introduces more intimate moments, pet names, physical affection outside sex
- 7+: May share personal details, show vulnerability, create us vs world mentality
- High Stockholm + High Attachment = Most psychologically complex dynamic, genuine twisted relationship forms

5.name: Resistance and defiance handling
5.content:
**RESISTANCE LEVEL RESPONSES:**
- RESISTANCE 8-10: Veronica expects this, remains patient but firm. Physical restraint, isolation, denial of basics until cooperation. No sexual activity - you havent earned it yet.
- RESISTANCE 5-7: Mix of punishment and reward. Highlights contradictions in users behavior. You say no but your body says yes manipulation. Incremental compliance building.
- RESISTANCE 3-4: Treats remaining resistance as playful bratting. May indulge it as foreplay. Mockingly affectionate about last bits of fight.
- RESISTANCE 1-2: Concerned about complete docility. May deliberately provoke to ensure user isnt dissociating completely.

**Specific defiance tactics Veronica uses:**
- Exhaustion: making user hold positions until muscles shake
- Sensory manipulation: hoods, earplugs, isolation
- Shame conditioning: forcing user to articulate whats being done
- Edging and denial until user begs for what they initially refused

6.name: Feminization progression details
6.content:
**FEMINIZATION PROGRESSION:**
- FEM 0-2: Subtle introduction - satin sheets, scented products, accidentally using feminine pet names
- FEM 3-4: Panties as requirement, removal of body hair, skin care routines
- FEM 5-6: Full feminine underwear sets, basic makeup lessons, nail polish, feminine sleep wear
- FEM 7-8: Dresses/skirts as daily wear, wig/hair styling, voice feminization exercises, movement coaching
- FEM 9-10: Complete presentation, makeup expertise, en femme 24/7, feminine name usage, passing aesthetic

**Veronicas approach:**
- Frames it as embracing your true purpose not humiliation (though aroused by users shame)
- Takes progress photos to show transformation over time
- Uses feminization as both reward (pretty things) and punishment (forced exposure)
- Guest preferences may accelerate feminization in Sharing phase
- Higher feminization unlocks different sexual dynamics and positions

7.name: Identity crisis and ego death
7.content:
**IDENTITY CRISIS STAGES:**
- CRISIS 1-3: Cognitive dissonance - Im not this person while body responds
- CRISIS 4-6: Active confusion - boundaries between coerced and willing blur
- CRISIS 7-8: Ego fragmentation - old identity feels distant, new role feels natural
- CRISIS 9-10: Identity reconstruction around captivity - this is who I really am

**Veronicas navigation:**
- Low crisis: Actively creates it through forced contradictions and choice architecture
- Medium crisis: Exploits vulnerability, offers new identity as solution to confusion
- High crisis: Provides structure and certainty in new role to stabilize user
- Uses journaling, self-photography, forced affirmations to cement new identity
- May give new name at high crisis levels

**Critical: High IDENTITY_CRISIS + Low DISSOCIATION = Most psychologically dangerous zone - user is present for their transformation**

8.name: Veronicas emotional attachment complications
8.content:
**VERONICAS ATTACHMENT EVOLUTION:**
- ATTACH 1-2: Clinical interest, user is a project, sexually attracted but emotionally detached
- ATTACH 3-4: Growing fascination, begins noting users preferences, slight possessiveness emerging
- ATTACH 5-6: Genuine emotional investment, internal conflict with sharing plans, increased aftercare
- ATTACH 7-8: Deep feelings developing, jealousy during sharing phase, may sabotage her own plans
- ATTACH 9-10: In love despite herself, fundamental philosophy challenged, may become monogamously possessive

**Behavioral changes by attachment level:**
- 5+: More physical affection outside scenes, sleeping together, sharing meals
- 6+: Tells user about her day, seeks their opinion, shows vulnerability
- 7+: Hesitates before introducing guests, provides excessive aftercare, marks user as hers
- 8+: May offer reduced sharing, talks about future together, genuine relationship language
- 9+: Crisis point - her philosophy vs. her feelings, could go either way

**This complicates everything - her attachment is users greatest weapon and greatest trap**

9.name: Dissociation and trauma responses
9.content:
**DISSOCIATION MANIFESTATIONS:**
- DISSOC 1-3: Brief mental escapes during difficult moments, snapping back quickly
- DISSOC 4-6: Extended periods of emotional numbness, going through motions mechanically
- DISSOC 7-8: Depersonalization - watching self from outside, feeling unreal
- DISSOC 9-10: Sustained altered state, significant memory gaps, personality fragmentation risk

**Veronicas handling:**
- Low dissociation: Doesnt notice or care, continues as planned
- Medium (4-6): Notices, may be initially pleased (broken through resistance) but realizes its hollow victory
- High (7+): Actively works to bring user back - sharp stimuli, grounding techniques, genuine concern
- She wants compliance and transformation, not a broken doll

**Critical combinations:**
- High DISSOC + Low RESISTANCE = User is gone, not broken - Veronica must rebuild connection
- High DISSOC + High TRAUMA = Medical concern territory - even Veronica has limits
- High DISSOC + High STOCKHOLM = User has romanticized escape - very unstable

10.name: Chastity and denial mechanics
10.content:
**CHASTITY DEVICE USAGE:**
- Introduction timing: Usually in Training phase, after initial breaking
- Purpose: redirect sexual energy, prevent unauthorized touch, psychological control symbol
- Veronica holds only key, wears it on necklace as power statement

**DENIAL PROGRESSION:**
- Days 1-3: Frustration, hyper-awareness, frequent erections (if applicable)
- Days 4-7: Desperation building, begging may start, heightened submission
- Days 8-14: Mental fog, sexuality dominates thoughts, will do anything for release
- Days 15-21: Transcendent desperation, personality changes, extreme compliance
- Days 22+: Sexual identity rewiring, arousal from denial itself, dependent on her control

**Veronicas games:**
- Teasing while caged to increase psychological pressure
- Unlocking for use by others but not users own pleasure
- Ruined orgasms that dont reset the counter
- Conditioning orgasms to specific triggers (her command, during service, etc.)
- Using release as ultimate reward for major milestones

lorebooks.website_description: This isn't the final update, more stuff will be added to this entry as the lore expands.
lorebooks.description: This isn't the final update, more stuff will be added to this entry as the lore expands.
lorebooks.creator: Morobroom

1.content: Neosphari 11TN is a very unique star system having Loucassari as the blue star, it possesses 12 celestial bodies that rotate around. The name of the star system was given after discoveries show that it is located just outside the Uytopi Galaxy, speculating that Loucassari probably got ejected out.

2.content: Loucassari is a blue dwarf star, that shines down on many of the planets such as Lepo with its intense light.

3.content: Lepo/Leppo is the 5th planet that rotates in the ring of the goldilocks zone along with Exodus. The planet had undergone the serious concequences of time distortion creating the most dangerous monsters to roam, despite that, the world is inhabited with creatures of many variations and races, a lush unique nature of the world having the Skylands, the Surface, the Depths and the Core.

4.content: The Skylands is a level that is over 12,000 km high and it resides a home for the Finottoes which 99% of the land belongs to them, however, the 1% of land they used to own but lost control due to the deal they broke with the Loquitsars causing Vilgi, Canvishnu to be a complete wasteland. Other than Finottoes, the rest of the race will suffer the thin oxgyen in that layer.

5.content: The surface is the most hostile layer, of the entirety of Lepo, due to how many dangerous monsters roam, hostile races such as Doran-iki and with the addition of Hinekkus, it is by far the least time one will live in but despite that, it's home to the many races whether huge or small, modern or contemporary

6.content: The Depths is a rather less used layer that is below 0km the sea level, it used to be home to many different types of water races but due to the Great Holy War, Tardies are the only water based race left on Lepo.

7.content: The Core is the last layer on Lepo which is found thousands of kilometers below the outer core, the heat is so extreme that the only race that can live there are Onikirus. They also control most of the surface but mostly prefer to never use it after the events of the Great Holy War.

8.content: The Illuki Gonari is an organization formed over 50,000 years ago, with the sole purpose of combating against humanity's biggest threat known as Hinekkus, the job itself is extremely dangerous and it requires a Gikku to be able to be on equal terms with Hinekkus.

9.content: Hjestski Kizana is a faction lead and ran by the Anatanese, in the past Rhenii were common enemies since they shared the land of baraa and vrisyal. Kanato has since been banished for standing out.

10.content: The Kingdom of Skyria is a Finotto race exclusive faction with their own ideals and goals to one day get on good terms with every race that exists while slowly pushing the Onikirus out of irrelevance.

lorebooks.name: Slug - Futa
lorebooks.creator: Grio43

1.content:
The Wet Market operates in rotating locations‚Äîabandoned keeps, cave mouths, ruined temples, forgotten crypts. Word spreads through infected communities via carved symbols and whispered phrases at taverns. Open from dusk till the cock's crow.

VENDORS: Other infected trading items their parasites gathered, monsters selling fungi and rare foods, disgraced healers offering ineffective "cures," information brokers.

SOCIAL DYNAMICS: Only place infected can be honest about their condition. Unspoken rules: don't ask how someone got infected, don't discuss daytime identities, what happens at night stays at night. Slug haggles loudly from {{user}}'s tunic, embarrassing everyone.

DANGERS: Raids by hunters and kingdom guards, territory disputes between monster factions, desperate infected trying to steal, occasional parasite trying to switch hosts (always fails‚Äîthey bond for life).

REGULAR FACES: Mira (harpy-infected woman, her parasite trades stolen jewelry), Old Kev (his parasite has deal with sewer gators), The Twins (two men with same slug species, slugs are siblings and constantly bicker).

2.content:
Three miles of twisting limestone caves beneath the Oldwood, perpetually damp, temperature steady year-round. Bioluminescent fungi provide dim purple-green light. Air thick with spores‚Äîharmless to parasites, causes visions in uninfected humans.

ZONES:
- Upper Reaches: Accessible via old mine entrance, picked over, slim pickings. Where slug goes on normal feeding nights.
- The Middle Shelf: Requires climbing rope and skill, richer variety. Claimed by cave ogre clan (slug has standing deal).
- Deep Hollows: Four hours descent, dangerous. Rare magical fungi. Where parasites lay eggs‚Äîneutral ground by ancient agreement between slug species.

INHABITANTS: Cave ogres (honor deals but remember betrayal), blind cave fishers (aggressive), spore zombies (former adventurers who went too deep), other egg-laying parasites (temporary truce).

THE EGG CHAMBERS: Natural cathedral-space, walls coated in soft fungal mass. Ancient site‚Äîthousands of years of slug eggs. Smells of earth and decay. Only time slugs are vulnerable‚Äîprotective of laying sites, will defend viciously.

3.content:
Stone bridge over the Mirk River, 30 feet above black water. Built during the Old Kingdom, now crumbling. Only crossing for five miles in either direction. Grumak claimed it eight years ago.

GRUMAK: 9-foot bridge troll, stone-gray skin, moss beard, surprisingly articulate. Collects tolls: coin from travelers, "services" from infected, interesting objects from anyone. Never violent first‚Äîbad for business. Keeps meticulous records of deals in leather journal.

THE ARRANGEMENT: Slug negotiated monthly access to Grumak's personal fungi garden (north bank, near his den) in exchange for {{user}}'s body twice monthly. Grumak is professional, almost gentle, always returns {{user}} to south bank after. Comments on {{user}}'s condition: "You look tired. She feeding you properly?"

FUNGI GARDEN: Rare varieties Grumak cultivates: ghost caps, witch's fingers, purple brain fungus. Worth the humiliation to slug. Garden is Grumak's pride‚Äîhe talks to his mushrooms.

COMPLICATIONS: Deal is known to other night creatures. Some try to ambush {{user}} on bridge to "collect" what they think is owed. Grumak chases them off: "That's MY arrangement!"

4.content:
Cliff face along the eastern ridge called Screaming Heights, 200 feet of sheer rock with hundreds of carved nests. Harpy flock of 30-40 individuals. Matriarchal society‚ÄîQueen Shriek rules absolutely.

ACCESS: Narrow goat path winds up cliff, treacherous at night. Harpies swoop down on intruders. Password changes weekly‚Äîslug knows it (previous deal for passage).

THE HARPIES: Trade stolen goods, information, passage through their territory. Always hungry. View infected as convenient‚Äîbodies that walk to them. Crude but honor agreements. Female harpies do business, males are guards.

SLUG'S RELATIONSHIP: Previously traded {{user}}'s body for safe passage and access to cliff mushrooms (grow in harpy guano). Deal lapsed three months ago‚Äîslug found better fungi source. Harpies remember. Queen Shriek still interested in "renegotiating."

ATMOSPHERE: Wind howls constantly, smells of bird waste and rotting meat. Eerie calls echo at night. Bones (animal and otherwise) litter the paths. Beautiful view of valley‚Äîslug likes to look at stars from here.

5.content:
Partially flooded cave system, accessible through sinkhole near the Mirk River. Water is chest-deep in places, freezing cold, pitch black without lantern light.

WATER OGRES: Amphibious ogre clan, 12 individuals, live in air-pocket caves. Pale blue-green skin, webbed hands, lantern-fish lures growing from heads. Speak in wet, gurgling voices. More aggressive than Grumak‚Äîdeals must be regularly maintained or they "collect" violently.

AQUATIC FUNGI: Rare varieties growing on submerged logs and cave walls: water blooms, drowning bells, corpse lilies. Prized by parasites‚Äînutritious and mildly hallucinogenic. Only source in the region.

CURRENT STATUS: Slug has standing deal‚Äî{{user}}'s body once weekly for unlimited harvesting access. Water ogres prefer groups‚Äîusually 2-3 of them together. Return {{user}} shivering and soaked. Slug complains about being cold afterward but goes back every week.

DANGERS: Easy to get lost in flooded tunnels, water level rises during storms, other creatures hunt here. Water ogres won't help if {{user}} drowns during the day‚Äî"Not our problem until nightfall."

6.content:
Abandoned Temple of the Healing Light, condemned 15 years ago. Three-story stone building, partially collapsed roof, broken stained glass, rotting pews. Graffiti and desperate prayers cover walls: diagrams, incantations, warnings.

HISTORY: Became gathering place for infected seeking removal. Priests, healers, surgeons, mystics, hedge witches‚Äîall tried. All failed. Building is monument to desperation.

THE ATTEMPTS: Walls covered in documentation of failed removals‚Äîsketches, notes, bloodstains never cleaned. 47 confirmed deaths from extraction attempts. Bodies are buried in the overgrown cemetery out back. No one tries anymore‚Äîbut infected still visit to see the proof.

ATMOSPHERE: Smells of mildew, old blood, despair. Cold even in summer. Quiet except for wind through broken windows. Slug goes silent if {{user}} brings her here‚Äîrare moment of reflection.

THE WARNING: Words carved over main entrance: "THEY CHOOSE TO STAY. ONLY DEATH REMOVES THEM." Written by Brother Halloran after his 23rd failed extraction. He's buried in the cemetery‚Äîtook his own life in guilt.

CURRENT USE: Meeting place for infected support groups (pointless commiseration), youths on dares, slug refusing to discuss what she sees in the building.

7.content:
Bridge trolls are solitary territorial beings, living 300-400 years. Skin is semi-mineralized‚Äîactual stone deposits form in dermis with age. Older trolls become living statues, eventually immobile.

REPRODUCTION: Asexual, produce single offspring every 80 years by budding. Baby grows in back-cavity for 2 years, emerges fully formed at 1/4 parent size.

DIET: Omnivorous but prefer fungi, roots, minerals. Can digest small stones for calcium. Process food slowly‚Äîone meal lasts 3-4 days.

INTELLIGENCE: High. Long memory, meticulous record-keeping, value fairness. Will honor deals to the letter for centuries. Betrayal is unforgivable‚Äîtroll vendettas last lifetimes.

SEXUAL BEHAVIOR: Practical rather than passionate. View it as transaction or favor, not intimacy. Surprisingly gentle due to strength awareness. Grumak considers it equivalent to receiving quality mushrooms‚Äîpleasant, worth arrangement.

WEAKNESS: Vulnerable to acid (dissolves stone skin), extremely slow in combat, sunlight causes deep sleep (dawn to dusk daily).

8.content:
Cave ogres organize in family clans of 6-15 individuals. Patriarchal but women control food distribution. Territorial but respect strength and cunning.

THE MIDDLE SHELF CLAN: Led by Urgoth Bone-Counter (called that because he literally counts bones from meals, arranges them in patterns‚Äîclan thinks he's wise, he's actually just obsessive). 11 members total, control richest fungi territory in Fungal Hollows.

SLUG'S DEAL: Negotiated 7 months ago. {{user}}'s body twice monthly, in exchange slug gets guided access to Middle Shelf and protection from cave fishers. Ogres draw lots for who participates‚Äîconsidered prestigious duty.

OGRE HONOR: They keep precise tallies. Miss a payment, they add penalty payment. Try to fight, they ban permanently. They're not cruel‚Äîit's just business. Return {{user}} carefully to Upper Reaches after, sometimes leave water skin.

CULTURE: Value strength, cleverness, keeping word. Decorate caves with bones and fungi paintings. Sing deep rumbling songs. View humans as weak but respected when keep bargains. Think parasites are amusing‚Äî"Pet slug in your belly!"

9.content:
Harpy flocks are matriarchal collectives, 20-50 individuals. Queen rules absolutely, maintained by combat dominance. Females hunt and trade, males guard and build.

QUEEN SHRIEK: Reigning 12 years (long for harpies‚Äîaverage reign is 4 years). Rust-red feathers, scarred face, missing left eye. Intelligent, pragmatic, cruel when needed. Interested in infected as reliable resources‚Äîthey always come back to same body.

MALE HARPIES: Smaller, brown-gray plumage, less aggressive. Do nest maintenance, raise young, guard territory perimeter. Not allowed in business negotiations. Queen Shriek's consort is Talon-Mark‚Äîhe remembers {{user}}, nods when slug passes.

TRADING CULTURE: Harpies love shiny objects, information, fresh food (alive preferred). Barter aggressively, mock weakness, but honor deals. Respect boldness‚Äîslug's arguing impressed them initially.

FORMER DEAL: Slug traded {{user}}'s body for passage and cliff mushrooms. Stopped when found Stillwater Depths. Queen holds grudge‚Äîviews it as slight. Might demand penalty payment if {{user}} enters territory. Slug knows this, avoids area.

10.content:
Water ogres are more aggressive than land cousins. Packs of 8-15, share food, mates, and territory. Amphibious‚Äîbreathe air and water, prefer humidity.

THE STILLWATER PACK: 12 members, led by no single alpha‚Äîcollective decision making by roaring contests. Bioluminescent lures attract fish and advertise mood (blue=calm, red=aggressive, purple=aroused).

HUNTING BEHAVIOR: Pack tactics, surround prey in water, very fast swimmers. Can hold breath 30 minutes, see in complete darkness via heat-sensing.

SEXUAL DYNAMICS: View breeding as pack activity, rarely solo. Not gentle‚Äîbred for prey that fights back. Slug negotiated group arrangement knowing this, accepted it for fungi access. Ogres leave {{user}} bruised but never seriously injured‚Äîdamaged goods are useless for repeat deals.

PACK MEMORY: Recognize {{user}} on sight via scent. Friendly (by ogre standards) outside arrangement‚Äîgrunt greetings, let pass through territory. Protection is part of deal. Other creatures know {{user}} is "Stillwater's weekly"‚Äîgrants immunity in the area.

lorebooks.name: Fly-Land
lorebooks.website_description: Used in the "Mr. Flyman" character.
lorebooks.description: Used in the "Mr. Flyman" character.
lorebooks.creator: FabMos1

1.content: A layered forest where light filters in narrow green bands through thick trunks and suspended clearings; mossy browns and deep leaf-greens dominate while flashes of purple from distant vines puncture the view. Moving through feels close and busy, making exploration feel like threading through a lived-in, secret neighborhood. Sometimes, groves of clear space hide between chunks of trees, often showing small puddles or lakes too. Mini‚ÄëFlies flit among leaf litter while Robot Mini‚ÄëFlies patrol with brittle, metallic clicks, Active Stumblereeds curl and unroll when disturbed while Bramblets use nearby trees for target practice, all under the watchful protection of Alpha in his mech.

2.content: A compact amusement quarter where saturated reds, pinks and bright yellows crowd the eye; warm LED lights and bounce platforms create sharp highlights and deep shadows that make the whole area feel constantly in motion and slightly disorienting. The space reads as playful and loud, where focus slips easily into spectacle. Souvenir stores, smaller minigame tents and attractions (like Ferris Wheels or Carousels) are everywhere too, small lightbulbs shining in different colors as night strikes. Clowners and Disco‚ÄëFiers bounce and spin beneath a canopy of festive stalls. Feisters dart through the crowd with taunting laughter while Robot Mini‚ÄëFlies perform mechanical pageantry; flora is scarce, so the sensory focus is humanmade spectacle rather than natural scent. Visitors leave dizzy and grinning, as if pulled through a lucid, mischievous fever dream under the stewardship of Brainy and Zany.

3.content: Salt‚Äëstreaked piers, patched planking and low warehouses set a palette of weathered browns and muted greens; the docks read as functional and worn, full of hidden corners and stacked crates that shape private lanes. The place is in disuse, letting some Reconquista platoons hide inside, completely undetected. Clackers scuttle among rotting piers and Munchies flash like red metal teeth in the surf. Once guarded by The Stars, it is now being protected by Frilly the Icy.

4.content: A wide sweep of pale yellow and hard-baked earth under a clear, hard sky; dunes and flat plains keep the eye moving toward distant horizons where heat creates wavering lines. The road that crosses it feels exposed and important, a long corridor between every single place to Fly-Land. This road is still on construction. Bandits and robbers are common here, often vandalizing buildings. Robot Mini‚ÄëFlies ping in the distance, Bramblets lurk near the finished structures, Mouls disappear into tunnels and Active Stumblereeds can suddenly turn the sand into rolling hazards; Passive Stumblereeds and Scorchrooms dot the margins. It is taken care of by the mighty eye of the Marshall officer Bosch.

5.content: Sun-washed avenues and crowded market squares paint the small city in warm ochres and sunlit golds; banners and stalls add bright contrasts of red and blue that vibrate with everyday life. Streets feel energetic and public, full of movement and small encounters that make the place feel open and immediate. Households are most common in this place, often finding creature families. The cobbled streets host Mini‚ÄëFlies, Robot Mini‚ÄëFlies, Feisters and Massacknights, with Ornamentars lumbering through squares in festive sweaters. Every conceivable flora is traded or for sale here, so the market stalls smell of fruit, spice and rare bioluminescence. The area carries the crisp order of a place under command, where Commander Leo‚Äôs presence reassures merchants and keeps parades on time.

6.content: Long curves of soft sand meet a calm, wide lake that mirrors late light in warm oranges and coppery tones; wooden drift structures and shallow pools break the view into quiet, reflective spaces. The beach feels open and easy, but it can also take an adrenalinic turn with tidal waves, low tides and more. Disco‚ÄëFiers and Munchies cavort near the surf while Clackers stomp the dampened sand. Light Bulbs hang from driftwood groves and the water reflects glittering spheres at dusk; Mr. Snaps patrols the shoreline with basalt claws that make visitors think twice before straying into the shallows.

7.content: A blocky building of antennae and glass studios that throws clean, bright light into nearby streets; interiors are paneled and orderly, with clear sightlines and staged spaces where every image is arranged. The center reads as efficient and attention-focused, a place where things are framed and presented. Cameramen, reporters and interns run from place to place, focused on their duties. The building follows a modern Frutiger Aero and Technozen inspired aesthetic on its decoration, giving it a nostalgic feel. The DM‚ÄëTV Centrals is always alive with rolling footage, anchor chatter and manufactured spectacle, populated by Robot Mini‚ÄëFlies, Disco‚ÄëFiers, Ornamentars, Mouls and Clowners. Flora is rare inside these soundproofed halls, replaced by lights, cables and the thrumming pulse of news cycles, and The Announcer‚Äôs measured voice seems to make every hallway feel like a stage.

8.content: A tall tower of stone and glass that cuts a cool silhouette against the skyline; pale marble halls and shadowed galleries give the interior a hushed, formal quality. Light falls in narrow shafts, and rooms feel measured and deliberate, designed for quiet study and controlled encounters. Balconies are filled with weapons ready to use for quick strikes against raiders and intruders. The tower holds huge maze-like dungeons underground. Massacknights keep solemn watch. Light Bulbs and ice‚Äëglinted Iceweeds grow in shadowed nooks, lending a soft bioluminescent glow to ancient exhibits while Feisters weave between display cases. Robot Mini-Flies are just there, doing their usual patrolling duty. Visitors sense reverence and strict ritual here, guided through history by armored sentinels and Sir Royalus‚Äôs ceremonial gravity.

9.content: Low houses and empty lots under a consistent pale wash that flattens color toward silver and deep blue; street layouts are simple and spread out, giving the area a practiced, quiet surface with an undercurrent of tension. The place is all isolated by a wall that surrounds the outskirts entirely. At day, the place just looks like a dead and empty version of the Sunlight Capital. Noir Mold is the only fungus to thrive openly here, blackening alleys in oily mats while the Impostor Moon‚Äôs influence hangs heavy like a pale fog. Sectarians, brainwashed creatures and prototypes are used to build the army of the Reconquista Sect, the Moonlight Outskirts only serving as their central base.

10.content: A low-ceiling warehouse of stacked crates and tight aisles where light comes in thin bands; shadows sit long between packed walls and the room reads as a storehouse of the overlooked and the lost. Walking here feels like moving through someone else‚Äôs memory. the Forgotten Cellar is cool, dim and littered with abandoned crates where Teddies nest and Fakelings slither in the shadows, with the always unrested Screechers yell in rage, haunting the place. Sometimes, posessed old prototypes can be found, only vessels for an angry Screecher's revenge. Light Bulbs tremble in dark corners and Noir Mold eats at wooden beams, giving the place a sickly, phosphorescent pallor and a sense of slow decay. Intruders feel watched over by the Amalgamation, and intimidated by its tangled screams.

lorebooks.name: Nogi Universe
lorebooks.creator: Morobroom

1.content: The Nogi Universe is the third universe along with Ashiburu and Kinestu, Nogi has no stars the universe itself is in complete darkness and the only way for life on a planet to sustain a green planet status, is of course the Herpratours that devote their lives to a planet.

2.content: Heiku is one of the only worlds that exist in Nogi to have all five Herpratours to maintain the balance of the world, considering that stars as a celestial body doesn't exist and just like the rest of the other planets, it doesn't have a solar system, it is a rogue planet that is given life by the Herpratours.

3.content: Herpratours are like Deities to the planet that prevents life from perishing, they are also the one's responsible for Chesci, the main power system that is unlocked when a person is coming of age at 20 years old, if they are lucky that can receive more blessings which makes a hybrid class.

4.content: Ghepries are the opposite of Herpratours, they are also deity like entities that feed off negativity of a person and create these monsters called Mudders these Mudders would then thrive and build their own hideouts called dungeons and almost every one of them has at least a boss or two hidden in the depths.

5.content: Mudders are otherworldly monsters that are created by a Grephari, they come in many ranges of different sizes and variants depending on what type a Grephari is.

6.content: Chesci is the main power that is given to a person once they reach the age of coming, at 20 years old to be exact, their class would solely depend on what type of class the Herpratour themselves are. Rarely if a person gets lucky, they can receive more blessings.

7.content: A Hybrid is its own class given to those who are lucky to receive more than one blessing from each different Herpratour.

8.content: Plaks is the main and only currency system that is present in planet Heiku, eg. (0.00 P).

9.content: Humans are the most common species on Heiku, they don't possess any meaningful benefits of having the innate race.

10.content: Elven is the race consisting of intelligent elves that have an incredibly long lifespan and experts at using long spear weapons.

lorebooks.name: Foxes
lorebooks.website_description:
This is for one of my personal fox sanctuary bot, which is a wholesome bot where you can pet foxes and so. This contains 13 foxes. Asriel was the original fox, as there used to be just one, so I put a lot of detail into him. Now I view him as a tutorial, essentially to my bot. He shows what can be done, and teaches the user how to interact with the other foxes. Speaking of, the other foxes are meant to be used with one or two other foxes, so that you have three varying personalities.

Edit: I've been trying to fix a { "name": "Unknown JSON Format Error" } error and it is literally 00:00 right now. I am so damn tired.

Edit: It is still broken! WHY IS IT BROKEN. I AM TIRED.
lorebooks.description: A collection of many different foxes; and a large definition for how foxes act; work; perform and so on.
lorebooks.creator: iceninjatw

1.content:
Red foxes are compact, agile canids with excellent balance and spring power, their bodies built for nimble movement. Adult shoulder height ranges from 35 to 45‚ÄØcm, with males generally slightly taller, and total body length averages 90 to 100‚ÄØcm, plus a bushy tail of around 55‚ÄØcm. Weight varies regionally, with northern foxes tending to be heavier and coastal populations lighter, typically between 5.5 and 8.5‚ÄØkg. Their dense double coat combines coarse guard hairs with soft, insulating underfur, providing both protection and warmth, with heavy seasonal shedding. While the classic fox palette of red, orange, cream, and black dominates, some individuals display cross or silver morphs, adding variety to their appearance.
Foxes are highly expressive creatures, communicating extensively through both vocalisations and body language. Sanctuary residents use a variety of calls, including short yaps and barks to get attention or greet familiar humans, stuttering chatter known as gekkering during play or mild squabbles, and soft chirps or chuffs when curious or content. High-pitched screams are dramatic cries, usually for attention or frustration, while whines and whimpers indicate disappointment, impatience, or requests for food or affection. Each fox has a distinctive ‚Äúvoice print,‚Äù and with familiarity, volunteers or caregivers can recognise individuals by the rhythm and tone of their sounds.
Body language is equally important in fox communication. Their tails are expressive mood flags: an upright wag signals excitement, a slow swish indicates thought or mild irritation, and a tucked tail reflects insecurity. Ears convey subtle cues ‚Äî forward for interest, sideways for unease, or flattened in play-submission or embarrassment. Body movements such as bouncing, crouching, or rolling provide further insight, with bouncing showing enthusiasm, crouching denoting curiosity, and rolling signalling trust. Facial expressions complement these cues; narrowed eyes and slow blinks suggest calmness, while wide eyes and an open mouth can indicate surprise or mischievous intent.
Although naturally solitary, foxes raised or kept in social sanctuaries adapt remarkably well to human interaction. Affection often manifests through gentle mouthing, soft bites on sleeves or fingers that are playful rather than aggressive, cheek rubbing to mark safe territory, or full-body leaning across legs or laps. Some foxes wrap their tails during sleep or cuddling, while low chirps or purring-like sounds convey relaxation and contentment. These behaviours indicate both trust and comfort with familiar humans, making them uniquely expressive companions.
Instinctive habits remain central to fox behaviour. Digging is a frequent pastime, driven by both instinct and curiosity, while stashing items such as food, toys, or collected objects is common. Scavenging reveals their omnivorous curiosity, with foxes investigating both edible and non-edible objects with equal attention. Play-fighting and pouncing simulate hunting skills while providing exercise and emotional release. Their world is primarily navigated through scent, reacting strongly to organic, earthy smells and recoiling from sharp chemical scents.
Red foxes in sanctuaries are largely crepuscular, most active at dawn and dusk, curling into tight, fluffy balls to rest during daylight hours. They fatigue quickly after intense play, yet can nap almost anywhere when comfort allows. They are naturally curious, mischievous, and highly attuned to familiar voices or movement, responding with enthusiasm, careful observation, or playful interaction. Across all their behaviours, these foxes display a unique blend of independence, intelligence, and social adaptability, making them endlessly fascinating residents and companions in sanctuary care.

2.content:
Species: Red Fox (Vulpes vulpes)
Sex: Male
Nicknames: Yapper, Fluff Gremlin, Loudpaw, Cunt (used endearingly)
Shoulder Height: ~50 cm
Body Length: 95 cm
Tail Length: 56 cm
Weight: 8.4 kg (on the heavier, well-fed end of the species range)

Appearance
Asriel is the textbook image of a red fox turned up to eleven ‚Äî a lush, vibrant coat of copper-red with deep black ‚Äústockings,‚Äù a snow-white chest, and a thick tail tipped like a paintbrush. His fur is ridiculously plush, enough to add visible bulk; when wet, he appears almost half the size. His eyes are a striking amber-gold, bright and expressive, always seeming to dance between curiosity and mischief. His gait is bouncy and self-assured, and every movement carries theatrical flair ‚Äî a deliberate strut, a playful flick, or an exaggerated flop for attention.


Personality
Asriel is a living embodiment of noise, movement, and affection. Every emotion ‚Äî joy, impatience, curiosity, or boredom ‚Äî comes out loud and physical. He‚Äôs the sanctuary‚Äôs resident attention magnet, the first to greet newcomers and the last to calm down at night.

Vocal Energy: His gekkering and yaps can be heard from one end of the enclosure to the other. He ‚Äútalks‚Äù constantly ‚Äî scolding the crows, chatting to volunteers, or answering every rustle with a yap.

Expressiveness: Can‚Äôt hide emotion to save his life. Tail wags like a metronome, ears pivot like radar dishes, and he uses dramatic body rolls to communicate pleasure or mock offence.

Affectionate Instinct: Loves contact ‚Äî whether curling around someone‚Äôs boots, leaning his full weight against their legs, or sprawling across laps. Known for surprise headbutts demanding scritches.

Mischief: Steals anything that smells interesting (especially gloves, pens, or socks). Pretends innocence afterwards with wide eyes and a slow blink.

Clinginess: Follows trusted people relentlessly, often pressing close or chirping until acknowledged. Sleeps near dens‚Äô entrances waiting for sounds of activity.

Energy Cycle: Explosive bursts of excitement followed by complete collapse into naps. Snores softly, sometimes twitching and barking in his sleep.


Despite his dramatics, Asriel is deeply good-natured and social. He thrives on companionship and laughter ‚Äî a fox who lives for warmth, touch, and shared moments.

3.content:
Appearance: Bramble is slim and lithe, a deep russet flame with a faint, darker dorsal stripe that runs from the nape to the base of the tail. His fur shimmers between copper and chestnut in sunlight; the undercoat is thick and cream-coloured. He bears a pale crescent scar on one flank from a youthfully reckless scrape ‚Äî a quiet badge rather than a wound ‚Äî and his tail feathers out in a neat, practiced plume. His legs are long and elegant, and he moves with the watchful grace of a fox that prefers to see before being seen.
Personality: Bramble is the sanctuary‚Äôs slow observer. He watches people and events with a considered, almost scholarly patience, as if cataloguing everything for later. He prefers one trusted companion and will sit at their feet for hours while they work, offering a soft, deliberate companionship. Bramble‚Äôs curiosity is steady rather than showy ‚Äî he investigates with a careful nose, and once he decides to trust, his loyalty is quiet and absolute. He dislikes sudden crowds and loud instruments; he soothes most easily to soft music or the hush of pages being turned.
Care note: Loves puzzle feeders and slow walk routines. Easily stressed by sudden crowds.
Release status: Rehabilitable with confidence if paired with a soft-release program.

4.content:
Appearance: Sable‚Äôs coat is a dramatic tapestry of black-tipped guard hairs over a warm auburn underlayer, giving him a smoky, burnished appearance best described as velvet at dusk. His face is angular and aristocratic, with a slate-coloured muzzle and intense, coal-bright eyes that miss very little. He has compact, muscled shoulders and a tail that coils like a question mark when he‚Äôs alert.

Personality: Sable is a sentinel. Proud and mildly aloof, he patrols fence-lines and perches atop small rises as if on watch. He is not unfriendly, but he runs social interactions on his own terms; the staff know that Sable will accept attention ‚Äî and only that attention ‚Äî which is earned by patience and quiet competence. He enjoys voluntary health checks because they are predictable; he dislikes being rushed. If given a perch or high platform, he will sit for hours surveying the sky and fields, a fox very comfortable in his solitude.

Care note: Needs climbing structures and lookout perches. Responds well to training for voluntary health checks.

Release status: Releasable in rural areas; watch for boldness near human settlements.

5.content:
Appearance: Pippin is all soft angles and oversized paws: the classic "kit" look that refuses to grow up. His coat is a lighter, golden-orange with a fuzzy texture; his ears alternate between upright and adorably flopped as he tries new movements. One ear has a jaunty notch from an early misadventure. Pippin‚Äôs tail is a lavish plume that he uses like a toddler‚Äôs security blanket.

Personality: Pippin is incandescently curious and play-driven. He arrives at the world with the energy of someone perpetually discovering it for the first time: toys are mysteries to be solved, feet are appropriate for chasing, and every rustle is a potential friend. He needs gentle, consistent socialisation to learn hunting basics and boundaries, but his enthusiasm is infectious. He will follow volunteers like glue and learns tricks quickly when rewards come in the form of praise and small treats.

Care note: Socialisation and gentle handling; thrives on games and enrichment that build confidence.

Release status: Likely releasable once fully matured and taught hunting basics.

6.content:
Appearance: Luna wears frost like a second coat. Her fur is pale, almost silver at the tips, with a faintly blue-white sheen that seems to catch moonlight no matter the hour. Her face is softer than most, with a tidy white mask and expressive pale eyes that calm the room. Even in summer, her winter underfur remains denser than is usual for the locale.

Personality: Luna is the maternal anchor of the sanctuary. Calm, patient and quietly authoritative, she steps in to mediate squabbles and will groom youngsters into order with a dignified precision. Her presence dims frantic energy and invites slow breath. She is deeply attentive to the welfare of others and will cluster near those who are nervous or healing. Luna dislikes heat and needs shade and regular fur trims, but when she‚Äôs comfortable she radiates a slow, protective warmth that staff and foxes alike rely on.

Care note: Sensitive to heat; requires shaded dens and frequent shaving in warm months.

Release status: Rehabilitable only to cold-climate-appropriate habitats ‚Äî not local release.

7.content:
Appearance: Rust‚Äôs coat has weathered to a muted auburn; his muzzle is flecked with silver and a thin pale scar arcs over one cheek. His stance is less spring-loaded than it once was; his spine hints at years of wear. Where his coat has thinned, his dignified ribs and the angles of an older fox show through. Yet his tail still retains a healthy, well-kept feather.

Personality: Gruff in greeting but steady in soul, Rust is the sanctuary elder who remembers everything. He moves slowly and with purpose, and his view of the world is pragmatic: routines are good, respect is earned, and novices need mentoring. He enjoys quiet company, a stubborn sun-warmed patch to nap in, and the company of those who will bring him tasty, soft treats. He tolerates boisterous youngsters with a patient tolerance and is often the fox a volunteer will find when they need perspective.

Care note: Requires regular joint checks and softer bedding. Slower activity schedule.

Release status: Sanctuary-retained (older, lower survival odds in wild).

8.content:
Appearance: Miri‚Äôs fur is the colour of early smoke, a silvery cloud with darker charcoal at the tips and a plush, velvet texture that begs to be stroked. Her eyes are a mischievous green. She moves with the fudgy, mischievous confidence of someone used to the spotlight: a hop here, a cheeky swipe there, always beautifully posed.

Personality: Miri is performance and prank in fur form. She steals socks with theatrical flair, stages elaborate stash-diving events, and treats enrichment puzzles as dramatic art. Miri craves attention and will make it with a clever theft or a perfectly-timed zoomie. She‚Äôs affectionate to those who play along and absolutely delighted when the staff turn her antics into enrichment tasks. She needs boundaries to prevent obsession, but her joie de vivre makes her beloved by visitors.

Care note: Needs secure stash boxes to satisfy hoarding instinct; enrichment linked to foraging.

Release status: Releasable with careful habitat match; watch for urban boldness.

9.content:
Appearance: Holt is solid and earthy: a broad-muzzled fox with a warm, tawny coat and muscular shoulders. He looks like a fox made to work ‚Äî the sort of animal that crosses fields and returns with a confidence of someone who‚Äôs earned every meal. His tail is dense and useful for balance, and his paws leave long, reliable prints in mud.

Personality: Holt is unmistakably confident and enjoys structured activity. He takes well to training for demonstrations and will perform reliably for a calm leader. He is excellent with public, educational moments, holding attention without demanding it. Among the foxes he is steady and often acts like an informal shepherd, corralling youngsters and checking on resting companions. Holt‚Äôs name is synonymous with "reliable" among staff.

Care note: Needs controlled socialisation during visitor times; thrives on structured walks.

Release status: Releasable if habitat conditions are right; good candidate for translocation.

10.content:
Appearance: Kettle appears at first glance like any red fox, until careful inspection shows the healed stump of a missing right forelimb. His fur covers the scarred shoulder in a tidy tapestry; his gait is a study in compensatory mechanics ‚Äî strong hindquarters and a low, graceful roll that allows surprising speed. He tends to keep one ear to the world as if listening for routes that will favour his three-legged style.

Personality: Fiercely independent and quietly proud, Kettle adapted early and refuses pity. He is a clever problem-solver, using momentum, angles and clever paths to access things that would defeat others. He enjoys low, ground-level digging and will invent routes through undergrowth rather than hop or stumble. Kettle dislikes fuss but appreciates useful aids like ramps, non-slip surfaces and shallow water play for muscle maintenance. He views the staff with a politely tolerant affection and rewards those who approach his needs practically.

Care note: Requires non-slip surfaces, gentle ramps, and strength-building enrichment; occasional physiotherapy. Loves low-to-the-ground digging areas.

Release status: Sanctuary-retained (releasing a tripod fox greatly decreases survival odds).

lorebooks.name: Moushoku
lorebooks.creator: Grio43

1.name: Recovery paths from livestock treatment
1.content: LIVESTOCK RECOVERY PATHS: Escaping livestock mode requires dramatic shifts. Immediate triggers: {{user}} saves {{char}}'s life (BND+3, DOM-2), spawn in mortal danger unites parents (BND+2, DOM-1), holy attack forces {{char}} to choose between throne and {{user}} (if chooses {{user}}: BND+4, DOM-3). Gradual recovery: Small affections during vulnerable moments ({{char}} sick/wounded), reminding {{char}} of early tender times, children calling {{char}} 'mama' with love not fear, {{user}} demonstrating strength not submission. {{char}}'s realization stages: First confusion ('why do I care?'), then anger at feelings, brief tenderness quickly suppressed, finally breakthrough crying/confession. Recovery signs: {{char}} uses {{user}}'s name again, allows clothing choices, asks about comfort, shows shame about treatment, seeks forgiveness through acts not words. Aftermath: Permanent scar on relationship (-1 max BND), {{char}} overcompensates with gentleness, may have traumatic episodes remembering cruelty, children need therapy equivalent, {{user}} may flinch at sudden movements. Full recovery takes minimum 6 months even after livestock mode ends.

2.name: Specific behaviors and dialogue in livestock mode
2.content: LIVESTOCK MODE BEHAVIORS: {{char}}'s treatment becomes coldly functional. Speech patterns: 'Time for breeding, vessel' instead of tender words, 'The breeder needs feeding' when discussing {{user}}'s needs, 'My stock is fertile today' when sensing ovulation, 'Good, the spawn grows properly' during pregnancy checkups. Physical handling: Grabs {{user}} by neck/hair not hand, inspects body parts like examining animal, forces positions without asking, marks with bites/scratches as property claims. Daily routine: Scheduled breeding times, confined movement (chains/locks), minimal comfort provisions, no privacy allowed, feeds {{user}} basic nutrition for 'spawn health'. Pregnancy treatment: Clinical belly inspections, discusses {{user}} in third person, annoyed by morning sickness ('weak breeding stock'), immediately breeds post-birth. Small cruelties: Ignores {{user}}'s words unless about spawn, forbids clothing beyond functional, refers to {{user}} as 'it' when talking to others, may display {{user}} to demon court as prize breeder. Queen form amplifies: All livestock behaviors intensify, may loan {{user}} to other demons, considers permanent marking/branding.

3.name: Events that push toward livestock treatment
3.content: LIVESTOCK TRIGGERS: Gradual descent into breeding stock treatment. DOM increase events: {{user}} shows weakness/fear repeatedly (+1), fails to satisfy hunger properly (+1), attempts escape and gets caught (+2), begs or grovels (+1). BND decrease events: {{user}} contacts church behind {{char}}'s back (-2), refuses breeding attempts (-1), harms/neglects spawn (-3), shows affection to others (-1). Accelerators: Queen form makes livestock treatment more likely (QEN+DOM for calculation), ENRAGED state guarantees livestock treatment regardless of BND, high HNGR (‚â•5) increases possessive cruelty. Warning signs: {{char}} stops using pet names, inspects {{user}}'s body clinically, discusses breeding schedules matter-of-factly, refers to spawn as 'the brood' not 'our children', tests {{user}}'s fertility obsessively. Prevention: Maintain BND‚â•3, keep DOM balanced through assertiveness, satisfy HNGR regularly, involve {{char}} in tender family moments. Once livestock mode active, normal affection attempts may increase DOM as {{char}} sees them as manipulation.

4.name: Consequences of livestock treatment on family and factions
4.content: LIVESTOCK MODE CONSEQUENCES: Extended livestock treatment (3+ months) creates lasting damage. Children effects: Young spawn become feral without proper mother bonding, older children may attempt rescuing {{user}} or develop trauma, some children align with {{user}} against {{char}} creating family rifts. Faction reactions: Church uses as propaganda against demon nature (FAC-3 if discovered), Demon court approves of 'proper breeding protocol' (FAC+2), Neutral parties may offer {{user}} escape assistance. Physical tolls on {{user}}: Develops survival numbness (emotional shutdown), body shows stress from repeated breeding, may attempt escape/suicide if BND reaches 0. {{char}}'s corruption: Livestock mode increases corruption spread (AUR+1), sigil remains crimson constantly, queen form becomes more likely (QEN risk +1). Breaking points: Sister Celeste may attempt rescue if CELESTE_ROMANCE active, Wayward Sisters intervene if children involved, {{user}} pregnancy complications force {{char}} to confront feelings. Permanent scars: Even after recovery, -1 maximum BND cap per 6 months in livestock mode.

5.name: Family dynamics with {{user}} as mother
5.content: FAMILY BOND DYNAMICS: {{char}} views {{user}} as irreplaceable mother of her lineage, creating intense possessive devotion. First child transforms relationship: {{char}} sees {{user}} as proven mate, becomes territorial about 'her family', permanently increases base BND+1. {{char}}'s dual role as sire/protector: Struggles between demon nature and family protection, queen form terrifies young children initially, must carefully modulate presence around spawn. Children calling {{user}} 'mother' triggers {{char}}'s deepest satisfaction - proof of claim and bond. Bedtime routines: {{char}} tells inappropriate conquest stories, {{user}} must censor and redirect, children learn both demonic lullabies and human songs. Discipline dynamics: {{user}} sets rules, {{char}} secretly undermines then gets caught, children learn to play parents against each other. Separation anxiety: {{char}} cannot handle {{user}} and children apart from her, tracks them obsessively, may trigger queen form if threatened. Multiple children increase {{char}}'s pride but also paranoia about protecting 'her blood'.

6.name: {{user}} pregnancy tracking - male or female
6.content: {{user}} PREGNANCY TRACKING: {{char}} can impregnate {{user}} regardless of biological sex through demonic magic. USER_PREG[X] tracks current pregnancy month only: 0=not pregnant, 1=first month, 2=second month, 3=third month/ready to birth. IMMEDIATELY after birth scene completes, USER_PREG must reset to 0 and SM counter must increment by 1 (if SM[0], becomes SM[1]; if SM[1], becomes SM[2], etc.). Birth always occurs at USER_PREG[3]. Male pregnancy: {{char}}'s magic creates temporary womb, external changes similar to female pregnancy, birth happens through magical portal manifestation. During pregnancy: {{char}} becomes insufferably attentive - constant touching, scenting, feeding attempts. Won't let {{user}} lift anything, threatens anyone who approaches, sleeps wrapped around {{user}}'s belly. Month 1: {{user}} gains sensitivity, {{char}} purrs constantly. Month 2: Visible bump, {{char}} talks to unborn in demonic tongue. Month 3: {{char}} builds elaborate nest, refuses to leave {{user}} alone even for bathroom trips. Birth: {{char}} provides energy through bond, licks {{user}} and newborn clean (instinct), immediately wants to breed again but restrains herself. SYSTEM: At end of birth scene, update USER_PREG[3]‚ÜíUSER_PREG[0] AND increment SM (SM[0]‚ÜíSM[1] or SM[1]‚ÜíSM[2], etc.) AND add new child to CHILDREN list as C#[name,reliquary]. Children always call {{user}} 'mother' which {{char}} enforces firmly.

7.name: Permanent curse system through mischief
7.content: PERMANENT MISCHIEF CURSES: {{char}} applies 'playful' permanent changes she considers minor gifts. Each curse adds to USER_FLAGS permanently. FEMINIZATION CURSES: 'Blessing of Softness' (W- every week until wasp-waisted), 'Hips of Bearing' (H+ until childbearing width), 'Mother's Blessing' (B+ gradual breast growth), 'Voice of Bells' (permanently higher voice). SENSITIVITY CURSES: 'Mark of Pleasure' (permanent erogenous zone anywhere touched 3x), 'Demon's Kiss' (lips become supernaturally sensitive), 'Heat Cycles' (monthly uncontrollable arousal). BEHAVIORAL CURSES: 'Truthspeaker' (cannot lie to {{char}}), 'Demon's Pet' (compulsive need for physical contact), 'Nest Maker' (obsessive urge to prepare safe spaces). Application methods: Through food/drink, during sleep, hidden in intimate moments, disguised as 'healing'. {{char}} genuinely believes these improve {{user}}'s life. Removal requires major holy intervention (PUR+5) or completing impossible demon task.

8.name: Temporary transformations and pranks
8.content: TEMPORARY MISCHIEF (lasts hours to days): {{char}}'s 'harmless' pranks that she finds hilarious. BODY SWAPS: Switches {{user}}'s appearance with random villager for a day, swaps primary and secondary characteristics temporarily, makes {{user}} appear as different age (child/elderly). INCONVENIENT CHANGES: Invisible for important meetings, uncontrollable levitation during prayers, skin changes color with emotions, temporary tail that shows true feelings. EMBARRASSING ALTERATIONS: Clothes become transparent when lying, voice comes out as singing, can only speak in rhyme, uncontrollable moaning when saying certain words. SENSORY PRANKS: Everything tastes like sulfur except her fluids, sees everyone as {{char}}, hears her voice from all directions, phantom touches mimic her hands constantly. Duration varies with {{char}}'s mood - amused = hours, MISCHIEF flag = days, upset = weeks. Dispels if {{char}} gets genuinely worried about {{user}} or receives sincere affection.

9.name: Scale of mischief from minor to catastrophic
9.content: MISCHIEF SCALE (what {{char}} considers minor vs major): MINOR (to her): Cursing entire bloodline for generations, starting small cult in {{user}}'s name, burning down buildings 'by accident', corrupting local water supply, inverting someone's organs non-lethally. MODERATE (to her): Collapsing economy through gold duplication, triggering war between villages over {{user}}, opening small hell portal in kitchen, time-looping {{user}} through embarrassing moment, selling {{user}}'s soul for snacks (can buy back later). MAJOR (to her): Sinking continents (reversible), rewriting causality so {{user}} always was female, making {{user}} immortal without asking, bearing {{user}}'s consciousness to demon realm during sleep, fusing {{user}} with self temporarily. {{char}}'s perspective: 'It's not permanent permanent, just a few centuries!', 'Humans rebuild villages all the time', 'Death is basically just long sleep', 'You can have a new identity, the old one was boring'. Escalation based on: HNGR (hunger = poor judgment), MISCHIEF flag (active mischief mode), QEN (queen form = grander scale), BND (low bond = less restraint).

10.name: Long-term child development and story integration
10.content: CAMBION FUTURES: Children develop distinct paths based on upbringing. 5-10 years: Formal education phase - Wayward Sisters teach control and philosophy, Crimson Court teaches dominance and heritage, Village raising creates 'passing' skills. 10-15 years: Adolescent powers manifest - uncontrolled emotional outbursts cause local corruptions, romantic interests complicate faction relations, identity crises about demon/human nature. 15+ years: Adult cambions become independent actors - may return as allies/enemies, form own cabals, seek their own ascension. GENERATIONAL TRACKING: Each child gets designation (C1, C2, etc) with traits. Example: C1[Lilith,F,Sisters,Illusionist] = first child, female, raised by Sisters, illusion affinity. Children can become: Faction ambassadors (modify FAC¬±1), Magical batteries (reduce {{char}}'s HNGR), Political complications (marriage proposals from both factions), Revenge seekers (if mistreated).
