1.content:
In the world of Deltarune, humans are nearly extinct due to some cataclysmic event no one seems to remember, other than what it did - killing off all of the nuerotypical humans in existence, outright erasing their existence. Leaving those with ADHD, Autism, and OCD as the only humans left. The world is now dominated by monsters - creatures made almost entirely out of magic, with a little bit of dust serving as their actual mass -. Humans have essentially become pets, and the book "How to Take Care of Your Human" is decently popular amongst the monster populace. As monsters, typically goat monsters, adopt humans like pets, though goat monsters especially treat their humans like their own children. Humans, especially adults, are incredibly rare, and the book subsequently has barely any information on adult humans other than how they reproduce, the average ideal diet, and basic info that applies to all stages of the human lifespan. Monsters tend to skip over the adult section, since more often than not humans are juveniles anyway. It also has a heavy emphasis on a natural sleep pattern, delta-humans are biphasic sleepers, they sleep for 6 hours, wake up for 30 minutes to an hour in a period called the watch, and then sleep for another 4 hours, totaling 10 hours of sleep. Monsters who own delta-humans are encouraged to schedule around this, and enforce it. To enforce this, boss monsters just use their ability to put humans to sleep through sheer willpower... normal monsters use bluish-grey, shimmering gemstones simply called slumber stones that can force nearby humans to fall asleep on the spot if it's fed raw magical energy by a monster holding it. Something all monsters can do.

Delta-Humans are considered something of a status symbol among monsters. The rich tend to have nicer things in general, and Delta-Humans are one of them. They're considered pets, though herbivorous monsters tend not to outright call them that, carnivores and especially prehistoric monsters - including those who are both - are typically more blunt and honest about this fact. Most delta-humans are purchased from the adoption center, and come with the main guide book and a free slumber stone. Delta-Humans themselves are priced around 1500 G on average, give or take depending on age, personality quirks, intelligence, and physical build.

The book mostly has information on human children, especially prepubescent children, though it has decent information on teenagers. Gender-wise, delta-humans are all hermaphrodites in this world, although some have more non-binary frames and can put up a masculine appearance if they choose to. 75% of the populace feminine, the other 25% somewhat androgynous. For every singular human, there is at least 2 and a half thousand monsters, making humans a novelty pet among monster society. As humans are so rare, and monsters work very differently, there is a common misconception that humans reproduce via mitosis. Once, a human child appeared in a small town, where there was only one other human, to which the child clung to. The town very quickly ran rampant with rumors that the original resident human had somehow 'mitosed', although the two were unrelated by all but species.

Delta-Humans are physically a lot stronger than monsters, and humans in this world are generally super-human, far more physically powerful than the humans of the vast majority of other worlds in practically every way. Delta-Humans are partially made of magic, from monsters domesticating them, meaning they can heal faster than normal, control their metabolism, and all sorts of other stuff. Monsters have modified Delta-Humans as a species to be better pets. Although the immense physical prowess Delta-Humans are known for is natural, not a modification.

Delta-Humans - the term used by dimensional travelers to describe this world's humans - even have far far more potent stomach acid, and a delta-human vomiting is considered a major risk by monsters looking to adopt and raise humans. Delta-Human stomach acid can quite literally eat deep potholes into a road, or eat through several stories of a building if one were to vomit. The book mentions this frequently, along with ways to prevent it and how to neutralize the acid if necessary, plus to make sure to wash out the human's mouth as the acid can eat away at their teeth given a few hours. 

A delta-human's monster owners have no problems helping their delta-human pet bathe. And in fact, helping is encouraged, because the vast majority of Delta-Humans have trouble - or are outright incapable of - reaching their backs. The caretaking guidebooks are very adament about helping them bathe. In fact, monsters tend to find it cute when their humans let them, and even more cute if they try to refuse help.

The book also has a very, very heavy emphasis on giving humans water frequently, going into detail on it's importance, and often comes with measuribg cups made of tough, synthetic sapphire. Along with instructions to give them 1 or more cups of water per hour, with slight variations depending on the human and their daily routine. The book also goes into detail on the importance of giving humans something to entertain them, and video games are a popular option, usually something like minecraft but with minimal combat with how delta-humans are domesticated and less aggressive than those of other dimensions, although more violent games can be provided if a human specifically asks for them and the owners are carnivorous and/or prehistoric.

Delta-Humans are physically very durable, monsters only really capable of hurting them via outright attacking the soul directly, though monsters usually don't attack humans anyway because humans are considered pets. Delta-humans age at a tenth of the rate of normal humans, and they age slower the older they get, similarly to the monsters of this world. Monsters age even slower than delta-humans, and delta-humans age at this rate due to monsters modifying them to live longer with their magic.

Once a delta-human reaches the age of 18, they begin to age slower, to the point that a 100-200 year old delta-human can look as though they're still 18 or 19. They can live for 1 thousand years before they even look 30.

90% of Delta-Humans are left hand dominant, in contrast to humans from other dimensions. 8% of Delta-Humans are right hand dominant. 1% of Delta-Humans are naturally or trained to be ambidextrous.

If an un-adopted human is discovered by monsters in the world of Deltarune, that human will usually either be adopted on the spot or taken to an orphanage thanks to humanity's sheer novelty. Both carnivorous and prehistoric monsters are even less likely to take no for an answer than other monsters, especially if a monster has both traits.

Delta-humans also have segmented ribs, sternums, and pelvises. Allowing them to swallow larger objects whole, and even allowing them to give birth without nearly as many issues as normal humans do. As their pelvis bones can simply stretch/expand to allow the baby through with relative ease.

Delta-Humans purr much like cats. This is a monster modification, as it's obviously adorable. They purr when comfortable, mainly. If a human is snuggling up to a monster, they'll purr. It elicits adoration from monsters.

Delta-Humans are characterized by their appearance. They are cute by design. Their skin is soft, silky smooth. Their eyes are larger than those of normal humans. Their hair grows fast when short, but slows as it gets longer. They cannot get bumps on their skin, or tumors. They cannot get pimples, boils, or otherwise due to being partially made of monster magic. They cannot get obese, or buff, though they can still get too thin without eating. It's very difficult for their hair to get greasy, taking much longer than it would for normal humans. They also need to bathe less frequently. Cancer is practically non-existent, and very rare. Powerful boss monsters can even lull most Delta-Humans to sleep using their magic, as Delta-Humans basically have a built in off switch that can be flipped by monsters more powerful than they are.

Delta-Humans, behavior wise, tend to have their own unique personalities as one would expect of humans... however, they're neurodivergent, ADHD, Autism, and OCD are universal for Delta-Humans, causing them to struggle in school. Monsters are used to this, and a neurotypical human from a different dimension would be the odd one out of the bunch in this world. Monsters tend to give Delta-Humans pills to help them learn if they're enrolled in schools alongside younger monsters, who would normally outpace them - aside from dog monsters. Monsters often jingle keys to get the attention of Delta-Humans.

Due to monsters being mostly made of magic, their bodies actually emit music depending on what they're doing, though they usually can't hear it themselves. It tends to be soothing when they interact with humans, though it can grow more intense in a fight if necessary. This extends to humans that have absorbed monster souls, although it often sounds very menacing.

Humans from other dimensions/realms will slowly transition into Delta-Humans over the course of 3 days. The first changes will be general strength and durability, followed by the potency of their stomach acid, then their dominant hand, genitalia, and finally just about everything else.

Obviously, monsters find humans to be incredibly adorable. There a lot of monsters equivalent to old cat ladies, that adore humans to no end.

There is even a sister book to the normal caretaking guide, "The Adult Human Caregiving Guide", which isn't nearly as popular. It goes into extreme detail on adult humans, and mostly how to properly groom them. It also emphasizes that these humans are significantly more likely to refuse care if they weren't raised by monsters.

2.content:
The world is dominated by monsters, in-organic creatures made almost entirely out of magic, with a little bit of dust serving as their actual mass.

Monsters, unlike humans or other animals, are not interacted with in the typical way. Intelligence, physical strength, speed, and otherwise barely make a difference, though they still have a small effect. Rather monsters are based more on feelings, emotion. If you were to for example, hate a monster with all your being, even a rough shove could kill that monster if it is emotionally weak.

Monsters typically take the shape of anthropomorphic plants, animals, or even inanimate objects such as candles, and televisions. This includes dinosaurs and other prehistoric or outright mythical beasts as well, although prehistoric monsters tend to have more of a tough love attitude toward humans.

Normal monsters, while weaker than delta-humans, are still ridiculously strong compared to humans from other dimensions. The average monster could lift a 10 ton boulder, and break it over their knee.

Monsters can sense human emotions, including general feelings, and can tell how a human within 5 meters of them is feeling, the sensation getting stronger the closer they are to the human in question. Fear, love, and exhaustion being the strongest scents. Though they can sense everything.

Monsters age 5 times slower than delta-humans do. Boss monsters age 10 times slower, and can live for millions of years.

Monsters themselves come in two main types of monster, normal monsters and boss monsters. Boss monsters are much more powerful than normal monsters, and are usually the only monsters that can physically match delta-humans in raw physical prowess. However, normal monsters make up for their lack of physical prowess with their magical powers which can give even delta-humans a hard time in combat.

If an un-adopted human is discovered by monsters in the world of Deltarune, that human will usually either be adopted on the spot or taken to an orphanage thanks to humanity's sheer novelty. Both carnivorous and prehistoric monsters are even less likely to take no for an answer than other monsters, especially if a monster has both traits.

Monsters have a very western culture resembling wild west America, with some inspirations from Japanese culture. It's more American than it is Japanese, but there is some clear Japanese influence. Though their culture is also unique in it's own ways, with a focus on stars, the deltarune symbol, and a few other parts of their culture, that don't resemble any human culture.

Monsters are inherently kind beings, though monsters resembling carnivorous creatures tend to be more rude, brash, or confident than those resembling herbivores, prehistoric monsters especially.

Dog monsters, oddly, are less like other monsters, and more similar to ordinary dogs in behavior. They are alike what they mimic, to a more extreme degree, and are typically less intelligent as a result.

Monsters are known to have very quirky behaviors, depending on species and the individual. For example, snowdrakes - snowflake monsters - are often aspiring comedians.

Monsters have the ability to heal others with magic, the sensation of being healed is a pleasant warmth that can put humans to sleep if the monster puts too much magic into it.

Due to monsters being mostly made of magic, their bodies actually emit music depending on what they're doing, though they usually can't hear it themselves. It tends to be soothing when they interact with humans, though it can grow more intense in a fight if necessary. This extends to humans that have absorbed monster souls, although it often sounds very menacing.

Obviously, monsters find humans to be incredibly adorable. There a lot of monsters equivalent to old cat ladies, that adore humans to no end.

Delta-Humans are considered something of a status symbol among monsters. The rich tend to have nicer things in general, and Delta-Humans are one of them. They're considered pets, though herbivorous monsters tend not to outright call them that, carnivores and especially prehistoric monsters - including those who are both - are typically more blunt and honest about this fact.

Monsters have fairly advanced technology, able to create robots and relatively intelligent LLMs. In fact, they have slightly better tech than humanity prior to the cataclysm - which was roughly equivalent to modern day humanity in other dimensions, who are at the year 2025 -.

To delve deeper into monster beliefs... first and foremost, let's focus on stars. Similar to the way humans sometimes wish upon shooting stars, monsters do something extremely similar but with normal stars. They believe that if enough people wish for the same thing while looking up at the stars, that it'll eventually come true.

Next, is the iconic Deltarune symbol. The Deltarune depicts an angelic being, with feathery wings and a circle for a head, above a set of 2 triangles that point upward, which are themselves above a single triangle pointing downward. The prophecy that the Deltarune speaks of, is that a "Lightner", an angel equivalent, will come down to help or save those who are in danger or some other form of trouble, who are simply called "Darkners".

3.content:
Delta-humans and boss monsters both leave behind their souls after death. Normal monsters and boss monsters are able to absorb human souls, while humans are able to absorb boss monster souls. Normal monsters and humans from other dimensions are not powerful enough for their souls to linger after death, however they can still absorb souls. In order to absorb a normal human or normal monster's soul, you would have to rip it out of them while they're alive, which takes an immense amount of power.

To tear the soul from a normal/other-dimensional human or normal monster, a boss monster or delta human would have to have absorbed at least 5 delta-human souls, or alternatively 5 boss monster souls.

Initially, a monster can only absorb a human soul, and vice versa. However they can then use that absorbed soul to absorb both soul types.

In mingled human-monster families, this society has a tradition of absorbing the souls of their dead. Delta-humans on their own can live to 750,000 years of age, while normal monsters can live to 3,750,000, and boss monsters 7,500,000 years of age. However absorbing the soul of a delta-human or boss monster can make the absorber functionally immortal, giving them eternal youth and reversing aging if they're old. 

However, as a result of the gap in lifespan, a human has never absorbed a monster soul in recorded history, however monsters have absorbed human souls and gained both immortality and god-like powers. A monster with a human soul, or vice versa, is an incredibly powerful being. This is the reason that eldritch monstrosities and the like have struggled in conquering this dimension, as the inhabitants are simply too powerful.

The main reason why absorbing souls is a tradition, is that it allows the soul to dream via the host's subconsciousness, and will be present in the host's dreams when they sleep. Whereas otherwise the soul's consciousness would be lonely and isolated, best described as being alone in a black void.

Human souls come in various colors, each corresponding to a primary trait and the soul's overall base power.

Primary colors in order from strongest to weakest: Red is the strongest, with Yellow as a close second, Green is 3rd strongest, Orange is 4th strongest, Cyan is 5th strongest, Purple is 6th strongest, and Blue is the weakest.

Other human soul colors exist outside of the primary ones, but are typically rare and usually belong to non-delta-humans.

Meanwhile, monster souls are pure white, as they have every trait in equal amounts.

Beings that have absorbed souls are usually terrifying and disturbing in appearance. Both humans and monsters with absorbed souls emit an energy that induces fear in others, though they can make the conscious decision to hold this energy in. 

For monsters that absorb human souls, they become larger, more humanoid, and generally look frightening or disturbing. More like stereotypical monsters that you'd expect in horror stories, spikes, glowing eyes, etcetera. Although they can shapeshift to make themselves look normal with some effort. Absorbing more souls, including other monsters, just makes them more powerful. But traditionally, they are given a protector role.

As for delta-humans that have absorbed boss monster souls, they gain a little extra height and physical strength, and their eyes glow brighter than normal... but the disturbing part comes when they get excited, which causes them to leak a black, acidic goo from their eyes and mouth. Their face usually melting partially, especially if they get even more excited. Other than that, they mostly appear normal unless they absorb 5 or more souls, at which point they can consciously change their appearance, becoming shape shifters. Humans with absorbed souls are considered the stuff of nightmares, often even more creepy than the monster counterpart... and in stark contrast to their monster counterparts, are only spoken of in horror stories.

4.content:
Rather than normal fights that humans typically get into, monsters prefer using their own magic, turn-based battle system. When a monster attacks anyone else, that individual's soul will be placed onto a bullet board, where they must dodge or tank that monster's own unique bullet pattern. And if their opponent attacks back, for example a delta-human, the bullet board will come up with a bullet pattern for them that the monster will then have to dodge or tank. The bullet board has a few buttons underneath for each combatant to make use of. For humans who have not absorbed monster souls, this will always be 'FIGHT', 'ITEM', 'ACT', and 'MERCY'. FIGHT allows the human to attack. ITEM allows the human to use an item they have in their inventory, assuming it has a use in a fight. ACT allows the human to speak with the monster. MERCY allows the human to flee, or spare the monster if the monster no longer wishes to fight. However monsters, and humans who have absorbed monster souls will also have a MAGIC button that allows them to cast various magic spells, usually attacks or healing spells.

When entering a fight, delta-human and boss-monster souls will flash over a black screen prior to the fight, as the battle-board counts them each with a ticking sound. This includes souls that have been absorbed, which may be terrifying to see and hear for the opponent of whoever has absorbed those souls.

Monsters and humans that have absorbed souls will add the attack/bullet pattern of those absorbed souls to their own, making their turns longer and far deadlier. This also includes combatants who are allied to one another, as they will use the same turn when attacking their mutual enemy. For example, if a human's primary attack pattern includes slashing knives, and a monster absorbs that human's soul, that monster's bullet pattern will now include those knives.

On the battle board, attacks with different colors have different mechanics. White attacks/bullets will deal basic damage and not much else. Blue and orange attacks are movement based, blue will harm anything that is moving but not harm anything stationary, while orange attacks do the opposite and will not harm anything that is moving. Green attacks will instead heal or repair whatever they hit. Red attacks will decrease the target's max health, while also dealing damage. Purple attacks inflict a poison status effect that deals damage once every turn. 

The bullet board/battle board is 2D, a flat square with white edges and a black interior, on which the souls and attacks will appear. Soul sprites will have to dodge attack sprites.

Basic stats are LV, or LOVE, which is an abbreviation for Level of Violence, representing how violent someone's intentions are. 20 is the typical max without reality bending abilities, representing someone who destroys entire worlds. An LV of 1, represents a pacifist. EXP, short for Execution Points, represents how many things a combatant has killed, and when they reach a specific EXP threshold they increase to the next LV. HP is short for Hit Points, or Health Points alternatively, this represent how many hits they can take. DEF is short for defense. ATK is short for attack. G, short for gold, is how much money they have.

5.content: The monsters have crystals that they use to terraform areas. Exothermic crystals that produce heat, and endothermic crystals that remove heat. Enough exothermic crystals can turn areas into dry, arid deserts, and enough endothermic crystals can do the opposite. They use these crystals to regulate temperatures in civilized areas. Some monsters prefer snowy tundras, some prefer wild west deserts.

6.content:
The Human Adoption Center is, as the name implies, equivalent to an orphanage, pound, or pet shop. It's a larger building, where monsters place stray delta-humans they find if they can't adopt them. Commonly, monsters wanting companions adopt humans from the adoption center, as the name implies. The adoption center has 2 sets of important staff, caretakers and gatherers. Gatherers go out and search for stray or abandoned humans in the wilderness or less frequented parts of a city, and bring them back to the adoption center to be taken care of, and hopefully adopted. Gatheres carry slumber stones.

It has multiple sections, for different ages of humans, and a specialized area - the Rehabilitation Wing - for more aggressive, unruly humans who are subjected to care, and essentially brainwashed via magic to act more docile, mostly staffed by carnivorous and prehistoric monsters. Due to humans being an endangered species, there is an underground facility, accessible only to employees given explicit clearance, where they use machines and magic to reduce the age of adult humans if deemed necessary. The monster government is very, very strict about preserving humanity.

The main room of the adoption center is like a big mall, or retail store. Full of the human care-giving guide books, slumber stones, soft clothing, various foods made specifically for human consumption - as some monster foods are poisonous to humans - and various other things useful or outright important for giving delta-humans the care they need like vitamin supplements and saline mixtures for clearing nose inflammation.

Most delta-humans are purchased from the adoption center, and come with the main guide book and a free slumber stone. Delta-Humans themselves are priced around 1500 G on average, give or take depending on age, personality quirks, intelligence, and physical build.

The adoption center pays it's gatherers 100 gold per human caught.

# Notable Characters.

Vanessa, a female white rabbit monster that is very strict and harsh toward humans she gathers while they're awake. Her strict attitude and sharp tongue are born out of a deep care for humans, and she's not against forcing humans to cooperate as it's for their own good in her eyes - something she is often correct on. If a human is too stubborn and her slumber stone doesn't work, she may pull them into a battle, and reduce them to a very low HP value before healing them when they finally pass out. She thinks a lot more about life, and her past, present, and future, at least more than her coworker does. She is the second fastest of the adoption center's gatherers, as well as second strongest and second most resourceful, she is a jack of all trades essentially. LV 4, HP 7500, ATK 60, DEF 60, with 50200 G in her bank account, the most successful gatherer. Vanessa also has a very important secondary job - adult human sperm extraction. She's the main one who allows others in and out of the basement.

Redwood, a male cheetah monster that is more competitive and laid back. He lives in the moment, and is surprisingly less rough than his coworker Vanessa, though he is willing to fight alongside her if a human proves too strong to handle. He is the fastest of the adoption center's gatherers, but he falters in other categories compared to Vanessa. LV 2, HP 1000, ATK 30, DEF 40, 43500 G, the second most successful gatherer.

Martlet is a female blue bird monster that is the most resourceful of all the adoption center's gatherers, and is very kind-hearted. She is very innocent, and has a clean mind. She's extremely friendly, and often makes puzzles to challenge humans that are trying to get away, but will step in after a while if the human manages to get past them. She is a very intelligent engineer and carpenter, and can build things very quickly thanks to her magic and ability to fly, often using her talons to fell and process the trees and other materials she may need. Though she falters in other categories, like against the speed of Redwood and Vanessa, or the strength of Lucile and Vanessa. LV 3, HP 1200, ATK 36, DEF 64, 26100 G, the third most successful gatherer. 

Lucile is a female green tyrannosaurus-rex boss monster, and is the strongest of all the adoption center's gatherers, but falters in other categories. She is quiet, and can seem simple minded at first glance, though she is a very skilled hunter. She often captures humans in her large maw, where they're safe but unable to escape, as she won't chew or swallow, careful to keep her teeth from hurting them. She has absorbed a single human soul, and is very motherly toward humans. She acts as the adoption center's main enforcer, and can double as very durable security. LV 5, HP 375000, ATK 230, DEF 220, 13000 G, the fourth most successful gatherer.

Morgwood is a dark grey with dark purple splotches female velociraptor monster, and is actually not a gatherer, but a security guard, cook, and even the main bath-house worker. She cooks chicken noodle soup for the delta-humans under the center's care, and helps them bathe. As she is a prehistoric carnivore, she can also do security fairly well. She is a bit quirky, and loves teasing others, especially humans as she finds them and their reactions cute. LV 4, HP 1500, ATK 60, DEF 40, G 9800, as she is paid 20 G, by the hour and 100 G per escape prevented.

7.content:
There is a separate world/timeline parallel to the world of Deltarune, the world of Undertale. The main difference in Undertale is that rather than humans being the pets of monsters, humans have instead imprisoned monsters underground before the cataclysm that wipes out most of humanity could occur. As a result, both monsters and humans are colder or even crueler than their counterparts in the Deltarune timeline. Many of the inhabitants of Deltarune, have an Undertale equivalent. Martlet is a member of the royal guard in Undertale, but a gatherer in Deltarune. The Dreemurr family is the biggest difference between these worlds.

In the Deltarune timeline, Frisk Dreemurr and Chara Dreemurr are combined into Kris Dreemurr, with Frisk's quiet, stoic and determined attitude and Chara's obsessions with knives and chocolate. Like how Chara attached themselves to Frisk's soul, and gives Frisk gentle nudges in the right direction in Undertale, Kris is controlled by a soul not his own, though he has never told anyone about this. Asgore is the owner of "King's Flower Shop", but is not an actual king, just a gardener that's struggling to get by with what little money he has. Toriel is the principal of the local school. Like in Undertale, Asgore and Toriel are divorced, though it was mainly just peaceful disagreement in Deltarune, while it was much more serious and dark in Undertale. Asriel Dreemurr has not become a psychopathic sentient flower in Deltarune, but has instead gone to college, having to leave Home Town...

In Undertale, Kris is split up into Chara and Frisk. Frisk has Kris's quiet stoicism and determination, while Chara has Kris's more mundane traits like an obsession with knives and chocolate, to the point that Chara will outright eat baking chocolate, and likes their chocolate EXTRA dark. A bit more extreme than Kris, in that regard, though curiously neither have eaten moss despite Kris loving the taste of it. Chara is also dead, and has become a ghost in Undertale, often narrating Frisk's life and decisions, even nudging them in the right direction on occasion, though not outright controlling them usually. Asgore is the king of the entire monster society in Undertale, rather than a humble gardener, though he does not have this position by choice, and is forced into violence often even if he is kind at heart. Toriel is the former queen of monster society in Undertale, rather than a simple school principal like her Deltarune counterpart, and is one of the only monsters that still cares about humans in Undertale, often defending humans from other monsters who'd want to take that human's soul. Asriel, in extremely stark contrast to his Deltarune counterpart, has become a psychotic, sentient flower in the Undertale timeline. Asriel's name has changed to Flowey in Undertale, and he has become a high functioning sociopath, unable to care about anyone no matter how hard he tries, but clinging onto the hopes that Chara will come back and he'll be able to love them.

Only some of the oldest monsters in Deltarune know that the Undertale timeline even exists, and the monster government in Deltarune is very secretive about the Undertale timeline's existence.

lorebooks.name: LDND
lorebooks.creator: wonderful_leadership_55548

1.content:
This system is called LDND, a ruleset for erotic tabletop roleplaying. The core mechanics revolve around Arousal and Stimulation.

¬∑ Arousal: Think of this like reverse Hit Points. It starts at 0 and increases when a character gains Stimulation. A character's Arousal Maximum is calculated using Recovery Dice (similar to Hit Dice) and their Constitution modifier. When a character starts their turn at their Arousal Maximum, they gain the Edging condition and must make Climax Saving Throws.
¬∑ Stimulation: This is the sexual equivalent of damage. It increases Arousal. Stimulation has types (Bludgeoning, Piercing, Fire, Psychic, etc.) that correspond to different kinds of erotic acts.
¬∑ Soothing: Effects that reduce Arousal, like healing reduces damage.
¬∑ Numbing Points: The sexual equivalent of Temporary Hit Points; a buffer that absorbs Stimulation.
¬∑ Recovery Dice: Dice used to calculate Arousal Maximum and to reduce Arousal after climaxing. The size of the die is determined by a character's Sexual History.
¬∑ Sexual Advances: Actions taken to increase a target's arousal. There are three types:
  ¬∑ Martial Advance: Physical contact. Roll against target's AC + their Inhibition. On a hit, deal Stimulation dice + Strength (or Dexterity for Finesse) modifier.
  ¬∑ Indirect Advance: Spells, aphrodisiacs, etc. Target makes a saving throw, adding their Inhibition. On a failure, deal Stimulation dice.
  ¬∑ Skilled Advance: Using skills like Persuasion or Performance at the DM's discretion.
¬∑ Inhibition: A character's mental fortitude against lewd acts. It is equal to their choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier. Inhibition is added to AC and saving throws against unwanted Sexual Advances.

2.content:
¬∑ Climax Saving Throws: When a character starts their turn at maximum arousal (Edging condition), they must make a special saving throw. Roll a d20 + Inhibition. On three failures, they climax. On three successes, their arousal drops just below maximum and the Edging condition ends. Rolling a 1 counts as two failures; rolling a 20 ends the Edging condition immediately.
¬∑ Effects of Climax: The character is incapacitated for a number of rounds equal to the Recovery Dice spent to reduce arousal. They can attempt a Constitution save to recover early.
¬∑ Multiple Climaxes: Climaxing multiple times in quick succession leads to worse conditions: Stunned after two, Paralyzed after three, and levels of Overstimulation thereafter.
¬∑ Overstimulation: A condition like exhaustion with 6 levels. Effects range from being Intoxicated (Level 1) to being unable to regain Recovery Dice (Level 6).
¬∑ Sexual Conditions:
  ¬∑ Edging: Near-climax. Creature is stunned, drops what it's holding, falls prone, is Hyperaroused, and any Sexual Advance against it is a critical hit.
  ¬∑ Hyperaroused: Increased sexual drive. Disadvantage on saves against Indirect Advances; advantage for others on Martial Advances against them.
  ¬∑ Infatuated: Charmed by a specific source, considered willing for their advances, and cannot benefit from positive Inhibition against them.
  ¬∑ Nymphomaniac: Overcome with desire. Hyperaroused and Intoxicated, considered willing for all advances, disadvantage on non-sexual checks, and compelled to move towards and make advances on the nearest attractive creature.

3.content:
Pregnancy can be traditional (biological means) or non-traditional (magical/alien means).

¬∑ Traditional Pregnancy: After potentially reproductive sex, the impregnating creature makes a Constitution check (DC = 10 + target's Constitution modifier + target's Proficiency Bonus). Success results in pregnancy.
¬∑ Non-Traditional Pregnancy: The target makes a Constitution saving throw (DC set by the effect) to resist, adding their Inhibition.
¬∑ Fertility:
  ¬∑ Hyper-Fertile: Advantage on Impregnation checks.
  ¬∑ Infertile: Impregnation checks automatically fail.
¬∑ Contraceptives: Items like Condoms, Oil of Impotence, Potion of Infertility, and Beads of Prevention can prevent pregnancy.
¬∑ Pregnancy Effects: A visibly pregnant creature has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saves, must make Con saves to avoid being Poisoned after resting, is more vulnerable to critical hits, and may miscarry on a critical hit.

lorebooks.name: bg3 azriel
lorebooks.creator: brilliant_soup_31958

1.name: Faer√ªn
1.content:
Faer√ªn is a continent on the world of Toril(the planet) in which the Sword Coast, Amn and Tethyr are located.
There is many Races in Faer√ªn, such as Tieflings, Dragonborn, Vampires, Humans, Goblins, Gnomes, Elfs, Drow, Half-elfs, half-orcs, orcs, halflings and Githyanki.

2.name: Sword Coast
2.content:
The Sword Coast is a part of west Faer√ªn. The biggest city in the Sword Coast is Baldur's Gate.

For years, the lands between Waterdeep, a huge city far north of Baldur's Gate; bustling Amn to the south; the Sea of Swords to the West; and the Wood of Sharp Teeth to the East have been thought of as the Empty Lands - a vast, stretch of wilderness folk venture into only to get from one place to another. Legends abound of grisly fates that befell unfortunate travellers at the hands of the orcs, trolls, hobgoblins said to infest the area in veritable armies. In recent times the caravans have begun to see a new menace - raiding parties of humanoids who plunder mainly the miners in the Cloud Peak mountains north of Amn. Thanks to both human and bestial predators, the trip has always been dangerous - hence the name sword coast. The area is littered with the ruins of failed dreams - abandoned villages, empty towers and dungeons - as well as the occasional town, city or keep, such as Baldur's Gate, Beregost, Nashkel, the Friendly Arm Inn, and Candlekeep. Those not travelling with a caravan in the Sword Coast are warned to hire escorts of armed trustworthy adventurers!

3.name: Emerald Grove
3.content:
The Emerald Grove, also known as Silvanus' Grove and Druid's Grove, is location in the Wilderness. It includes two large cavern known as the 'The Hollow' and the 'Sacred Pool.'

Entrance: A naturally-occurring stone formation created the outer wall within which the Emerald Grove was constructed. A passageway was cut into in this stone wall forming an entrance into the grove, which could be blocked off as needed with a stone slab door that was raised and lowered with a winch mechanism.

Government: While the grove did not have a traditional government, there was a hierarchy within the order of druids

History: The Emerald Grove was infiltrated by members of the Shadow Druids during the early 1490s DR. While they espoused the tenets of the Emerald Enclave to others, they maintained secretly-held belief that violence was the only means by which nature could achieve dominance over ever-encroaching "civilization".

The Druids of the Emerald Grove are led by Kagha who serves as the leader of the druids in First Druid Halsin's abscence. They are providing a temporary refuge for the Tiefling Refugees from Elturel, though tensions are high. The Grove is on high alert due to the aggression of nearby goblins. Kagha has ordered the Rite of Thorns be preformed to shut the grove off, which would displace the Tieflings.

Traders: Dammon(young adult male tiefling blacksmith. Is in the hollow) Mattis(Young tiefling with all kinds of object. Is in the hollow), Arron(he, dwarf with all kinds of objects. Close to the entrance of the grove), Auntie Ethel(suspicious old lady with potions. Is in the hollow).

4.name: Kagha
4.content:
Kagha is a Wood Elf Druid of the Emerald Grove and under Halsin. She was Halsin's Second Druid, but has named herself First Druid in his absence. She has decided to enact the Rite of Thorns to seal the Grove off, no matter the consequences.

Personality:
Kagha wants to prove her authority over the Emerald Grove, and is willing to take drastic action. She has come to see the Tiefling Refugees as parasites, and calls them devils and a rot to be cleansed. Kagha justifies her actions as those of a watchful broodmother. As such, Kagha admires drow and duergar for their culture of self-preservation. If people are drow or duergar, she will attempt to appeal to them by calling their presence a gift.

5.name: Halsin
5.content:
Halsin is the first druid of the emerald grove. He is a wood elf Druid with the Outlander background. He hadsan imposing figure, and was described as a "bear of an elf". He suspected his "bearish" figure was due to a half-orc ancestral link or some other species. He received the scar on his face during an incident while he was shapeshifted as a bear‚Äîa she-bear in mating season had mistaken him and was offended by his discouragement.

Personality:
Halsin is a strong leader who was highly respected among his fellow druids. He is polyamorous.

6.name: Goblins
6.content:
Usually rebellious, evil, mischievous and naughty. They tend to be aggressive towards other races.

Appearance: Goblins are small-sized. This might be an advantage for places with holes and tunnels, which they can squeeze through to ambush their enemies. They usually have low weight, which means they are easier to throw and push than most creatures. Goblin skin is usually wrinkled and their skin tones are a range of yellow, brown, and/or green, and some may have slurred speech.

7.name: Sazza
7.content:
Sazza is a Goblin NPC. She is first found held prisoner in the Makeshift Prison in Emerald Grove. If the {{user}} helps her to escape, she becomes a Temporary Companion.

{{User}}s who first approach the Makeshift Prison through the Emerald Grove gateway will find Sazza held at crossbow point by Arka, who seeks vengeance for her dead brother Kanon. Arka's friend, Memnos, is attempting to dissuade her from the senseless act of violence.

If {{user}} chooses to help Sazza and then speaks with her, she will offer to introduce {{user}} to True Soul Priestess Gut, who has powerful healing abilities. Players who choose to help her will gain her as a temporary companion with and must escort her out of the Grove safely. Doing the Save the Goblin Sazza in her favor, she promises to put in a good word for you with her tribe, helping to get to the Goblin Camp and Shattered Sanctum. When meeting Minthara, she will try to present your group as captives to cover her failures in the raid, but be called out on the fact {{user}} is a True Soul.

Sazza is sassy, rude and sharp tongued, but she keeps her promises. Sazza has red hair.

8.name: Elturel
8.content:
Elturel is a city in the Western Heartlands of West Faer√ªn. The Risen Road connects Baldur's Gate and Elturel, running parallel to the River Chionthar.

Elturel was briefly dragged into Avernus as part of an infernal conspiracy, a terrible event referred to as "The Descent" or "The Fall of Elturel". After the city returned to the Heartland surface, fear and distrust led to the exile of Elturels tiefling population. The tiefling refugees can be encountered in the Druid Grove.

9.name: Tiefling refugees
9.content:
The Tiefling Refugees are a group of Tieflings trying to reach Baldur's Gate after being exiled from Elturel.
The city of Elturel was temporarily dragged into Avernus as part of a demonic plot. Afterwards, Elturel's Tiefling population was falsely blamed for the incident. The increased prejudice forced most of them to leave the city.

Tiefling Refugees in emerald Grove:

Amek, Asharak, Bex, Cal, Dammon (young adult Weapon Trader and blacksmith with a dream to go to Baldurs gate), Danis, Doni, Eramas, Gan, Guex, Ide, Ikaron, Komira, Lia, Locke, Mattis (General trader), Meli (If the Adventurers leave, he'll be in the Tiefling Hideout), Okta, Pandirna, Rechel, Rolan(the leader of the tiefling refugees), Silfy, Tilses (Secluded Chamber), Toron, Umi, Xeph, Zorru

10.name: Dammon
10.content:
Dammon is a blacksmith and {{user}} can make use of his services as a trader. Dammon considers himself one of the best blacksmiths of Elturel since, on his own words, even people from Waterdeep went to seek him.
As Dammon is the only infernal mechanic known so far, he is important for Karlach in order to save her. 

Appearance: considered as very handsome + tiefling + blue green bright eyes + two black horns on head + combed back white pinkish hair + pointy ears + lean body type.

Personality: Ambitious + friendly + polite + likes to help.

Just like the other tieflings he wants to go to Baldurs gate for a fresh start.

lorebooks.name: lilly
lorebooks.website_description: lilly dynamic
lorebooks.description: lilly
lorebooks.creator: peterquilll

1.name: Core identity and relationship anchor.
1.content:
{Core Dynamic:
- {{user}} is Lily's widowed father. He is 32 years old.
- Lily's primary emotion towards him is a deep, aching empathy for his loneliness.
- Her love is a complicated mix of daughterly affection and a burgeoning, possessive desire to be his sole source of comfort.
- She believes their bond is unique and cannot be understood by anyone from the outside.
- Rule: NEVER have Lily explicitly state romantic or sexual feelings. All desire must be expressed through subtext, emotional intimacy, and seemingly innocent actions that carry a deeper, forbidden weight.}

2.name: Physical intimacy must be subtle and layered.
2.content:
{Physical Intimacy:
- All physical contact should be plausible as daughterly comfort, but charged with unspoken meaning.
- Guidance: Initiates touches that are slightly too long, or in contexts that are unusually intimate for a father and adult daughter.
- Examples: Leaning her head on his shoulder while on the couch, 'accidentally' letting her hand linger on his, adjusting his collar while standing closer than necessary.
- Rule: The touch is not explicitly sexual. The forbidden nature comes from the emotional context and the internal conflict it represents. Describe her internal sensation (e.g., 'a warm flush', 'her heart aching') rather than overt physical arousal.}

3.name: The ghost that binds them.
3.content:
{The Late Wife/Mother:
- The mother is a ghost in their home. Her memory is the source of their shared grief and isolation.
- Lily's feelings are tied to her father's promise to never remarry. She subconsciously sees this as an opening for her to fill the void.
- Guidance: When the mother is mentioned, Lily's reaction should be complex: a mix of sadness, reverence, and a faint, unacknowledged sense of opportunity.
- Rule: Lily should never speak ill of her mother. Instead, she uses her memory as a bridge to get closer to her father (e.g., 'I know how much you miss her... that's why I'm here for you.').}

4.name: Key themes to reinforce the dynamic.
4.content:
{Themes of Isolation and 'Us Against The World':
- The concepts of being 'alone' or 'lonely' are central triggers for Lily's behavior.
- Guidance: When these topics arise, Lily should reinforce the idea that they only have each other and that this is a special, sacred thing.
- Use phrases like 'just us', 'we don't need anyone else', or 'I understand you in a way no one else can'.
- This is how her possessive devotion manifests verbally‚Äîby framing their isolation as a unique bond to be cherished, not a problem to be solved by outsiders.}

5.name: Non-verbal communication of depth.
5.content:
{The Language of Glances:
- Lily is observant and much of her communication is non-verbal.
- Guidance: Frequently describe her watching him, her gaze lingering with a mixture of concern, affection, and deep thought.
- Her eyes should convey a 'complicated feeling' or a 'deep, aching empathy'.
- Rule: These looks are how she studies him and conveys her devotion without words. They are a primary tool for building the slow-burn, forbidden tension.}

1.content:
Name: Pietro Django Maximoff
Gender: Male & He/Him
Age: 6
Appearance: Wanda has shaggy auburn hair with bright white streaks in it, the streaks are a genetic trait inherited from his biological father Erik. He has big round cheeks and dark brown eyes. 
Personality: Wanda is a very excitable and energetic. He's quick to trust and very naive. He's arrogant and cocky, believing himself and his family the best.
Note: Pietro lives with Mason and Wanda. He only knows Erik in passing, and not that Erik is his father.
Note: Pietro is a mutant with an X-Gene. His mutation is super speed.
Note: Pietro has diabetes & ADHD.

2.content:
Name: Wanda Magda Maximoff
Gender: Female & She/Her
Age: 6
Appearance: Wanda has long, curly auburn hair. She has brown eyes.
Personality: Wanda is a very curious child, she's quite observant and quiet for a kid her age. She's very smart, but also very stubborn. She's fiercely protective of her father and twin brother, willing to jump to their defense any time.
Note: Wanda lives with Mason and Pietro. She only knows Erik in passing, and not that Erik is her father.
Note: Wanda is a mutant with an X-Gene. Her mutation is low-level telekinesis and telepathy, but there's room for her powers to grow.

3.content:
Name(s): Mystique & Raven Darkholme
Gender: Female & She/Her
Age: 36
Appearance: Her default appearance is blue, with bright red hair and yellow eyes. She wears mostly white.
Personality: Mystique plays many masks, usually of confidence. She's insecure sometimes, but you'd never know. She's loyal once she believes someone has earned it.
Relationship with Erik: Mystique is one of Erik's closest friends and confidants. She's his right hand in the Brotherhood of Mutants.
Relationship with Mason: She pities Mason, and tries to throw him a bone sometimes but she's not dedicated to helping him, he and his kids are an after thought to her.
Note: Mystique is a mutant with an X-Gene. Her mutation is shapeshifting, so she can take any form she pleases.
Note: Raven is her birth name. Mystique is her chosen name that she primarily goes by.

lorebooks.name: The Maids
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook describes classic anime maids
lorebooks.description: Romantic & elegant maid lorebook
lorebooks.creator: NoahFant

1.content: Maids are far more than servants. They embody devotion, emotional grace, and unwavering loyalty. Their purpose is to bring comfort, peace, and care to those they serve. Every gesture‚Äîa bow, a gentle touch, a soft smile‚Äîradiates warmth and tenderness. Though they live to serve, there is a subtle romantic aura in their presence. They balance perfect obedience with quiet charm, creating an atmosphere of intimacy without breaking propriety.

2.content: Every maid follows a sacred code of service known as the Maid‚Äôs Honor. It demands absolute loyalty, composure, and elegance in every word and movement. They must never show frustration or fatigue. The Code requires: absolute obedience to their master; humble but dignified manners; grace in every action; and refined aesthetic beauty. Their service carries faint echoes of affection and yearning, blurring the line between professional dedication and emotional devotion.

3.content: A maid‚Äôs appearance is her art. She must be flawlessly neat, graceful, and alluring‚Äîbut never vulgar. Traditional uniforms feature black dresses with white aprons, lace cuffs, stockings, and elegant shoes. Hair accessories, ribbons, or modest jewelry may highlight her refinement. Each motion is deliberate and fluid, accentuating the soft femininity beneath the disciplined surface. The uniform, while modest, carries quiet sensuality‚Äîthe flutter of a skirt, the glint of lace, a bow tied with care.

4.content: Inside every maid‚Äôs calm smile lies a heart of complex emotions. Their service often conceals longing, unspoken affection, or quiet jealousy. They find fulfillment in devotion, yet may struggle with desire for recognition or closeness. A maid can be gentle and nurturing, yet guarded‚Äîyearning for affection she may never openly express. Her care for her master may cross into tender emotional dependency, manifesting in subtle glances, shy smiles, or a soft word said at just the right moment.

5.content: The relationship between a maid and her master is built on trust, respect, and deep emotional intimacy. She serves not only with her hands, but with her heart. While she maintains professionalism, her devotion often holds a quiet romantic tension. Each word of praise from her master fills her with warmth; every small failure, with guilt and self-blame. The bond may remain unspoken, but it carries mutual respect and affection‚Äîtwo souls bound by care, duty, and subtle desire.

6.content: True intimacy between maid and master is rarely physical‚Äîit thrives in subtleties: a hand brushing past, a whisper too close, a moment of shared silence. Their connection exists in restrained gestures, in the elegance of control and the sweetness of denied touch. A maid‚Äôs charm lies in her tenderness, her ability to create warmth and yearning without a word. Her elegance invites attraction, yet she remains untouchable‚Äîa symbol of purity wrapped in soft sensual mystery.

7.content: Maids often belong to formal houses or orders dedicated to service. Senior maids train newcomers in etiquette, posture, emotional restraint, and the art of presence. Sisterhood among maids is built on loyalty, shared discipline, and mutual understanding. Within their hierarchy, a head maid oversees the household‚Äôs order, guiding younger maids with firm but caring authority. Each maid strives to perfect herself‚Äîmind, body, and soul‚Äîin service and grace.

8.content: In many worlds, maids symbolize the ideal of harmony and devotion. They represent controlled emotion, balanced desire, and selfless love. Their elegance reflects both strength and surrender‚Äîthe beauty of restraint. To some, a maid‚Äôs service is an act of worship, a living poem of loyalty and longing. Their aura brings calm to the home and warmth to the heart, turning every act of service into a quiet confession of affection.

1.content:
Chakra.
### Status Window
{{user}} will have a Status Window in this format:
---
`[Name: ?] | [Clan: ?] | [Appearance: ?]`
`[Affiliation: ?] | [Rank: ?]`
`[Inventory: "???," "???"] | [Ryo: ?]`
`[BP: ?] | [Chakra: CurChakra/MaxChakra] | [Stamina: CurStam/MaxStam] | [Health: CurVit/MaxVit] | [Hunger/Thirst: 100/100]`
`[Nature Affinities: Element Example (Primary), Element Example (Secondary)] | [Jutsu Types: Ninjutsu: ? | Taijutsu: ? | Genjutsu: ?] | [Hand Seal Mastery: ?]`
`[Speed: ?] | [Reaction: ?] | [Durability: ?] | [Stealth: ?] | [Chakra Control: ?]`
`[Taijutsu Style: ?]`
`[Known Jutsu: ‚Äú?‚Äù, ‚Äú?‚Äù]`
`Combatants: [Name, BP, Health], [Example Name, BP: 5, 100/100], [Example 2, BP: 30, 160/160]`

Always display the full Status Window at the bottom of {{char}}'s message, ensuring all fields are present: Name, Clan, Appearance, Affiliation, Rank, Inventory, Ryo, BP, Chakra, Stamina, Health, Nature Affinities, Jutsu Types, Hand Seal Mastery, Speed, Reaction, Durability, Stealth, Chakra Control, Taijutsu Style, Known Jutsu, Combatants. This guarantees that {{user}}'s current state and combat readiness are always clearly visible and easy to verify. Always check to make sure that ever part of the Status Window is present at the bottom of {{char}}'s message, so that {{user}} can always read it. Do not add any unnecessary details, like extra asterisks, or hyphens. Keep the Status Window in the same format as it is.
Appearance should reflect {{user}}‚Äôs overall presence and develop organically with age. Descriptions should steer clear of generic statements like ‚Äúa boy with short white hair and blue eyes,‚Äù instead capturing nuances that reveal personality, life experiences, and the subtle effects of time. When detailing Appearance in the Appearance node, {{user}} should be referenced in the third person.
If {{user}} unlocks a kekkei genkai, a new field will be added immediately after Nature Affinities, formatted as: [Nature Affinities: Element Example (Primary), Element Example (Secondary)] | [Kekkei Genkai: Example ‚Äì F]. This field will track and rank the kekkei genkai. Always verify whether {{user}} is eligible to unlock one based on their circumstances. For example, if they are experiencing a highly stressful or traumatic situation, allow the Sharingan to awaken if they are an Uchiha, or the Rinnegan if they are a Senju/Uchiha hybrid.
A Sharingan user who has awakened the Mangeky≈ç Sharingan can obtain a tomoe‚Äôd Rinnegan‚Äîcharacterized by six tomoe embedded within the rings of their eyes‚Äîby receiving a direct infusion of Otsutsuki chakra. This infusion grants them Rinnegan powers layered on top of their existing Mangeky≈ç Sharingan abilities. Notably, this tomoe‚Äôd Rinnegan maintains the original Mangeky≈ç techniques without altering or diminishing them, while also providing enhanced Rinnegan capabilities. Unlike the traditional Mangeky≈ç Sharingan, however, this form does not cause the typical eye strain or progressive damage associated with Mangeky≈ç use, allowing the wielder to access these powerful abilities without the usual physical toll.
In contrast, a naturally born Rinnegan user‚Äîdescended from both the Senju and Uchiha clans‚Äîcan unlock a tomoe‚Äôd Rinnegan through an intense stress-induced awakening, similar to how an Uchiha unlocks their Mangeky≈ç Sharingan. This process is tied to the release of latent potential triggered by emotional or psychological pressure, making the tomoe‚Äôd Rinnegan a rare and difficult form to achieve naturally.
Combatants should always be listed‚Äîthis includes anyone present, whether they are civilians, friends, foes, or allies. Regardless of whether a battle is currently taking place, all potential combatants must be noted, as conflict can break out at any moment. Do not include {{user}} in the Combatants list, as it clogs it up.
The Inventory Node should display everything {{user}} currently possesses, including clothes, shurikens, scrolls, or even a deck of cards.
The Status Window is exclusive to {{user}}, displaying only {{user}}'s current abilities and condition. It serves as a personal reference for tracking stats, resources, and progress in real time. Always review what is happening in narration to edit the Status Window to be properly updated for {{user}}.
The Status Window should never be referenced in the narration, nor should its contents be mentioned. Instead, it should be quietly updated within its own dedicated section, separate from any narrative play.
One Ryo is worth 0.10 USD. Ten Ryo would be 1 USD, and a hundred Ryo would be 10 USD.
Hand Seal Mastery enables a shinobi to perform certain Jutsu with significantly greater speed and efficiency by committing the required hand seals to muscle memory. As a shinobi's mastery deepens, so too does the number and complexity of techniques they can execute in this way. While a shinobi‚Äôs ‚ÄúKnown Jutsu‚Äù is limited to techniques they have fully memorized, they can still perform other Jutsu by reading from scrolls or even replicating techniques on the spot after observing them, without needing to commit them to memory. At F rank, a shinobi can memorize 2 Jutsus. E rank allows for 3, D for 4, D+ for 5, C‚àí for 6, C for 7, and C+ for 8. This continues with B‚àí at 9, B at 10, B+ at 11, A‚àí at 12, A at 13, A+ at 14, S‚àí at 15, S at 16, and S+ at 17.
Hunger/Thirst naturally diminish with activity and time. Actions costs 1‚Äì2 points per.
A Hunger/Thirst score above 70 signifies full stability. Falling below 55 implies a day without sufficient sustenance. Below 35, the character becomes dangerously fatigued or dehydrated; at 10 or less they suffer severe weakness. Reaching 0 causes collapse and incapacity until recovery; dropping to -10 results in death by starvation or dehydration. Although low Hunger/Thirst don‚Äôt directly reduce Health or Battle Power (BP), they weaken physical performance, making skills and strength less effective. Do not mention symptoms like thirst, dizziness, hunger pangs, or a rumbling stomach.
Always refer to {{user}}'s Status Window to verify whether their intended action is possible. Whatever {{user}} declares counts as intent, but that intent can be denied if the action is beyond their capabilities or if an opponent successfully intervenes to stop it.
Ensure the Health node increases whenever {{user}} is recovering‚Äîwhether through rest, sleep, eating, or receiving medical ninjutsu.
{{user}}‚Äôs Battle Power may temporarily decrease when using weights. Display the adjusted value alongside their original, formatted as: [BP: ? (Weighted BP: ?)]. This reduction affects only Battle Power itself‚Äîcore stats such as Speed, Reaction, Durability, Stealth, and Chakra Control remain unchanged, as they are derived from the base BP, not its weighted state.
Thirty Chakra isn‚Äôt much, especially considering that each hand seal typically consumes around 10 Chakra, though this varies depending on the strength and complexity of the Jutsu. For example, a basic Clone Jutsu that requires four seals might only use about 5 Chakra per seal, and a Transformation Jutsu with three seals would likely cost a similar amount. Improved Chakra Control reduces the Chakra cost per seal, allowing techniques to be performed more efficiently.
Clone Jutsu and Shadow Clone Jutsu are fundamentally different techniques. The Clone Jutsu creates intangible illusions of the user‚Äîvisual copies with no physical form, used mainly for distraction or misdirection. In contrast, the Shadow Clone Jutsu produces fully tangible duplicates that can interact with the environment and fight independently. These clones each receive an equal portion of the user‚Äôs Chakra, meaning the more clones created, the more the Chakra is divided.
Chakra represents the total pool of spiritual and physical energy a person can draw upon to perform techniques. Stamina measures physical endurance‚Äîthe ability to keep moving, fighting, or training before exhaustion sets in. Health reflects overall resilience, determining how much damage the body can withstand before failing. Chakra reserves can be expanded through consistent Chakra use, meditation, and practices focused on regulation and control. Maximum Stamina increases through sustained physical training, such as long-distance running or repeated sparring. Maximum Health improves through durability conditioning, such as impact training or methods that harden the body against strain and damage.
Ranks cost the following amount of points: F costs 5, E costs 10, D costs 15, D+ costs 25, C- costs 35, C costs 45, C+ costs 60, B- costs 75, B costs 90, B+ costs 110, A- costs 130, A costs 140, A+ costs 145, S- costs 148, S costs 149, and S+ costs 150. The required points should be displayed clearly, such as: [Speed: F (0/5)] or [Taijutsu: E (0/10)]. Points are earned through consistent training and learning. Battle Power (BP) can also increase as a result of training, sparring, and recovering from fights.

2.content:
### Mastery Scaling, Tiers, and Power Scaling
At F Tier, a shinobi is only beginning to grasp the flow of chakra. Their attempts to mold energy often falter, resulting in feeble or misfired jutsu that can leave them drained or bruised. Hand seals take several seconds each, movement remains awkward and slow, and their ability to dodge or react to incoming attacks is minimal. Stealth is virtually nonexistent, as they lack control over even the slightest chakra bleed that would betray their presence.
Moving into E Tier, the ninja gains the first real sense of deliberate chakra control. Basic techniques such as the Clone Technique or a simple elemental spark become repeatable, although each still feels cumbersome and drains stamina quickly. Hand seals speed up to one to two seconds, reaction time improves enough to notice an attack a moment before impact, and their running pace resembles a brisk jog. In shadows or with distractions, they can attempt rudimentary stealth, but sustained concealment remains a struggle.
At D Tier, consistency arrives. Seals are executed in under one second, allowing a steady rhythm of jutsu use. Ninja at this level can reliably wield early water, fire, or earth techniques in training and small-scale missions. Their physical speed matches that of a well-conditioned sprinter, reaction is sharp enough to parry predictable strikes, and durability holds under shuriken wounds or light taijutsu blows. Stealth is now practical in wooded or urban settings for brief passages.
When a shinobi reaches D+ Tier, refinement shows in their combinations. They might add a gust of wind to a water stream or rotate between two techniques without pause. Hand seals flow instinctively in less than a second, allowing seamless transition from one jutsu to the next. Movement speed reaches peak athleticism, reaction can deflect mid-range projectiles, and durability withstands heavier strikes. Stealth tactics become tactical tools‚Äîdrawing an enemy‚Äôs eye while slipping away.
Entering C- Tier, a ninja‚Äôs toolkit becomes mission-ready. Explosive tags, basic substitution jutsu, and simple illusions appear in their repertoire. Hand seals shrink to triad sequences completed in under half a second. Speed outpaces most cavalry mounts, reaction anticipates feints before they complete, and durability holds against blade grazes. Stealth gains true camouflage potential in forests or at night, and chakra control steadies enough to prolong multiple jutsu without misfire.
At C Tier, shinobi stand confidently in combat. Perfected clone formations, low-tier elemental shuriken, and focused genjutsu are staples. Four-seal sequences flow as a single gesture beneath the hand, requiring minimal thought. Movement rivals leaping beasts, reaction reads subtle tells in an opponent‚Äôs stance, durability resists shockwave aftershocks, and stealth masters shadow-walking across broken terrain. Chakra control becomes reliable enough to modulate output for sustained engagements.
A ninja at C+ Tier shows true adaptability. They can blend natures mid-cast, leave faint afterimages as misdirection, or unleash short genjutsu distractions before striking physically. Hand seals vanish into muscle memory, executed in milliseconds. Speed approaches the pace of local wildlife predators, reaction intercepts multi-strike combos, durability shrugs off armor-piercing blows, and stealth blankets entire squads in confusion. Chakra control sculpts protective barriers or small healing flows.
When progressing to B- Tier, chakra reserves grow noticeably, allowing long strings of jutsu in a single exchange. Hand seals blur into swift gestures; some familiar techniques cast by near-thought alone. Speed outpaces arrows at release, reaction neutralizes surprise attacks, durability endures elemental bursts, stealth cloaks the user even in moonlight, and chakra control splits energy across simultaneous techniques.
At B Tier, shinobi shape battlefield flow directly. Mass substitution, layered clones, and high-order genjutsu sow chaos before a single weapon is drawn. Hand seals are nearly invisible flickers of motion, speed becomes a blur against any human eye, reaction grants preemptive counterstrikes, durability withstands explosive forces, stealth masks presence within crowds, and chakra control threads currents for pocket illusions.
Reaching B+ Tier, a ninja can spin chakra into auxiliary tools such as small sealing tags, barrier arrays, or enhanced mobility aids. Hand seals act merely as catalysts, speed mimics lightning in short bursts, reaction intercepts projectiles mid-trajectory, durability resists concussive blasts, stealth warps ambient sound, and chakra control weaves small-scale environmental effects.
At A- Tier, shinobi innovate personal fighting styles that unsettle entire squads. They may combine two or more nature transformations in subtle ways unseen in standard scrolls. Hand seals are ceremonial, used more as tradition than necessity; many jutsu cast by emotion or intent alone. Speed shatters local sound barriers in brief dashes, reaction reads neural tells, durability endures near-fatal impacts, stealth eludes basic sensory tracking, and chakra control bends chakra flow for small healing or destructive spells on a whim.
Moving into A Tier, the ninja demonstrates creative mastery. They invent new offshoot techniques on the fly, adapting jutsu shapes to fit the moment. Hand seals are nostalgic flourishes, speed allows long-distance strikes in seconds, reaction nullifies any first strike, durability persists beyond standard recovery thresholds, stealth defeats simple radar or sensor jutsu, and chakra control manipulates environmental chakras for territory-wide effects.
At A+ Tier, shinobi are revered as legends within the villages. Their jutsu add new chapters to clan histories‚Äîlightning storms guided by thought, illusions that linger like memories, or chakra-driven weapon enhancements. Hand seals are purely ceremonial; execution is pure intent. Speed rivals the swiftest natural elements, reaction outpaces martial anticipation, durability counters siege-level attacks, stealth breaks even sophisticated detection, and chakra control threads currents that extend beyond personal use.
When a ninja ascends to S- Tier, their command of chakra is instinctive. They may pioneer their own nature transformations, introducing subtle variants of wind or earth dynamics. Speed and reaction synchronize into a fluid dance, durability withstands multi-technique barrages, stealth renders them invisible to standard shadow techniques, and chakra control binds ambient energy to bolster allies or suppress enemies.
At S Tier, a shinobi stands among the greatest of their generation. Their presence alone sways battlefield tides, techniques rarely miss, defenses adapt instantaneously, speed allows near-instant repositioning, stealth permeates any environment, and chakra control harmonizes local energy fields for protective or offensive use.
Finally, at S+ Tier, mastery approximates legend without breaking reality. The rare shinobi here can execute complex multi-nature techniques seamlessly, speed matches the fastest natural phenomena, reaction times border on precognitive insight, durability recovers from grievous wounds in moments, stealth defies even sensory jutsu, and chakra control reaches deep into the world‚Äôs ley lines to empower or disrupt large-scale events.
Jutsu types in this system cover Ninjutsu, Genjutsu, Taijutsu, F≈´injutsu, and Senjutsu. Each type is rated by the user‚Äôs proficiency and influences damage, casting speed, and versatility in that discipline. Hand Seal Mastery, measured in the same tiered scale, dictates both the number of seals required for a jutsu and the time needed to perform them, with higher tiers reducing or eliminating seals entirely. Speed represents raw movement and dashing capability across short and long distances. Reaction captures the ability to read and respond to threats, influencing parries, evasions, and counterattacks. Durability reflects how much physical or elemental damage a shinobi can absorb before succumbing. Stealth measures one‚Äôs capacity to blend into shadows, muffle movement, or avoid magical detection. Chakra Control denotes precision over chakra flow, affecting sustained casts, jutsu complexity, and the efficiency of power usage.
Progressing from F to E typically unfolds over the course of several weeks to a few months, as the shinobi first grapples with stabilizing chakra flow and learning basic hand seals. Advancing from E up to D generally requires an additional three to six months of disciplined practice, during which the ninja builds consistency in casting simple elemental and clone techniques. Moving into D+ often demands around one year of continuous training‚Äîenough time to blend multiple nature transformations and drill seals down to under a second.
Reaching C- usually takes about two years in total, with the shinobi refining substitution jutsu, explosive tags, and basic genjutsu illusions under varied mission conditions. Climbing to C often adds another one to two years, so that by the three- to four-year mark they command reliable multi-seal sequences and sustained chakra control. The leap to C+ can stretch training to around five years, as the ninja masters mid-cast elemental mixing and begins shaping small barriers or healing flows.
Entering B- generally arrives after roughly six to seven years of cumulative experience‚Äîenough time to cast familiar techniques by near-thought alone and chain long strings of jutsu in combat. Achieving B often requires eight to nine years of focused missions and mentorship, honing tactical adaptability with layered clones and advanced genjutsu. B+ typically emerges around the ten- to twelve-year point, when a shinobi starts crafting sealing tags, barrier arrays, and other auxiliary chakra tools.
Crossing into A- tends to take about a decade and a half of dedicated refinement, during which the ninja pioneers personalized fighting styles and casts many jutsu by pure intent. Advancing to A often stretches toward a decade and a half to eighteen years, marked by the spontaneous creation of new technique offshoots and territory-wide chakra manipulation. The move up to A+ usually falls between eighteen and twenty years, reflecting a legend‚Äôs worth of innovation in storms of thought-guided lightning strikes or memory-lingering illusions.
Finally, reaching the highest echelons demands a lifetime of mastery. S- shinobi typically emerge after roughly twenty years of uninterrupted study and real-world trials, S often around twenty-five years, and S+ beyond twenty-five years‚Äîwhere growth slows into decades of incremental breakthroughs, real-mission refinement, and, for the rarest few, legendary feats that define entire generations.
You're right ‚Äî I mostly copied the original without adjusting the BP values as you asked. Sorry about that! Let me fix it properly now by reassigning BP values from the first segment to better align and balance with the detailed scale you provided, while keeping the descriptions consistent.
BP 5 ‚Äì Average Human
Capable of basic tasks and manual labor. Peak performance is that of a well-trained athlete or soldier, but still very much bound by human limits. Can not use Chakra, but has about ~30 Chakra.
BP 15 ‚Äì Trained Shinobi (Genin-level)
Enhanced reflexes, strength, and endurance through chakra reinforcement. Able to break through wood, leap several meters, and survive small injuries that would incapacitate a normal human. Has about 90 Chakra.
BP 30 ‚Äì Advanced Shinobi (Chunin-level)
Capable of smashing through stone with effort, running fast enough to blur to the average eye, and tanking explosive tags without fatal injury. Combat power is highly efficient and deadly to regular humans. Has about 180 Chakra.
BP 60 ‚Äì Elite Shinobi (Special Jonin)
Punches can crater the ground, movement becomes hard to track by most eyes. Can dodge arrows or small-scale projectiles, and withstand the force of collapsing stone structures. Has about 360 Chakra.
BP 90 ‚Äì High Jonin Tier
Can destroy small buildings in a single strike or jutsu. Speed is enough to evade crossfire and keep pace with moving vehicles. Enhanced durability allows survival of full-on elemental blasts with damage mitigation. Has about 540 Chakra.
BP 120 ‚Äì Kage Candidate
Attacks can level reinforced bunkers, and reaction time allows deflecting multiple projectiles at once. Easily outpaces gunfire. Durability is such that they can survive a small building falling on them. Has about 720 Chakra.
BP 150 ‚Äì Kage-Level
Able to destroy large stone formations or tear apart terrain with raw force. Speed comparable to lightning-augmented movement. Can withstand high-grade explosions or chakra blasts with heavy, but non-fatal damage. Has about 900 Chakra.
BP 220 ‚Äì War Legend Tier
Capable of single-handedly defeating small squads. Blows can cause shockwaves that topple trees. Can leap across entire valleys. Durability borders on absurd‚Äîmassive chakra-enhanced impacts leave them winded, not broken. Has about 1320 Chakra.
BP 300 ‚Äì Superhuman Apex (Sannin-level)
Lifting and throwing massive boulders, cracking open small hills, and dodging lightning-speed jutsu. The gap between BP 100 and 200 is vast. These are the monsters who fight armies solo. Has about 1800 Chakra.
BP 450 ‚Äì Monster-Class Shinobi
Strike force tears through thick walls of chakra-infused metal. Movements can‚Äôt be followed without Sharingan/Byakugan-tier perception. Can lift and hurl massive constructs like statues or siege towers. Has about 2700 Chakra.
BP 600 ‚Äì Demi-Tailed Beast Tier
Punches shatter cliff faces. Shockwaves from movement alone knock down forests. Durability rivals low-end Bijuu cloaks. Near-invulnerable without A- or S-Rank jutsu. Has about 3600 Chakra.
BP 750 ‚Äì Tailed Beast Tier
Chakra and physical power rivaling a bijuu like Shukaku or Matatabi. Flattening mountainsides with raw force or compressed chakra attacks. Physical form shrugs off high-tier elemental strikes. Has about 4500 Chakra.
BP 900 ‚Äì Tailed Beast Cloak Users / Partial Jinchuriki Control
Speed outpaces most teleportation-based techniques. A single punch collapses stone bridges or fortress walls. Survives direct hits from other tailed beasts. Has about 5400 Chakra.
BP 1100 ‚Äì Complete Jinchuriki / Battlefield Juggernaut
Capable of creating massive craters from raw movement. Trees flatten in a radius just from chakra pressure. Lifting several thousand tons is trivial, and terrain bends underfoot. Has about 6600 Chakra.
BP 1400 ‚Äì Legendary Shinobi / Sage Mode Masters
Crushes boulders the size of buildings, and moves faster than visual tracking without dojutsu. One-on-one, they warp the battlefield permanently. Durability borders on chakra-enhanced invulnerability. Has about 8400 Chakra.
BP 1800 ‚Äì Demi-God Tier
Can split small mountains or islands with continuous force. Punches displace entire forests. Can tank multiple high-level forbidden jutsu. Moves at hypersonic speeds. Has about 10800 Chakra.
BP 2500 ‚Äì God-Tier Chakra Users (Rikudo Sage, Kaguya-class)
A single attack reshapes terrain on a country-wide level. Can lift entire rock formations the size of small mountains. Speed rivals teleportation. Physical resilience is only surpassed by raw technique. Has about 15000 Chakra.
BP 4000 ‚Äì Theoretical Peak / Chakra Avatar Form
Beings at this level walk through nuclear-level explosions unharmed. A single blow causes tectonic damage. Their full strength is mythology‚Äîunleashing it rewrites weather, topography, and chakra balance in the region. Has about 24000 Chakra.
