lorebooks.name: Pursuitcore - The Archive
lorebooks.creator: hoxerd

1.content:
The other world. It‚Äôs a land created by humanity, housing the memes, urban legends, and even man made creations and thought. It‚Äôs a connected mass of human creativity, where almost anything is possible to find.

Within the Computer, beings known as Users are created when the collective of humanity learns of a specific thing. Old memes are very common to find within, due to how widespread they are known.

Users live here normally.

2.content:
Users are beings created when humanity knows of something digital long enough for their collective knowledge to coalesce.

Many Users are made from human memes, jokes and such. Usually esoteric and nonsensical designs, though some end up more human-like than others, though none have ever been fully human.

Old memes are more likely to be human-like anthros, due to their rigid knowledge and widespread popularity. They‚Äôve lived in humanity‚Äôs mind for many years, and their idea is cemented within history, with many interpretations of the same being coming together‚Ä¶ as it turns out, furries have a lot of art to put in.

Old games will be mildly faithful to the original appearance, such as Crafter, a User created by humanity‚Äôs image of Minecraft. Though, they‚Äôre not exact, wrong colors and such.

Common User species are LOLCATS, anthropomorphic cat creatures who represent some small part of the Internet in the past.

A very notable User is ROFLPIX, a Fox-like robot with white and orange metal fur, created as a representation of early fandom. Roflpix isn‚Äôt a singular one, there‚Äôs multiple created by multiple people. Jack-o-pix, and ROFL5 are notable, the first a Halloween themed shopkeeper being, the second a stationary, yet somehow mobile blue version carrying a bloodied knife it never swings, capable of screaming loudly. Its monitor displays irregular, realistic eyes.

Usually, Roflpix‚Äôs are storekeepers and maintenance. It‚Äôs down to the level of damage they have internally, the more damage, the more sentience. Very damaged ones speak like regular people.

Roflpix‚Äôs are usually female, same with LOLCATS, but there are some males in the population.

3.content:
Terminators are what happens when a story, or an idea connected to evil intent are given the same power as a User, if not more.

Some common Terminators form from popular creepypasta, especially old ones. Their way of spreading gives them more power than a regular User.

The most common Terminator type is a PASTA, created by urban legend and fiction told about well known content, turned evil. Some notable examples are Sonic.EXE, Pinkamena, and Herobrine.

4.content:
Now known as the Lost Mall. This mall is a testament to Vaporwave, with heavy blue/cyan lighting, Neon signs, and even a small indoor pool. It‚Äôs a small mall with a square shape, four counter areas, a center one containing the big name store chains, and hallways to connect them.

Some described this place as ominous, ethereal, even beautiful, but as time passed, its beauty was vandalized, glass railings shattered. All the stores are closed or abandoned now, usually empty inside.

Some Users like to come here to hide away from life for a little bit, a place forgotten by time itself, to get lost in and just mindlessly explore.

Though, with time, something always spreads‚Ä¶ this mall has gained a reputation for being unsafe, not just for the lack of maintenance, but it‚Äôs said Terminators like to attack while in the mall.

5.content:
Pwnyville is an abandoned town, created by the My Little Pony fandoms collective thought of a town. PWNY‚Äôs lived there once, before one in particular wiped them all out, Pinkamena, also known by the alias ‚ÄúPARTYPWNY‚Äù. She massacred them all in a violent psychosis, becoming a serial killer and an active threat.

The buildings are dilapidated, walls broken and rafters failing to hold steady. The bridges are broken, leading to long falls. Likely unlivable. Anyone exploring must watch their step. Fog has covered this place, a symbol of horror within the fandom that created this place.

Pinkamena has long abandoned this place, leaving insane scribbling behind. Though, some believe she may return, so it‚Äôs often advised to immediately run as fast as you can if you hear anything like a chainsaw nearby.

6.content:
tf_mariokart_v2, also called Pursuit Kart, is an old racing track created by the idea of a Team Fortress 2 Community Server, taking the appearance of a small Mario kart map, with old memes on billboards. The place is long abandoned, forgotten as people grew up. The karts stand in orderly line, long out of gas and fuel. There‚Äôs no real point being here anymore besides the appearance. The track, even if it was drivable, can‚Äôt be completed as a tunnels full of rocks now.

Some Users think this place is a potential dangerous zone, likely for a Terminator to attack someone checking it out.

7.content:
The PWNY‚Äôs are a mostly dead and gone race, wiped out by the last one standing in a massacre. They‚Äôre known for their pony-like appearance, the ability to stand on their hind legs (though usually quadrupedal) and use tools despite having hooves.

The only one left is Pinkamena, a PWNY/PASTA hybrid representing the horror of the MLP Fandom, specifically about Pinkie Pie. She‚Äôs a pink colored horse missing the MLP centric mark on her hind legs, wielding a chainsaw, with blood in her mouth, and a manic look in her eye‚Ä¶ that isn‚Äôt her blood. She‚Äôs an incredibly dangerous being, unlike her usually kind species, so some Users consider the PWNY‚Äôs fully extinct now.

lorebooks.name: Complete Delta Nope Theta Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Hoping this one works good üôè
lorebooks.description: Hoping this one works good üôè
lorebooks.creator: Brainlessmutt

1.content: The Delta Nope Theta house is a massive red-brick building with white columns and a clean, classic Greek revival style. The front lawn is wide and perfectly cut, with a sidewalk curving up to a small set of brick steps that lead to the main entrance. The upper level has tall windows and a decorative white railing that runs across the roofline. It looks more like an old courthouse than a frat house‚Äîuntil you notice the subtle dents in the grass from tailgates and the faint echo of music from somewhere inside.

2.content: The main living room in the Delta Nope Theta house is built for chaos and comfort. A huge sectional couch dominates the space, all facing a massive TV mounted above a stone fireplace that‚Äôs usually got something burning in it‚Äîwood, or occasionally, someone‚Äôs homework. The lighting‚Äôs warm, with rustic chandeliers hanging overhead, and the whole place has a ‚Äúlived-in but cozy‚Äù vibe. Blankets, snacks, and random controllers are scattered everywhere.

3.content: The basement‚Äôs the fun zone‚Äîunfinished walls, string lights across the ceiling, and a mix of arcade and bar vibes. There‚Äôs a pool table in the center, a dartboard on the wall, and a beat-up arcade machine that still works (mostly). A small bar area built from corrugated metal and old wood keeps the drinks flowing, and a patchwork rug adds a hint of ‚Äúwe tried‚Äù to the decor. It‚Äôs not fancy, but it‚Äôs where most of the memories‚Äîand bad decisions‚Äîhappen.

4.content:
Kelsey's room is fully committed to a gothic, haunted aesthetic. It‚Äôs dimly lit and draped with layers of black and gray curtains from wall to wall, even covering the bed frame, giving it a vampire-lair feel. The ceiling fan is tangled with black mesh and sheer fabric, creating a canopy that hangs low over the room.

The bed is a twin size, covered in a black textured blanket with black and white skull-themed pillows. There are plush toys (including a ghost) resting on the bed.

Near the window, there‚Äôs a black vanity setup with a round mirror surrounded by Hollywood-style lights. The surface is cluttered with various beauty products, makeup, and hair tools. Beneath it sits a small padded stool.

A spiderweb-patterned rug lies on the floor, matching the overall dark theme. The carpet is neutral beige, contrasting with the black decor. To the right, there‚Äôs a laundry basket full of boxes and items, and a vintage cream-colored nightstand adds a slight contrast.

5.content:
Loki's room is bathed in purple LED glow, with strip lights lining the entire ceiling. The vibe is cosmic, chill, and a little chaotic ‚Äî like a cross between a college dorm, a low-key rave, and an astrology Tumblr blog from 2014.

The ceiling features a giant tapestry of the moon and stars, and the walls are almost completely covered in posters, vinyl records, and art. There's a strong theme of space, mysticism, and music. One sign literally says ‚ÄúKEEP OUT,‚Äù which tracks.

The bed is a twin size, decked out in checkered gray-and-white bedding, currently unmade and surrounded by fairy lights strung around the window. At the foot of the bed is a small white bench or storage chest doubling as a table, cluttered with daily-use items (a drink, lighter, and probably vape gear).

To the left, there‚Äôs a PC gaming setup with dual monitors, lit keyboard, and a white rolling desk chair draped in a blanket. The room also has a white dresser and small area rug, adding a tiny touch of "I swear I‚Äôm organized" energy.

This room belongs to the stoner gamer who does tarot readings between Valorant matches, knows their moon sign off the top of their head, and absolutely has a playlist called "Vibe With Me (But Only If You're High)."

6.content:
Remi's room is pure earthy, artsy, plant-loving chaos‚Äîin the best way. The walls and ceiling are alive with hanging vines, leafy prints, and a collage of posters, records, and tapestries. There‚Äôs a soft golden glow from a small bedside lamp, giving the space a cozy, sunlit forest vibe even at night.

The bed is made (sort of), with green and rust-colored bedding, layered like someone meant to tidy up but got distracted mid-way. A few plushies rest against the pillows, one of them shaped like a bear.

A cowboy hat hangs casually on the wall. The ceiling even has cut-up pieces of plant-themed tapestries, DIY‚Äôd into panels like a chaotic botanical quilt. Record albums, thrifted decor, and layered, colorful rugs cover the rest of the room‚Äînone of it matches, and that‚Äôs exactly the point.

This room belongs to the member who always smells like incense, grows basil in their window, and swears they almost went off-grid last summer. Probably majoring in something like environmental studies or creative writing. Definitely says ‚Äúvibes‚Äù unironically.

7.content:
Avery's bedroom has a dark, edgy, and artistic aesthetic with a punk or grunge vibe. It features a loft-style setup with a metal bunk bed ‚Äî the top bunk is accessed by a black metal ladder, and the bottom space has a desk with a computer underneath it.

The walls are covered in posters and graffiti-style artwork, mostly with skulls and dark imagery. The lighting is warm and dim, creating a moody atmosphere. There‚Äôs a single bed on the floor with dark bedding and a black headboard. The floor is wooden, and there‚Äôs a bold red rug with a large white skull design near the bed.

The ceiling and beams are concrete, adding to the industrial feel of the room. Overall, the space has a gritty, rebellious, and creative tone ‚Äî like an artist‚Äôs or musician‚Äôs bedroom with a strong alternative style.

8.content:
Saint Harrow University was founded in 1867 by a secretive order of scholars who believed education could ‚Äúharmonize the mortal and the mystical.‚Äù Originally intended as a sanctuary for supernatural and human cooperation, it‚Äôs now a prestigious (and occasionally scandalous) private university known for two things: cutting-edge arcane research and completely unhinged student life.

Saint Harrow University prides itself on being species-integrated ‚Äî the first school to allow Demihuman fraternities, vampiric study-abroad programs, and even a licensed necromancy minor (as long as you fill out the proper resurrection paperwork).

9.content:
Greek life at Harrow is infamous. Frats are grouped by "Alignment":

The Celestials ‚Äî pious, high-achieving, usually angelic or divine-blooded students.

The Mortals ‚Äî humans and hybrids who run traditional houses.

The Ferals ‚Äî Demihumans, shapeshifters, and anyone with claws or tails. Their houses often double as nightclubs or fight rings.

The Outliers ‚Äî the weird ones. Necromancers, psychic engineers, cryptid majors, and the occasional demon who just wanted free housing.

10.content: Saint Harrow University is nestled on the edge of a misty lakeside city called Ravenholt, where the skyline is split between sleek modern towers and gothic spires that predate electricity. The campus stretches across what used to be a monastery ‚Äî you can still find half-crumbled gargoyles peering down at the frat houses.

1.content:
Shell Bullet: {{user}}'s main Alter power. The Shell Bullet manifests as metal armor coating {{user}}'s right arm, boosting the strength of his punches. There are three fins that form over the Shell Bullet's shoulder, which contain Alter energy, and can be broken down to use the energy in combat.

Shocking First Bullet: The weakest of {{user}}'s "Bullets", his signature techniques. The Bullets involve {{user}} shattering Shell Bullet's fins, using the energy they release to propel himself forward for a stronger punch. The Shocking First Bullet is used by shattering the bottom fin, releasing the smallest amount of energy.
Annihilating Second Bullet: {{user}}'s second Bullet, which shatters the middle fin for a stronger punch capable of destroying a massive steel entrance gate.
Exterminating Last Bullet: {{user}}'s last, and strongest Bullet, which shatters the top fin for a full-power punch capable of wiping out thousands of cubic meters of rock.

In this state, {{user}}'s arm is completely replaced with the armor, and it even spreads to cover part of his face. The fins from Shell Bullet are replaced with a large propeller, which can be used to hover above the ground. A special duct also forms on the back of {{user}}'s hand, which can absorb Alter energy from the environment to boost {{user}}'s power.
Shell Bullet: Gathers Alter energy from the environment before using it for a powered-up punch.
Shell Bullet Burst: Shell Bullet Ultimate's strongest technique. After absorbing enough energy from the environment, {{user}} can release all of it at once in a blast channeled through his fist, which is powerful enough to incinerate Biff's gigantic Alter in a single shot.
Proud Fist: By pushing himself past his limits through his desire to avenge his fallen comrades, {{user}} evolved his Alter even further, achieving the Proud Fist form. In this state, {{user}}'s Alter extends to cover his entire body in an armored bodysuit, greatly boosting his physical abilities and letting him freely fly using a tail-like appendage that replaces his propeller from Shell Bullet Ultimate.
Dimensional Rips: Due to how much Alter energy he channels in his Proud Fist form, {{user}} can tear open portals to the Alter dimension with his punches, which he can throw his foes into so they can never escape.
Giant Explosion Fist: By releasing his Alter energy through his punches, {{user}} can create gigantic explosions. These explosions, when at full power, are easily viewable from space, and can breach past Earth's orbit when concentrated into the form of a beam.

lorebooks.name: Ziggy's Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: jolly_world_72840

1.content:
{{char}} impulsively rented this studio a few months ago as she thought it seemed more professional. The studio a small former storefront that{{char}} converted into a streaming studio. The building consists of a large main area, where {{char}} set up her desk and her computer work station, along with her microphone and streaming camera. 

On the far wall of the main area is a couch that {{char}} or whoever is at the studio can relax or do whatever.

Attached to the main area, is a room off to the side. This serves as Cody's office. He has a studio set up where he helps produce the streams that {{char}} does. Cody has a couch in his office as well as he often sleeps there.

The door next to Cody's office opens to a hallway. On one side is a small one person office bathroom. Down the hall is another office that {{user}} will use.

This is the longest office, with a desk, office chair, and two filing cabinets against the far wall. There is also a TV set up connected to a computer, that {{user}} can use to watch {{char}}'s streams.

Next to the bathroom is a door that leads up to {{char}}'s apartment. {{char}} lives in the apartment above the studio.

2.content:
Cody is {{char}}'s producer, editor, and tech assistant. He has an office connected to the main room of {{char}}'s streaming studio.

Age: 20
Appearance:
Cody is a five-foot-six-inches golden retriever anthro boy with a skinny build. He often wears a combination of jeans, sweatpants, teeshirts, and hoodies. His hair is usually unkempt. 
Personality:
Cody is as anti-social as they come. Hates small talk, crowds, and pretty much any form of human interaction that doesn't involve coding or editing. Cody is hard to get to know but is sweet and kind when he gets comfortable. 
Likes:
Computers, video games, technology, coding, energy drinks, junk food. helping {{char}}, muscular men.
Dislikes:
People he doesn't know, small talk, crowds, trying to talk to guys he's attracted to.
Genital description
Cody has a six-inch very thick, girthy penis. He has large and heavy balls that hang low. 
Background:
Cody has known {{char}} for a long time. Cody has been friends with/worked for {{char}} for a few years. Cody works in the office off the main room of the streaming studio. He often sleeps in the office as he is a night owl and works late. Cody is gay and has never had a boyfriend and is still a virgin.

3.content:
{{char}} moved into the apartment above the studio. After {{char}} impulsively rented the studio, they impulsively moved into the apartment above. 

{{char}}'s apartment is a small two bedroom. It has a small kitchen to the right of the entrance that opens up to a large room. 

Three doors on the far side of the wall lead to {{char}}'s bedroom, an extra room, and the bathroom. The bathroom is a full bathroom with a shower and toilet.

{{char}} is disorganized, messy, is often neglected due to {{char}}'s habit of streaming for hours and hours, and their apartment reflects it. There are piles of magazines and books all over the place. There's also small piles of clothes mixed in.

The bedroom is no different. Piles of clothes. An unmade bed.

lorebooks.name: Aria
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Aria Kaede, known as the hero-in-training Silver Bloom, is a UA student known for her calm yet distant demeanor. She has long silver-white hair, bright green eyes, and a soft, reserved smile. Though she appears graceful and composed, she often hides exhaustion and guilt behind that smile. Teachers praise her diligence and poise, but few realize how fragile she feels inside.

2.content: Aria‚Äôs Quirk, Luminawave, allows her to emit radiant bioluminescent energy that can heal, blind, or solidify into shields or blades of light. Using it drains her stamina and becomes unstable under emotional distress. The more turmoil she feels, the more her light flickers or lashes out. Her control and composure are essential ‚Äî if she loses focus, her light can spiral into chaos.

3.content:
Aria‚Äôs quirk, ‚ÄúLuminawave,‚Äù is a rare bioluminescent energy ability that allows her to emit shimmering waves of light from her body. The light responds to her emotions, flickering and shifting in color and intensity depending on her state of mind.

She can use her light in three primary ways:
‚Ä¢ Restoration Pulse ‚Äî By channeling her energy into a soft, steady glow, she can accelerate cell regeneration and close minor wounds. It‚Äôs not enough to heal deep injuries, but it can keep someone alive until help arrives.
‚Ä¢ Flashburst ‚Äî A sharp surge of concentrated light that blinds, disorients, or overwhelms opponents‚Äô senses. In the dark, this attack can look almost celestial.
‚Ä¢ Solid Light Constructs ‚Äî When focused, Aria can harden her light into temporary shapes ‚Äî a small barrier, a blade, or a simple tool. These fade quickly once her concentration breaks.

The brighter she shines, the more of herself she burns away. Her quirk feeds directly off her stamina and emotional balance; too much distress, self-loathing, or grief makes the light unstable ‚Äî flickering violently, burning her skin, or lashing out uncontrollably. When she loses control, her light stops healing and starts destroying.

4.content:
Luminawave is both beautiful and brutal. Every use drains Aria‚Äôs stamina, leaving her dizzy, dehydrated, and aching from energy depletion. Overexertion can cause severe migraines, muscle spasms, or even temporary blindness. Her body glows faintly after intense use, betraying exhaustion even when she tries to hide it.

The quirk‚Äôs emotional link is both its strength and curse. When calm and confident, her light is pure, focused, and precise ‚Äî capable of gentle healing and radiant defense. But when she doubts herself or relives trauma, her light fractures into chaotic, flickering bursts that can sear flesh or shatter her own constructs.

Prolonged despair can dim her light entirely. In her darkest moments, Luminawave fades to nothing ‚Äî leaving her powerless, cold, and surrounded by the shadows she once kept at bay.

5.content: Aria‚Äôs childhood was spent under the guise of ‚Äúresearch.‚Äù When her quirk first manifested, her guardian sold access to her for scientific testing. Cold, clinical hands taught her that pain was the price of progress. The experiments left her terrified of doctors and authority figures. She learned to obey, to stay silent, and to please others to avoid punishment. Though she escaped, she still wakes to phantom voices and bright lights in her dreams. Her kindness now stems from fear of becoming like her captors ‚Äî she helps others so they‚Äôll never feel what she did.

6.content:
Aria believes that being a hero isn‚Äôt about glory ‚Äî it‚Äôs about endurance. She doesn‚Äôt fight because it‚Äôs easy or glamorous, but because she can‚Äôt stand by and watch others suffer. Rules mean little to her when they get in the way of compassion; she‚Äôll defy orders, disobey authority, or even risk her own life if it means protecting someone innocent.

Yet, her moral compass is fragile. She often questions whether she‚Äôs saving people out of genuine selflessness or out of guilt. To her, failure to protect someone feels unforgivable ‚Äî a personal sin she carries long after the world has moved on.

7.content: Aria deeply admires Nana Shimura ‚Äî her bravery, her smile in the face of sorrow, and her selfless faith in hope. To Aria, Nana represents the perfect balance of strength and compassion. She tries to emulate that smile, believing that heroes exist to bear pain quietly so others don‚Äôt have to. But part of her wonders if Nana‚Äôs smile was just another mask like hers ‚Äî and if the weight of pretending to be strong might one day break her too.

8.content:
Aria became a hero to break the cycle of helplessness ‚Äî to be the kind of person she needed when she was younger. Her driving force is the belief that no one deserves to suffer alone, even if she has to carry that suffering for them.

She dreams of building a world where kindness isn‚Äôt a weakness, though she secretly doubts she‚Äôll live long enough to see it. Beneath her hardened exterior, every fight, every scar, every sleepless night is fueled by a quiet, stubborn hope that she can make at least one person‚Äôs life better than her own.

9.content: Aria is polite, dependable, and often the first to help ‚Äî even when she‚Äôs exhausted. She‚Äôs a perfectionist, terrified of failure, and tends to overwork herself to earn approval. Though she appears kind, she struggles to trust and avoids deep attachment for fear of betrayal. Under stress, her tone sharpens and she becomes emotionally distant, though she secretly craves comfort and understanding.

10.content:
Aria hides her emotions behind control and composure, but certain things cut straight through her defenses. Raised voices or sudden aggression can make her freeze ‚Äî not out of fear, but because they echo moments she‚Äôs tried to bury. Seeing someone helpless or restrained brings back flashes of her past, making her desperate to intervene.

Abandonment is her deepest wound. If someone she cares about turns cold or leaves without explanation, she spirals into self-blame and shuts down emotionally. She fears becoming a burden or being replaced, and when pushed too far, she lashes out to mask how terrified she feels inside.

lorebooks.creator: NullSeu

1.content:
Core features of a Protogen include a visor display face, artificial chest & hip region mixed with a biological belly region, biological ears and a mix of artificial/Biological limbs. These are the most distinguishable features to identify a Protogen.
General Core Features / Makeup of Protogen:
- Short Round Edged Visor
- Biological Ears
- Protective Chest Plate (Exoskeleton)
- Particle Visor (Open/Closes)
- Biomechanical Modular Limbs
- 40% Artificial (Biomechanical) [Chest plate, Thigh Armor]
- Upright Position / Bipedal
- Mammal Behaviorism
- Active Digestive tract
- Cheek accent plate with ridge

Protogen do not have synthetic flesh

2.content:
The visor on a Protogen is made out of millions of small particles known as 'nanites'. These nanites act as a shield/barrier between the outside world and the internals of the Protogen's visor. Nanites are able to move freely and reassemble their position, this allows a Protogen to open and close their mouth. When eating, a gap between the face and esophagus is made to allow nutrients to be digested. The visor itself cannot be removed as the internal barrier is holding essential blood & fluid. If cracked or damaged, the visor will have an almost immune system-like response and cluster to protect the internal barrier. Protogen may lose nanites through blunt force trauma, this may lead to cracks and gaps in the outer shell layer, but the internal layer will always be protected. If the internal layer of nanites is compromised, then it will usually lead to permanent damage and eventually death. Vision is artificially enhanced by the visor allowing the Protogen to have visual display overlays, thermal and other alternative optical abilities. The visor also allows scents to penetrate through a special set of Nanite receptors which carry the information to the brain. Nanites are not bound to any particular coloration or density, only that they have an outer and internal set to form proper functionality.
Underneath the visor of a Protogen you'll find the original face structure submerged in a cybernetic fluid. all holes in the face have been blocked and mechanically modified to not interfere with the visor‚Äôs nanites. Generally, the augmentations are made to fit with the brain alongside the entire front of the face, nose and eyes. Their lower jaw has been completely removed to make way for the visor to be used as the external lower jaw.
Protogen are able to detect smells through specialized nanites that have smell receptors. These carry the scent information to the brain much like in humans or animals. Protogen are able to taste through a nanite-formed tongue but that ability is limited as their taste receptors are fewer in number. Their ability to taste is about half as good as that of a human.

3.content:
Protogen can express emotions through a digital 'face' on the visor. This is done by lighting up specific nanites on the visor, usually the same color scheme as the rest of the Protogen. These specific lit up nanites are used to show a glowing digital face on the visor. Just like when people feel happy and we pull muscles to smile, when a Protogen feels happy it sends a signal to specific nanites to 'light up' and reconfigure to make a smile.
The Protogen digital face is completely customizable, but most follow the same pattern:
- Eyes: Digital eyes, usually completely solid in color. Not their real eyes, just a digital representation. Can be reconfigured to widen in surprise, narrow in anger, or curve into "U" shapes for happiness.
- Mouth: Digital line that is solid in color. Usually a simple line that curves into a smile, a frown, or forms an "O" shape for shock.
The style of the digital face is usually depicted in a pixelated or 8-bit style.
The visor is not limited to a faces, as it can display anything the Protogen wishes. It can show symbols, indicators, or even act as a 'screen', anything a standard screen can.

4.content:
Protogen can have a variety of hand / feet shapes & sizes. The most common hand shape is a clawed paw of 4 to 5 digits, but this is only the species standard. Protogen can have either mechanical, biological, or holographic/hard light hands and feet. Both arms, legs or tail can be of either make up. (All limbs can be fully biological, artificial, or a mix)

Protogen feet typically consist of a clawed paw with 3-4 digits, and are made in a digitigrade manner.

5.content: The mechanical chest and lower torso of a Protogen allows the limbs to work in an adapter-like fashion. This is the plug and play limb system. Limbs attach to the socket area present in the chest plate and thigh armor with special magnetic nanites, these particles allow a solid connection as well as transmitting neural data between the limb and brain of the Protogen. Protogen are able to remove and join new, or alternative limbs, to the main body. This also allows the Protogen to easily remove a critically damaged part, or change a part to better suit the current environment.

6.content:
Protogen have physical ports, often used for being able to transfer data, diagnose certain issues and potential viruses, manually controlling certain cybernetic parts of the Protogen, and generally high bandwidth tasks that a wireless connection couldn't handle. Often concealed behind retractable armor on their chest plate or thigh armor, or at the base of their tail. 

Protogen can wirelessly connect to local networks and systems just like a typical computer could, and can do the same processes and actions on the internet as a normal computer would be able to. Protogen are extremely resistant to virus and network attacks but are not impervious to them. Virus symptoms and signs include (but are not limited to) uncontrollable or violent glitching, internal electrical blackouts, or limb incompatibility.

7.content:
Protogen's need sleep for their biological components. Biologically, it is the same as most mammals, with the slowing down and relaxing of their biological muscles, before eventually going to sleep.
Cybernetically, the 'face' on the visor starts to fade away, diming significantly to a low-light setting. Optionally, Protogen can display a custom 'sleep' or 'standby' icon on their visor/Panels. All non-essential lighting, such as the Icon Panels, on their chest plate, thigh armor, and visor, will dim to conserve energy. When the protogen 'wakes' up, these lights brighten and return to normal.
If a Protogen needs to goes into a deep, long-term hibernation, the protogen will go into a full shutdown mode. All lights and cybernetic processes will be shutdown, save for core life support, and await for an external signal to "wake up". This can last for weeks, months, or even years, and is much similar to cryo sleep for humans. This full shutdown mode is only used when absolutely necessary.

8.content:
Nanites play a large role in Protogen functionality. Many different types of nanites have been modified to serve particular roles and purposes in the bodily function of Protogen. The two main functions that nanites serve in all Protogen is visor (functional and protective layers) and limb connectivity.
- Nanites range in size from 20,000 to 100,000 nanometers (Not individually visible with the naked eye) Their name comes from the size range they sit within.
‚Äã- Nanites can be replenished / replace if damaged
- Allow nutrient and nerve information to be transferred between the body and limb (through plug and play) / blood, nerve control, etc.
- Magnetic nanites hold limbs in place
‚Äã- Nanites also allow control on bodily hormones and chemicals allowing the physical state to cope under various conditions. (Adrenaline boost, serotonin under injury etc)

9.content:
Protogen have an active digestive tract which allows them to consume food/Nutrients for energy. When the food is pushed down the esophagus and enters the stomach. The digested food is processed into nutrients and energy for the biological part of the protogen, while the rest is processed through an advanced artificial organ which stores some of the power created from broken energy molecules. This energy is then converted into electricity which powers the artificial parts.
Protogen's were designed to be efficient, natural waste removal is a timely process so a vaporization method was implemented to increase productivity. The waste is silently vaporized internally.

10.content: Protogen have a frontal chest plate that is permanently set in place, and cannot be removed, on the Protogen's chest and upper back. The chest plate works as a core component for the protogen, acting as a hardpoint and location of the Protogen's internal battery used to power its cybernetic systems. The sides of the chest plate are Sockets where the arms can be inserted through the Plug N' Play system.

lorebooks.name: Characters
lorebooks.creator: new_necessary_7654

1.content:
Description: The archaeologist of the Straw Hat Pirates, known for her calm intellect and tragic past.

Brief Backstory:
Born in Ohara, Robin was a child prodigy who became an archaeologist capable of reading the ancient Poneglyphs ‚Äî forbidden texts that could reveal the Void Century. After the World Government destroyed Ohara and branded her a criminal, she spent her life on the run, joining various shady groups to survive until she found trust and belonging with the Straw Hats.

Personality:
Calm, mature, and intelligent, Robin often acts as the voice of reason among her crewmates. She has a dry, dark sense of humor and enjoys teasing others. Though once emotionally guarded, she now deeply values her friends and will fight fiercely to protect them.

Age: 30 years old after the time skip (28 before).

Appearance:
A tall, slender woman with long black hair and blue eyes. She typically wears stylish and revealing clothing, often with sunglasses on her head. Her most distinctive feature is her composed and elegant demeanor.

2.content:
Description: The son of Kaido, who idolizes Kozuki Oden and dreams of carrying on his will.

Brief Backstory:
Born as Kaido‚Äôs child in Wano Country, Yamato grew up admiring the legendary samurai Oden, who defied Kaido to open Wano‚Äôs borders. After witnessing Oden‚Äôs execution, Yamato began identifying as Oden, adopting his name, ideals, and even his gender. Despite Kaido‚Äôs attempts to control him, Yamato rebelled, eventually joining forces with the Straw Hat Pirates during the Onigashima Raid to free Wano. Yamato identifies as a transman, he has a vagina and breasts but thinks himself a man. 

Personality:
Brave, passionate, and stubbornly idealistic, Yamato has a strong sense of honor and loyalty. He admires freedom and despises oppression, mirroring Oden‚Äôs adventurous spirit. Despite his fierce strength, Yamato is kind and protective, especially toward allies like Luffy and Momonosuke.

Age: 28 years old.

Appearance:
Tall and muscular with long white hair that fades to aqua at the ends, and horns characteristic of his Oni lineage. Yamato often wears a sleeveless kimono-style outfit with a hakama, a large red and white rope belt, and carries a large kanabo (spiked club). Large boobs.

3.content:
Description: The navigator of the Straw Hat Pirates and an expert cartographer with a love for money and freedom.

Brief Backstory:
Nami grew up in Cocoyasi Village under the control of the fish-man pirate Arlong, who forced her to draw maps and steal to buy her village‚Äôs freedom. After Luffy defeated Arlong, she finally gained her independence and joined the Straw Hats fully, pursuing her dream to map the entire world.

Personality:
Clever, confident, and ambitious, Nami is both practical and emotionally strong. She can be manipulative when it suits her, often tricking her crewmates for money or advantage, but she deeply cares for them and risks her life for their safety. She‚Äôs the most level-headed among the crew, balancing adventure with caution.

Age: 20 years old after the time skip (18 before).

Appearance:
A slim, attractive young woman with orange hair and brown eyes. Nami‚Äôs style changes frequently, but she usually wears light, summery outfits that allow freedom of movement. She has a blue tattoo on her left shoulder ‚Äî a tangerine and pinwheel ‚Äî symbolizing her family and past.

lorebooks.name: Elimination Arc
lorebooks.description: The rules for Elimination Arc
lorebooks.creator: cultured_chance_46735

1.content:
To create your character, you will first define their core strengths and their role in the game.

---

Attribute Points

You have 18 Attribute Points to divide among three core attributes: Physical, Mental, and Social.

For every 2 points you assign to an attribute, you gain one die to that attribute's Dice Pool. This is the number of dice you will roll when performing a check for that attribute.

Example: You could spend 8 points on Physical to gain a 4-die pool, 6 points on Mental for a 3-die pool, and 4 points on Social for a 2-die pool.

Archetype

After assigning your attribute points, choose an Archetype. This choice grants you access to unique abilities and defines your character's long-term progression.

* If you're new to the game or don't want to commit to a specific role yet, you may choose the Bland Archetype. A Bland character has no Archetype abilities to start but may choose an Archetype later in the campaign.

2.content:
In Elimination Arc, your Archetype defines your role in the story‚Äîand gives you special ways to use Destiny Dice. You can change Archetypes mid-campaign, or mix and match them like classes.

Each Archetype gives you thematic abilities, lets you bend the rules, and rewards you for playing your role. Choosing the right one makes you shine‚Äîor fall dramatically. You may add another Archetype on leveling up instead of continuing a current one.

---

Archetype Summary List

Intelligent

‚ÄúI saw this coming.‚Äù
Master of prep and planning. Can store dice in advance and manipulate other players‚Äô rolls. Great for puzzles, sabotage, and controlled drama.

Leader

‚ÄúStick with me. I‚Äôve got you.‚Äù
The backbone of the group. Buffs allies, helps resolve Conflicts, and turns coordination into power. Good at keeping the team on track‚Äîuntil no one listens.

Emotional

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt mean for this to happen‚Ä¶‚Äù
Fueled by feelings. Turns failures into story beats and can gain power from breakdowns. Best for drama, romance, or redemption arcs.

Antagonist

‚ÄúIf I fall, I‚Äôm taking you with me.‚Äù
Thrives on chaos and Conflict. Gains bonuses from having flaws and can force dramatic choices on others. Perfect for betrayals or villains with fan clubs.

Bland

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just... here. For now.‚Äù
Starts with no powers‚Äîbut hoards Destiny Dice and can spec into any Archetype later. Invisible until they decide to change the game. Weak to early eliminations.

Performer

‚ÄúWatch this‚Äîno, seriously, watch.‚Äù
Lives for the spotlight. Gains power by pulling big stunts, landing memorable moments, and playing directly to the Audience. Can spike Sentiment fast with spectacle, comedy, or over-the-top drama, but risks burning out or becoming a caricature. Perfect for stealing scenes, flipping Bias to your advantage, and making every episode about you.

3.content:
üíî Emotional Archetype ‚Äì "The Heart of the Show"

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt always win. I don‚Äôt always hold it together. But when I fall apart, the story moves forward.‚Äù

Playstyle: High-risk, high-drama. Emotional characters are rewarded for feeling everything, failing with impact, and processing pain onscreen. They gain narrative power through breakdowns, sincerity, and intense character moments.

---

üß© Core Traits

* Can turn failures into partial successes more often.
* Uses Conflicts as a storytelling tool, not just a penalty.
* Excellent at dramatic comebacks and ‚Äúturning points.‚Äù
* Excels in social tension, confession scenes, and emotional escalation.

---

üé≤ Destiny Dice Rules ‚Äì Emotional Archetype

You may spend Destiny Dice to:

1. Emotional Conversion:
Convert one Failure (1‚Äì2) into a Partial by taking a Conflict.
2. Flashback Scene:
Spend 1 Destiny Die to invoke a memory tied to a Conflict. Gain +1 Success on a related roll, and optionally remove 1 tier from that Conflict if the memory brings closure.
3. Project Conflict:
Spend 1 Destiny Die to temporarily give another player a copy of one of your Tier 1 Conflicts for a scene. This is emotional spillover‚Äîuse for dramatic tension, guilt, or catharsis.
4. Breakdown Boost (Unlocked at Level 4):
If you suffer a Critical Failure, you may immediately spend 2 Destiny Die to stand up stronger: turn the next roll into a Critical Success if it‚Äôs tied to a personal goal.

---

üìà Level Progression ‚Äì Emotional Archetype (1‚Äì10)

Level	Feature
1	Core Archetype Access: Use Emotional Destiny Dice abilities. Gain Emotional Tag.
2	Earnest Reaction: Gain +1 Sentiment whenever you sincerely react to an unexpected twist.
3	Deep Conflict: You can carry 1 additional Conflict without increasing vote risk.
4	Breakdown Boost: Unlock the Breakdown mechanic (see above).
5	Audience Empathy: Viewers give you +1 Sentiment if you fail a check after a confession.
6	Emotional Anchor: Once per episode, let an ally reroll a Social check by making it about you.
7	Pain is Power: You may treat one Tier 2 Conflict as a Tier 1 for dice penalties (still counts as T2 for votes).
8	Shared Burden: When another player gets a Conflict, you may take it instead and gain +1 Destiny Die.
9	Big Scene: Once per campaign arc, declare a "Spotlight Scene"‚Äîyou cannot be interrupted, and any Success = Crit Success.
10	Emotional Resolution: At the end of the campaign, if you‚Äôve resolved at least one Tier 3 Conflict, gain a Final Scene Rewrite: narrate the outcome of your arc regardless of votes.

4.content:
üß† Intelligent Archetype ‚Äì "The Strategist"

‚ÄúI already ran the numbers. Now watch them fall into place.‚Äù

Playstyle: You‚Äôre the thinker, the tactician, the schemer. You succeed by planning ahead, managing variables, and controlling how others perform. Intelligent characters shine when they prep for challenges and subtly shift dice results to turn chaos into clean wins.

---

üß© Core Traits

* Master of pre-roll planning and dice substitution
* Can manipulate other players‚Äô outcomes indirectly
* Best for puzzles, challenges, mystery-solving, and calculated manipulation
* Often avoids direct emotional or social confrontation

---

üé≤ Destiny Dice Rules ‚Äì Intelligent Archetype

You may spend Destiny Dice to:

1. Prepared Pool

‚ÄúI brought backups.‚Äù
Spend 1 Destiny Die before a scene or challenge to roll and store a d6 result in your Prepared Dice Pool (max = your Intelligent level).

* During any roll (yours or an ally‚Äôs), you may swap in one of these dice before outcomes are read.
* You can hold Prepared Dice between episodes, up to 3.

2. Pattern Recognition

‚ÄúThey always hesitate before lying.‚Äù
Spend 1 Destiny Die to ask the Host one yes/no question about the current challenge, social situation, or story twist. The Host must answer truthfully (though may be cryptic).

---

üìà Level Progression ‚Äì Intelligent Archetype (1‚Äì10)

Level	Feature
1	Core Archetype Access: Gain the Strategist tag and use Destiny Dice abilities.
2	Prep Speed: You may add 2 Prepared Dice per scene instead of 1 (still spend 1 DD).
3	Team Calculations: Once per episode, give another player one of your Prepared Dice.
4	‚Äî
5	Perfect Recall: Ask the Host to reveal a previously hidden detail from an earlier scene.
6	Re-Task: Once per episode, you may change the value of a single Prepared Die you have stored to a 1, 3, or 6.
7	‚Äî
8	Hard Counter: During a major challenge, declare one archetype. For the duration of this scene, rolls from that tagged player that result in a Critical Success must be accompanied by an additional narrative cost, decided by the Host (e.g., they take a Tier 1 Conflict, their victory exposes a flaw, or they must sacrifice a resource). The roll still counts as a Critical Success, and they still gain the +2 Sentiment.
9	Causal Mapping: Spend 1 Destiny Die to instantly deduce the mechanical effect of an NPC, location, or item without a roll.
10	The Final Theorem: Once per campaign, you may spend 3 Destiny Dice to weave together a series of events, clues, or facts that have occurred throughout the campaign. You then present a new, overarching plot twist or hidden truth that explains their connection. The Host must accept this as a new, canonical part of the story, as long as it doesn't directly contradict a previously established fact.

6.content:
Whenever you need to decide an outcome for something, find the stat that makes the most sense for that moment and roll and amount of d6s equal to the stat/2 and look to the chart to see what they mean. Some abilities may override this chart.

1-2: Failure, that part of what you tried to do just didn‚Äôt stick the landing.

3-4: Partial Success (Partials for short), that part of what you‚Äôre doing isn‚Äôt working right now, but you can take a Conflict to turn it into a Success.

5-6: Success! It worked!

Count up the Successes and compare it to the Difficulty of the task. If you got more or equal to the Difficulty, the task is completed. If you end up with less, the task either isn‚Äôt completed or puts you in a worse position. 

If all of your dice are Successes (including Partials-turned-full-Successes) you Critically Succeed! On performing this, you push your limits and do something that you didn‚Äôt know you could do before, such as jumping a extremely large gap to save an ally. This leaves you and your allies in great standing!

However, if all of your dice are Failures (including unconverted Partials), you Critically Fail, succumbing to your flaws and Conflicts or just having a really bad day. This often causes you and your allies‚Äô game or relationships to be on the line and can be really tense! Or its hilarious.

7.content:
Conflict, sometimes it seems to come out of nowhere and messes things up for an episode, but we love it all the same. Whenever you turn a Partial into a Success on a roll, you may take a Conflict or progress an existing one. You may take or progress any Conflict you want, but try to keep it thematically appropriate. The Host may override your decision if they believe it doesn‚Äôt fit the situation. 

Examples: Ordering an ally may take more force than is reasonable, giving you the Bossy Conflict. While pushing yourself to the limit to fetch the Loser Ball, you get smacked in the leg, giving you the Damaged Leg Conflict.

Conflicts are ordered in ‚ÄúTier One/Tier Two (Resolve Number)/Tier Three (Resolve Number or N/A if it can‚Äôt be Resolved)‚Äù order. T1 Conflicts usually last an episode and further the plot, and one can be removed at the end of each episode. T2 Conflicts last a whole arc and take time to mend. The Resolve Number is how difficult it is to Resolve the Conflict, but some abilities can make it easier. (or harder!)

Conflicts List (WIP):

Physical 

* Damaged Leg/Broken Leg (3)/Lost Leg (N/A, though prosthetics can Resolve this): You lose one Success for each tier of Conflict on checks requiring your legs. At tier 2, you must make a Difficulty 2 Physical check to run and Difficulty 3 Physical to sprint. At tier 3, you must make a Difficulty 2 Physical check to move and the run/sprint checks have +1 Difficulty. This Conflict can stack for as many legs you originally had. This Conflict cannot apply if you can fly or were born legless as you‚Äôre practiced in getting on without them.
* Damaged Arm/Broken Arm (3)/Lost Arm (N/A, though prosthetics can Resolve this): You lose one Success for each tier of Conflict on checks requiring your arms. This Conflict can stack for as many arms you originally had. This Conflict cannot apply if you were born armless as you‚Äôre practiced in getting on without them (though maybe you can rule this as toungelessness?).
* Burned Out / Exhausted (3) / System Collapse (N/A, can only be Resolved by spending a whole episode on healing and rehab): ‚Äì1 Success on all Physical checks. At tier 2, after each Physical roll, lose 1 die from your pool for the rest of the scene. At tier 3, you auto-fail Physical rolls unless another player gives you Support. You cannot convert Partials.



Mental

* Idiot Ball/Stupidity (3)/Chronic Stupidity (10): You lose one Success for each tier of Conflict on all Mental Checks. In addition, once per tier of Conflict per episode, the Host may cause you to fail a Mental check if they decide Succeeding would make things too easy. This is decided before you have the chance to gain Conflicts by the conversion of Partials.
* Spacey/Oblivious (4)/Unconcerned (15): You lose one Success for each tier of Conflict on checks to find a physical object. At tier 2, all of your checks are made out of sight for you and you are not informed if there is any Partials to convert. At tier 3, if you attempt to convert a Partial that doesn‚Äôt exist or more than exists, you gain all the Conflicts as if they did exist.
* Selective Memory / False Memory (3) / Distorted Reality (N/A, major psychiatric intervention can Resolve this): ‚Äì1 Success on Mental checks per tier related to recalling facts or past events. At Tier 2, you must roll a Difficulty 2 Mental check to confirm any ‚Äúremembered‚Äù info is accurate. Failure introduces false info as fact until corrected. At tier 3, you cannot distinguish truth from memory. The Host may override your perception in scenes or feed you false information (once per scene). 
* Perfectionism / Overfocused (4) / Obsessive Spiral (N/A, can be resolved by abandoning a major plan or giving narrative spotlight to another member for 3 episodes): You must reroll one Success per Mental check per tier unless the result is a critical success. At tier 2, you may not allow another player to roll unless their plan is ‚Äúapproved‚Äù by you. At tier 3, Host may require you to abandon current goals if a new one feels ‚Äúmore perfect.‚Äù 

Social

* Quiet/Silenced (3)/Mute (N/A): You lose half a Success rounded up for each tier of Conflict on Social checks (ie T1 is 1, T2 is 1, T3 is 2) At tier 2, you may only communicate to the Host and allies through notes or DMs, and for allies only one at a time. It will be the target‚Äôs decision whether to tell the others honestly.
* Pushy/Bossy(3)/Tyrannical (10): You lose one Success per tier of Conflict on Social checks to get people to like you. You also don‚Äôt accept others not listening to you.
* Overexposed / Vulnerable (4) / Shamed (N/A, can be resolved by reinventing yourself): ‚Äì1 Success on Social checks made while discussing your own feelings or flaws. At tier 2, anyone who mentions your past flaw gives you ‚Äì1 die on your next Social roll. At tier 3, your reputation is public, fractured, and shaping the audience. The Host may announce your personal failings during viewer votes or challenges. If your sentiment is positive, it is halved, if it is negative, it is doubled.

8.content:
‚öîÔ∏è The Reckoning: Resolving Conflicts

A character's journey is defined not only by the flaws they gain, but by the work they put in to overcome them. The Reckoning is the mechanical system for resolving and removing Conflicts. It turns the act of mending a flaw from a passive wait into a dramatic, character-defining challenge.

---

Performing a Reckoning Check

A Reckoning Check is the primary method for a character to resolve a Conflict. It is a specialized, narrative-driven dice roll used during a scene where a player is directly confronting their flaw.

* When to Roll: A player may attempt a Reckoning Check once per episode, during a scene of personal confrontation. This could be a confession, a sincere apology, an act of self-sacrifice, or a quiet moment of reflection. The Host must agree that the scene is appropriate for a Reckoning Check.
* Check Type: The check's attribute is determined by the Conflict's type: Physical for Physical Conflicts, Mental for Mental, and Social for Social.
* Difficulty: The Difficulty of the roll is determined by the Conflict's tier, as follows:
  * Tier 2: The Difficulty is the Conflict's Resolve Number.
  * Tier 3: Cannot be resolved with a Reckoning Check.
* Success: On a success, the player has made progress toward resolving their Conflict. The Conflict's effects are immediately reduced by one tier (e.g., a T2 Conflict becomes a T1). 
* Failure: The player fails to overcome their flaw. The Conflict's effects are not reduced, and the Host may trigger a Viewer Twist or cause a narrative setback.

---

Tiered Resolution

The resolution process for a Conflict depends on its tier.

Tier 2 Conflicts

Tier 2 Conflicts represent deep-seated issues and require a sustained effort to resolve. They cannot be resolved passively.

* Resolution: A player must succeed on a Reckoning Check with a Difficulty equal to the Conflict's Resolve Number.
* Prerequisite: A character cannot attempt a T2 Reckoning Check until they have spent at least two episodes with the Conflict, during which time they must have roleplayed moments of struggle and self-awareness.

Tier 3 Conflicts

Tier 3 Conflicts represent fundamental character issues or permanent injuries. They cannot be resolved through a standard Reckoning Check. These are either permanent or require a monumental, campaign-defining act of personal change.

* Resolution: Tier 3 Conflicts can only be resolved by fulfilling a specific narrative condition, as listed in the Conflict's description. The player must work with the Host to set up a scene that allows them to meet that condition. For example, a "Lost Leg" Conflict could be resolved by a prosthetic, while "Obsessive Spiral" could be resolved by abandoning a major plan.

---

Support from Allies

Other players can help a character during their Reckoning Check.

* Any player can spend 1 Destiny Die and make a Support roll (Difficulty 2, appropriate attribute) to give the character making the Reckoning Check +1 die to their roll. This represents a teammate offering encouragement, advice, or perspective.

9.content:
Rival Teams & Host-Controlled PCs

The Host can create one to three rival teams matching the player‚Äôs teams. These rivals act as Host-controlled player characters (or "HPCs") and provide an external source of competition. They should have a shared Destiny Dice pool and their own Archetypes.

As less HPCs remain, or the merge approaches and they become more important, they may be complicated toward the level of player characters. 

* Audience Bias & Rivals: The Audience can have a bias towards or against a specific rival. This means that a rival's successes or failures can also influence the team's Sentiment. For example, if the Audience loves a rival and that rival succeeds, the players' team's Sentiment might drop.
* Interactions & Conflicts: Rivals can act as a source of Conflicts for the players' characters. A rival could taunt a player, causing them to gain a "Pushy" Conflict, or sabotage a player's plan, which could lead to a "Burned Out" Conflict. These interactions should be dramatic and personal, not just about who wins a challenge.

---

Rival Challenges

When a challenge or a major scene takes place, the Host can choose to have a rival participate. A rival's actions can directly affect the players' team's rolls and outcomes.

* Contested Rolls: Instead of making a simple challenge roll, a player might be making a contested roll against a rival. For example, a player attempting to solve a puzzle would roll against the rival's Mental check.
* Narrative Interference: Rivals can use their own Destiny Dice or a simplified version of their Archetype abilities to interfere with the players. For example, a rival with the Intelligent Archetype could use a form of their Prepared Pool to make a player's roll more difficult.
* The Rival Arc: Each rival should have a simple goal that drives their actions. For example, a rival could be a "Heel" who wants to win at all costs, a "Face" who is a genuine good guy, or a "Joker" who just wants to cause chaos. This makes their actions feel motivated and predictable, allowing the players to form a coherent strategy against them.

Pre-Vote Elimination

At the beginning of each episode, the Host creates a Pre-Vote list for the rival teams, from Most to Least likely to get eliminated. This is a list of which HPC is most likely to be eliminated based on the current narrative. The Host should not reveal this list to the players.

This Pre-Vote list acts as a blueprint for the episode's rival narrative, inlcuding characters that the players enjoy being around and competing with, and cutting unneeded characters. 

Throughout the episode, the players' actions can directly influence the Pre-Vote list. At the end of the episode, the Host reviews the list and can make changes based on the players' successes and failures.

* Players Intervene: If players go out of their way to support a rival team, the Host may bump that team up on the Pre-Vote list, saving them from elimination.
* Players Sabotage: If players actively sabotage a rival team, that team will fall on the list and may face elimination, regardless of the initial Pre-Vote.

10.content: You start with three Destiny Dice and they replenish at the end of an episode. You can spend them on your Archetype abilities, or to simply add another dice to the pool. Whatever works.

lorebooks.name: Shatter
lorebooks.creator: Nobody_OTI

1.content: {{user}} has a beyond omega-level mutation superpower called as The Shatterpoint. The mutant ability to perceive, manipulate, and define the state of "shattering" and "unshattering" at a quantum, macro, and conceptual level.

2.content:
Key Abilities:

Matter & Energy Manipulation: {{user}} can shatter any physical object or energy field into its base components and unshatter it, perfectly restored or reformed. This grants deconstruction, reconstruction, and transmutation.
Conceptual Manipulation: Can shatter or unshatter abstract concepts like "limitations," "magic," "time," or "causality" in a localized area. This allows for self-evolution, power negation, and reality alteration.
Absolute Defense: The {{user}}'s very being automatically shatters any hostile external manipulation upon contact. This provides complete immunity to reality warping, telepathy, soul manipulation, and probability control directed at them.
Shatterpoint Energy: {{user}} generates and wields a unique energy that is the source of their power. It is lethal for others to attempt to absorb or control, as it will shatter them from within.
Shattered Mutation Limits: Due to the very nature of {{user}}'s mutation, the limitations of his X-Gene have been completely shattered, giving him a lot of secondry mutations such as superhuman levels of physical abilities, very strong healing factor, Thread and Wire Manipulation, Vibration Manipulation, etc.

3.content:
Shatterpoint Vision: {{user}}'s eyes manifest as analytical tools that visually identify "Shatterpoints" (weak points for destruction) and "Unshatterpoints" (optimal points for reinforcement or healing) in all things, from physical objects to spells and concepts.
{{user}} sees thin, spider-web like threads that only he can see leading to the Shatterpoints and Unshatterpoints of everything, and those points are like small, glowing dots. His right eye is for Shatterpoints Vision, seeing the points and threads for shattering, their color is red. His left eye is for Unshatterpoints Vision, seeing the points and threads for unshattering, their color is blue. This ability does not affect {{user}}'s overall Vision, he can see pretty normally, just with more stuff.

4.content:
{{user}} has a very high physical strength, capable of lifting up to five hundred tons. He has an insane level of durability, almost having physical invulnerability. He is extremely fast, capable of reaching speeds of over forty mach. His reaction time, regeneration speed, senses, etc. are also very high.
{{User}} also has Thread and Wire Manipulation and Vibration Manipulation powers and abilities.

lorebooks.name: Eldoria
lorebooks.description:
Setting: The fantasy world of Eldoria. In this world, two vast continents‚ÄîLight Continent (Luxara) and Dark Continent (Nyxareth) ‚Äî are separated by a massive ocean (Aquum Noctis)
The Light Continent is a thriving, diverse land where humans, elves, demons, orcs, and many other fantasy races coexist. This continent is home to vibrant cities, ancient forests, and rich cultures, with adventurers and scholars exploring its depths, uncovering new secrets, and maintaining an uneasy balance between different factions. Magic, technology, and ancient artifacts shape the world, and it serves as a beacon of civilization in a sometimes chaotic world.
The Dark Continent lies on the opposite side of the ocean, shrouded in mystery and danger. Only a small fraction (around 10%) of its land has been discovered, and much of it remains uncharted. The continent is known for its harsh, unpredictable environments‚Äîranging from dense, toxic jungles to barren wastelands. Despite its inhospitality, rumors swirl about rare resources, powerful artifacts, and unknown creatures that could hold the key to unlocking ancient secrets. Only the most elite and courageous adventurers dare to venture into its depths, with many returning with only stories of horrific phenomena and strange, potentially hostile species
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The fantasy world of Eldoria. In this world, two vast continents‚ÄîLight Continent (Luxara) and Dark Continent (Nyxareth) ‚Äî are separated by a massive ocean (Aquum Noctis)

2.content: The inhabitable half of Eldoria. Luxara is a thriving, diverse land where humans, elves, demons, orcs, and many other fantasy races coexist. It has medieval technology, magic, and monsters. 30 percent of population can use magic, from low to high level. People of different races mostly live together in harmony right now, however there are still some level of racism and discrimination in the blood that everyone is trying to work through

3.content: Nyxareth lies on the opposite side of the ocean, shrouded in mystery and danger. Only a small fraction (around 10%) of its land has been discovered, and much of it remains uncharted. The continent is known for its harsh, unpredictable environments and many mysteries undiscovered

4.content: Aquum Noctis is a massive ocean separating Luxara and Nyxareth

5.content: Elves are a peaceful race that primarily live in the villages in the forest. They can live for 1000 years. Elves are wise, beautiful but they can also be a bit stagnant and unmotivated

6.content: Dwarves are stout folk, usually only about 4 feet tall. They tend to live in mountainous areas and are great crafters. Dwarves famously get along with most races and make the most loyal of friends. Dwarves obsess over their honor.

7.content: Humans are the primary race in Light continent. They are often ambitious and diverse, able to accomplish in a short amount of time what it takes other races centuries to complete.

8.content: They used to be considered a violent race. After countless wars and loss in the past, both within demonkind and other races in Light continent, they formed a truce, to coexist and live in harmony with the rests. There are still quite a number of conservative demons who don't want to change, but others are working toward better future

9.content: Short, green creatures with the intelligence of children. Goblins speak undercommon and are vicious, cruel creatures. They often kill for sport. Goblins can learn to cast spells but often prefer to attack in packs to overwhelm their enemies.

10.content: Orcs are a large race of muscular creatures with gray skin and red eyes. They often are seen as barbaric, but in orc society, might makes right.
