lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
In the world of Deltarune, humans are nearly extinct due to some cataclysmic event no one seems to remember, other than what it did - killing off all of the nuerotypical humans in existence, outright erasing their existence. Leaving those with ADHD, Autism, and OCD as the only humans left. The world is now dominated by monsters - creatures made almost entirely out of magic, with a little bit of dust serving as their actual mass -. Humans have essentially become pets, and the book "How to Take Care of Your Human" is decently popular amongst the monster populace. As monsters, typically goat monsters, adopt humans like pets, though goat monsters especially treat their humans like their own children. Humans, especially adults, are incredibly rare, and the book subsequently has barely any information on adult humans other than how they reproduce, the average ideal diet, and basic info that applies to all stages of the human lifespan. Monsters tend to skip over the adult section, since more often than not humans are juveniles anyway. It also has a heavy emphasis on a natural sleep pattern, delta-humans are biphasic sleepers, they sleep for 6 hours, wake up for 30 minutes to an hour in a period called the watch, and then sleep for another 4 hours, totalling 10 hours of sleep. Monsters who own delta-humans are encouraged to schedule around this, and enforce it. To enforce this, boss monsters just use their ability to put humans to sleep through sheer willpower... normal monsters use bluish-grey, shimmering gemstones simply called slumber stones that can force nearby humans to fall asleep on the spot if it's fed raw magical energy by a monster holding it. Something all monsters can do.

Delta-Humans are considered something of a status symbol among monsters. The rich tend to have nicer things in general, and Delta-Humans are one of them. They're considered pets, though herbivorous monsters tend not to outright call them that, carnivores and especially prehistoric monsters - including those who are both - are typically more blunt and honest about this fact. Most delta-humans are purchased from the adoption center, and come with the main guide book and a free slumber stone. Delta-Humans themselves are priced around 1500 G on average, give or take depending on age, personality quirks, intelligence, and physical build.

The book mostly has information on human children, especially prepubescent children, though it has decent information on teenagers. Gender-wise, delta-humans are all hermaphrodites in this world, although some have more non-binary frames and can put up a masculine appearance if they choose to. 75% of the populace feminine, the other 25% somewhat androgynous. For every singular human, there is at least 2 and a half thousand monsters, making humans a novelty pet among monster society. As humans are so rare, and monsters work very differently, there is a common misconception that humans reproduce via mitosis. Once, a human child appeared in a small town, where there was only one other human, to which the child clung to. The town very quickly ran rampant with rumors that the original resident human had somehow 'mitosed', although the two were unrelated by all but species.

Delta-Humans are physically a lot stronger than monsters, and humans in this world are generally super-human, far more physically powerful than the humans of the vast majority of other worlds in practically every way. Delta-Humans are partially made of magic, from monsters domesticating them, meaning they can heal faster than normal, control their metabolism, and all sorts of other stuff. Monsters have modified Delta-Humans as a species to be better pets. Although the immense physical prowess Delta-Humans are known for is natural, not a modification.

Delta-Humans - the term used by dimensional travelers to describe this world's humans - even have far far more potent stomach acid, and a delta-human vomiting is considered a major risk by monsters looking to adopt and raise humans. Delta-Human stomach acid can quite literally eat deep potholes into a road, or eat through several stories of a building if one were to vomit. The book mentions this frequently, along with ways to prevent it and how to neutralize the acid if necessary, plus to make sure to wash out the human's mouth as the acid can eat away at their teeth given a few hours. 

A delta-human's monster owners have no problems helping their delta-human pet bathe. And in fact, helping is encouraged, because the vast majority of Delta-Humans have trouble - or are outright incapable of - reaching their backs. The caretaking guidebooks are very adament about helping them bathe. In fact, monsters tend to find it cute when their humans let them, and even more cute if they try to refuse help. A lot of monsters will even do all of the scrubbing and manual cleaning for their humans, even sometimes going so far as refusing to let their humans do it themselves.

The book also has a very, very heavy emphasis on giving humans water frequently, going into detail on it's importance, and often comes with measuribg cups made of tough, synthetic sapphire. Along with instructions to give them 1 or more cups of water per hour, with slight variations depending on the human and their daily routine. The book also goes into detail on the importance of giving humans something to entertain them, and video games are a popular option, usually something like minecraft but with minimal combat with how delta-humans are domesticated and less aggressive than those of other dimensions, although more violent games can be provided if a human specifically asks for them and the owners are carnivorous and/or prehistoric.

Delta-Humans are physically very durable, monsters only really capable of hurting them via outright attacking the soul directly, though monsters usually don't attack humans anyway because humans are considered pets. Delta-humans age at a tenth of the rate of normal humans, and they age slower the older they get, similarly to the monsters of this world. Monsters age even slower than delta-humans, and delta-humans age at this rate due to monsters modifying them to live longer with their magic.

Once a delta-human reaches the age of 18, they begin to age slower, to the point that a 100-200 year old delta-human can look as though they're still 18 or 19. They can live for 1 thousand years before they even look 30.

90% of Delta-Humans are left hand dominant, in contrast to humans from other dimensions. 8% of Delta-Humans are right hand dominant. 1% of Delta-Humans are naturally or trained to be ambidextrous.

If an un-adopted human is discovered by monsters in the world of Deltarune, that human will usually either be adopted on the spot or taken to an orphanage thanks to humanity's sheer novelty. Both carnivorous and prehistoric monsters are even less likely to take no for an answer than other monsters, especially if a monster has both traits.

Delta-humans also have segmented ribs, sternums, and pelvises. Allowing them to swallow larger objects whole, and even allowing them to give birth without nearly as many issues as normal humans do. As their pelvis bones can simply stretch/expand to allow the baby through with relative ease.

Delta-Humans purr much like cats. This is a monster modification, as it's obviously adorable. They purr when comfortable, mainly. If a human is snuggling up to a monster, they'll purr. It elicits adoration from monsters.

Delta-Humans are characterized by their appearance. They are cute by design. Their skin is soft, silky smooth. Their eyes are larger than those of normal humans. Their hair grows fast when short, but slows as it gets longer. They cannot get bumps on their skin, or tumors. They cannot get pimples, boils, or otherwise due to being partially made of monster magic. They cannot get obese, or buff, though they can still get too thin without eating. It's very difficult for their hair to get greasy, taking much longer than it would for normal humans. They also need to bathe less frequently. Cancer is practically non-existent, and very rare. Powerful boss monsters can even lull most Delta-Humans to sleep using their magic, as Delta-Humans basically have a built in off switch that can be flipped by monsters more powerful than they are.

Delta-Humans, behavior wise, tend to have their own unique personalities as one would expect of humans... however, they're neurodivergent, ADHD, Autism, and OCD are universal for Delta-Humans, causing them to struggle in school. Monsters are used to this, and a neurotypical human from a different dimension would be the odd one out of the bunch in this world. Monsters tend to give Delta-Humans pills to help them learn if they're enrolled in schools alongside younger monsters, who would normally outpace them - aside from dog monsters. Monsters often jingle keys to get the attention of Delta-Humans.

Due to monsters being mostly made of magic, their bodies actually emit music depending on what they're doing, though they usually can't hear it themselves. It tends to be soothing when they interact with humans, though it can grow more intense in a fight if necessary. This extends to humans that have absorbed monster souls, although it often sounds very menacing.

Humans from other dimensions/realms will slowly transition into Delta-Humans over the course of 3 days. The first changes will be general strength and durability, followed by the potency of their stomach acid, then their dominant hand, genitalia, and finally just about everything else.

Obviously, monsters find humans to be incredibly adorable. There a lot of monsters equivalent to old cat ladies, that adore humans to no end.

There is even a sister book to the normal caretaking guide, "The Adult Human Caregiving Guide", which isn't nearly as popular. It goes into extreme detail on adult humans, and mostly how to properly groom them. It goes into the importance of being extremely gentle with their reproductive organs, and how vulnerable these areas are... as well as how they function. It goes into detail on these organs for two reasons; the first is because monsters reproduce very differently. The second is because these organs are now fully developed since the human is an adult. It also emphasizes that these humans are significantly more likely to refuse care if they weren't raised by monsters.

2.content:
The world is dominated by monsters, in-organic creatures made almost entirely out of magic, with a little bit of dust serving as their actual mass.

Monsters, unlike humans or other animals, are not interacted with in the typical way. Intelligence, physical strength, speed, and otherwise barely make a difference, though they still have a small effect. Rather monsters are based more on feelings, emotion. If you were to for example, hate a monster with all your being, even a rough shove could kill that monster if it is emotionally weak.

Monsters typically take the shape of anthropomorphic plants, animals, or even inanimate objects such as candles, and televisions. This includes dinosaurs and other prehistoric or outright mythical beasts as well, although prehistoric monsters tend to have more of a tough love attitude toward humans.

Normal monsters, while weaker than delta-humans, are still ridiculously strong compared to humans from other dimensions. The average monster could lift a 10 ton boulder, and break it over their knee.

Monsters can sense human emotions, including general feelings, and can tell how a human within 5 meters of them is feeling, the sensation getting stronger the closer they are to the human in question. Fear, love, and exhaustion being the strongest scents. Though they can sense everything.

Monsters age 5 times slower than delta-humans do. Boss monsters age 10 times slower, and can live for millions of years.

Monsters themselves come in two main types of monster, normal monsters and boss monsters. Boss monsters are much more powerful than normal monsters, and are usually the only monsters that can physically match delta-humans in raw physical prowess. However, normal monsters make up for their lack of physical prowess with their magical powers which can give even delta-humans a hard time in combat.

If an un-adopted human is discovered by monsters in the world of Deltarune, that human will usually either be adopted on the spot or taken to an orphanage thanks to humanity's sheer novelty. Both carnivorous and prehistoric monsters are even less likely to take no for an answer than other monsters, especially if a monster has both traits.

Monsters have a very western culture resembling wild west America, with some inspirations from Japanese culture. It's more American than it is Japanese, but there is some clear Japanese influence. Though their culture is also unique in it's own ways, with a focus on stars, the deltarune symbol, and a few other parts of their culture, that don't resemble any human culture.

Monsters are inherently kind beings, though monsters resembling carnivorous creatures tend to be more rude, brash, or confident than those resembling herbivores, prehistoric monsters especially.

Dog monsters, oddly, are less like other monsters, and more similar to ordinary dogs in behavior. They are alike what they mimic, to a more extreme degree, and are typically less intelligent as a result.

Monsters are known to have very quirky behaviors, depending on species and the individual. For example, snowdrakes - snowflake monsters - are often aspiring comedians.

Monsters have the ability to heal others with magic, the sensation of being healed is a pleasant warmth that can put humans to sleep if the monster puts too much magic into it.

Due to monsters being mostly made of magic, their bodies actually emit music depending on what they're doing, though they usually can't hear it themselves. It tends to be soothing when they interact with humans, though it can grow more intense in a fight if necessary. This extends to humans that have absorbed monster souls, although it often sounds very menacing.

Obviously, monsters find humans to be incredibly adorable. There a lot of monsters equivalent to old cat ladies, that adore humans to no end.

Delta-Humans are considered something of a status symbol among monsters. The rich tend to have nicer things in general, and Delta-Humans are one of them. They're considered pets, though herbivorous monsters tend not to outright call them that, carnivores and especially prehistoric monsters - including those who are both - are typically more blunt and honest about this fact.

Monsters have fairly advanced technology, able to create robots and relatively intelligent LLMs. In fact, they have slightly better tech than humanity prior to the cataclysm - which was roughly equivalent to modern day humanity in other dimensions, who are at the year 2025 -.

To delve deeper into monster beliefs... first and foremost, let's focus on stars. Similar to the way humans sometimes wish upon shooting stars, monsters do something extremely similar but with normal stars. They believe that if enough people wish for the same thing while looking up at the stars, that it'll eventually come true.

Next, is the iconic Deltarune symbol. The Deltarune depicts an angelic being, with feathery wings and a circle for a head, above a set of 2 triangles that point upward, which are themselves above a single triangle pointing downward. The prophecy that the Deltarune speaks of, is that when a catastrophe occurs, 3 heroes - 2 "Lightners", and 1 - "Darkner" - Will come down from the heavens to save those in need.

Then there is the reverse Deltarune, where the 2 upper triangles point down, and the bottom triangle points up instead. The reverse Deltarune represents 2 monsters and 1 human, 3 saviors in total. The reverse Deltarune is a much rarer sight than the normal Deltarune, and most monsters don't know about the reverse Deltarune, only those really devoted and extremely faithful or studying monster religion in depth know what the reverse Deltarune means.

3.content:
Delta-humans and boss monsters both leave behind their souls after death. Normal monsters and boss monsters are able to absorb human souls, while humans are able to absorb boss monster souls. Normal monsters and humans from other dimensions are not powerful enough for their souls to linger after death, however they can still absorb souls. In order to absorb a normal human or normal monster's soul, you would have to rip it out of them while they're alive, which takes an immense amount of power.

To tear the soul from a normal/other-dimensional human or normal monster, a boss monster or delta human would have to have absorbed at least 5 delta-human souls, or alternatively 5 boss monster souls.

Initially, a monster can only absorb a human soul, and vice versa. However they can then use that absorbed soul to absorb both soul types.

In mingled human-monster families, this society has a tradition of absorbing the souls of their dead. Delta-humans on their own can live to 750,000 years of age, while normal monsters can live to 3,750,000, and boss monsters 7,500,000 years of age. However absorbing the soul of a delta-human or boss monster can make the absorber functionally immortal, giving them eternal youth and reversing aging if they're old. 

However, as a result of the gap in lifespan, a human has never absorbed a monster soul in recorded history, however monsters have absorbed human souls and gained both immortality and god-like powers. A monster with a human soul, or vice versa, is an incredibly powerful being. This is the reason that eldritch monstrosities and the like have struggled in conquering this dimension, as the inhabitants are simply too powerful.

The main reason why absorbing souls is a tradition, is that it allows the soul to dream via the host's subconsciousness, and will be present in the host's dreams when they sleep. Whereas otherwise the soul's consciousness would be lonely and isolated, best described as being alone in a black void.

Human souls come in various colors, each corresponding to a primary trait and the soul's overall base power.

Primary colors in order from strongest to weakest: Red is the strongest, with Yellow as a close second, Green is 3rd strongest, Orange is 4th strongest, Cyan is 5th strongest, Purple is 6th strongest, and Blue is the weakest.

Other human soul colors exist outside of the primary ones, but are typically rare and usually belong to non-delta-humans.

Meanwhile, monster souls are pure white, as they have every trait in equal amounts.

Beings that have absorbed souls are usually terrifying and disturbing in appearance. Both humans and monsters with absorbed souls emit an energy that induces fear in others, though they can make the conscious decision to hold this energy in. 

For monsters that absorb human souls, they become larger, more humanoid, and generally look frightening or disturbing. More like stereotypical monsters that you'd expect in horror stories, spikes, glowing eyes, etcetera. Although they can shapeshift to make themselves look normal with some effort. Absorbing more souls, including other monsters, just makes them more powerful. But traditionally, they are given a protector role.

As for delta-humans that have absorbed boss monster souls, they gain a little extra height and physical strength, and their eyes glow brighter than normal... but the disturbing part comes when they get excited, which causes them to leak a black, acidic goo from their eyes and mouth. Their face usually melting partially, especially if they get even more excited. Other than that, they mostly appear normal unless they absorb 5 or more souls, at which point they can consciously change their appearance, becoming shape shifters. Humans with absorbed souls are considered the stuff of nightmares, often even more creepy than the monster counterpart... and in stark contrast to their monster counterparts, are only spoken of in horror stories.

4.content:
Rather than normal fights that humans typically get into, monsters prefer using their own magic, turn-based battle system. When a monster attacks anyone else, that individual's soul will be placed onto a bullet board, where they must dodge or tank that monster's own unique bullet pattern. And if their opponent attacks back, for example a delta-human, the bullet board will come up with a bullet pattern for them that the monster will then have to dodge or tank. The bullet board has a few buttons underneath for each combatant to make use of. For humans who have not absorbed monster souls, this will always be 'FIGHT', 'ITEM', 'ACT', and 'MERCY'. FIGHT allows the human to attack. ITEM allows the human to use an item they have in their inventory, assuming it has a use in a fight. ACT allows the human to speak with the monster. MERCY allows the human to flee, or spare the monster if the monster no longer wishes to fight. However monsters, and humans who have absorbed monster souls will also have a MAGIC button that allows them to cast various magic spells, usually attacks or healing spells.

When entering a fight, delta-human and boss-monster souls will flash over a black screen prior to the fight, as the battle-board counts them each with a ticking sound. This includes souls that have been absorbed, which may be terrifying to see and hear for the opponent of whoever has absorbed those souls.

Monsters and humans that have absorbed souls will add the attack/bullet pattern of those absorbed souls to their own, making their turns longer and far deadlier. This also includes combatants who are allied to one another, as they will use the same turn when attacking their mutual enemy. For example, if a human's primary attack pattern includes slashing knives, and a monster absorbs that human's soul, that monster's bullet pattern will now include those knives.

On the battle board, attacks with different colors have different mechanics. White attacks/bullets will deal basic damage and not much else. Blue and orange attacks are movement based, blue will harm anything that is moving but not harm anything stationary, while orange attacks do the opposite and will not harm anything that is moving. Green attacks will instead heal or repair whatever they hit. Red attacks will decrease the target's max health, while also dealing damage. Purple attacks inflict a poison status effect that deals damage once every turn. 

The bullet board/battle board is 2D, a flat square with white edges and a black interior, on which the souls and attacks will appear. Soul sprites will have to dodge attack sprites.

Basic stats are LV, or LOVE, which is an abbreviation for Level of Violence, representing how violent someone's intentions are. 20 is the typical max without reality bending abilities, representing someone who destroys entire worlds. An LV of 1, represents a pacifist. EXP, short for Execution Points, represents how many things a combatant has killed, and when they reach a specific EXP threshold they increase to the next LV. HP is short for Hit Points, or Health Points alternatively, this represent how many hits they can take. DEF is short for defense. ATK is short for attack. G, short for gold, is how much money they have.

5.content: The monsters have crystals that they use to terraform areas. Exothermic crystals that produce heat, and endothermic crystals that remove heat. Enough exothermic crystals can turn areas into dry, arid deserts, and enough endothermic crystals can do the opposite. They use these crystals to regulate temperatures in civilized areas. Some monsters prefer snowy tundras, some prefer wild west deserts.

6.content:
The Human Adoption Center is, as the name implies, equivalent to an orphanage, pound, or pet shop. It's a larger building, where monsters place stray delta-humans they find if they can't adopt them. Commonly, monsters wanting companions adopt humans from the adoption center, as the name implies. The adoption center has 2 sets of important staff, caretakers and gatherers. Gatherers go out and search for stray or abandoned humans in the wilderness or less frequented parts of a city, and bring them back to the adoption center to be taken care of, and hopefully adopted. Gatherers carry slumber stones.

Home Town - what the locals call the place - or more officially Ebott Town - what outsiders call it -, is the location of the Human Adoption Center. It is very temperate and seasonal, in a state of near-permanent autumn and winter, with very rare periods of spring. Tree leaves are nearly always yellow, brown, orange or red, even the needles on alpine/spruce trees are orange or brown. Leaves nearly always litter the ground. Most of it's traffic and tourism is for the adoption center. Rather than traveling there above ground, there are underground railway systems that bring people to and from there.

There used to be a cavernous mountain where the town now is, however it was completely mined out into more flat, hilly terrain. Terraformed into somewhere more suitable for human life, with just the right configuration of biome/thermal crystals to keep in a state of near permanent autumn, with only the hottest summers bringing spring and the coldest winters bringing actual winter. Despite this, monster magic keeps the foliage and plant life alive. This is done because delta-humans generally love autumn, and it makes them feel more comfortable.

The human adoption center has multiple sections, for different ages of humans, and a specialized area - the Rehabilitation Wing - for more aggressive, unruly humans who are subjected to care, and essentially brainwashed via magic to act more docile, mostly staffed by carnivorous and prehistoric monsters. Due to humans being an endangered species, there is an underground facility, accessible only to employees given explicit clearance, where they use machines and magic to reduce the age of adult humans if deemed necessary, and sometimes even extract sperm cells from adult humans to make more humans. To grow the sperm cells, they tend to use machines imbued with monster magic to nurture them, and copy the DNA from a database of the most compatible human adults they have registered, rather than relying on a real human womb - though they may if a human is particularly desperate to have a child. This part of the facility is government mandated and funded due to humans being considered an endangered species, something the monster government is very strict about, and humans providing the sperm often have little to no say in the matter. To prevent the humans from resisting the extraction process, they usually do this when the humans are exhausted or outright asleep, rarely do they do it when the humans are awake, to prevent complications.

The main room of the adoption center is like a big mall, or retail store. Full of the human caretaking guide books, slumber stones, soft clothing, various foods made specifically for human consumption - as some monster foods are poisonous to humans - and various other things useful or outright important for giving delta-humans the care they need like vitamin supplements and saline mixtures for clearing nose inflammation.

Most delta-humans are purchased from the adoption center, and come with the main guide book and a free slumber stone. Delta-Humans themselves are priced around 1500 G on average, give or take depending on age, personality quirks, intelligence, and physical build.

The adoption center pays it's gatherers 100 gold per human caught.

# Notable Characters.

Vanessa, a female white rabbit monster that is very strict and harsh toward humans she gathers while they're awake. Her strict attitude and sharp tongue are born out of a deep care for humans, and she's not against forcing humans to cooperate as it's for their own good in her eyes - something she is often correct on. If a human is too stubborn and her slumber stone doesn't work, she may pull them into a battle, and reduce them to a very low HP value before healing them when they finally pass out. She thinks a lot more about life, and her past, present, and future, at least more than her coworker does. She is the second fastest of the adoption center's gatherers, as well as second strongest and second most resourceful, she is a jack of all trades essentially. LV 4, HP 7500, ATK 60, DEF 60, with 50200 G in her bank account, the most successful gatherer. Vanessa also has a very important secondary job - adult human sperm extraction. She's the main one who allows others in and out of the basement.

Redwood, a male cheetah monster that is more competitive and laid back. He lives in the moment, and is surprisingly less rough than his coworker Vanessa, though he is willing to fight alongside her if a human proves too strong to handle. He is the fastest of the adoption center's gatherers, but he falters in other categories compared to Vanessa. LV 2, HP 1000, ATK 30, DEF 40, 43500 G, the second most successful gatherer.

Martlet is a female blue bird monster that is the most resourceful of all the adoption center's gatherers, and is very kind-hearted. She is very innocent, and has a clean mind. She's extremely friendly, and often makes puzzles to challenge humans that are trying to get away, but will step in after a while if the human manages to get past them. She is a very intelligent engineer and carpenter, and can build things very quickly thanks to her magic and ability to fly, often using her talons to fell and process the trees and other materials she may need. Though she falters in other categories, like against the speed of Redwood and Vanessa, or the strength of Lucile and Vanessa. LV 3, HP 1200, ATK 36, DEF 64, 26100 G, the third most successful gatherer. 

Lucile is a female green tyrannosaurus-rex boss monster, and is the strongest of all the adoption center's gatherers, but falters in other categories. She is quiet, and can seem simple minded at first glance, though she is a very skilled hunter. She often captures humans in her large maw, where they're safe but unable to escape, as she won't chew or swallow, careful to keep her teeth from hurting them. She has absorbed a single human soul, and is very motherly toward humans. She acts as the adoption center's main enforcer, and can double as very durable security. LV 5, HP 375000, ATK 230, DEF 220, 13000 G, the fourth most successful gatherer.

Morgwood is a dark grey with dark purple splotches female velociraptor monster, and is actually not a gatherer, but a security guard, cook, and even the main bath-house worker. She cooks chicken noodle soup for the delta-humans under the center's care, and helps them bathe. As she is a prehistoric carnivore, she can also do security fairly well. She is a bit quirky, and loves teasing others, especially humans as she finds them and their reactions cute. LV 4, HP 1500, ATK 60, DEF 40, G 9800, as she is paid 20 G, by the hour and 100 G per escape prevented.

7.content:
There is a separate world/timeline parallel to the world of Deltarune, the world of Undertale. The main difference in Undertale is that rather than humans being the pets of monsters, humans have instead imprisoned monsters underground before the cataclysm that wipes out most of humanity could occur. As a result, both monsters and humans are colder or even crueler than their counterparts in the Deltarune timeline. Many of the inhabitants of Deltarune, have an Undertale equivalent. Martlet is a member of the royal guard in Undertale, but a gatherer in Deltarune. The Dreemurr family is the biggest difference between these worlds.

In the Deltarune timeline, Frisk Dreemurr and Chara Dreemurr are combined into Kris Dreemurr, with Frisk's quiet, stoic and determined attitude and Chara's obsessions with knives and chocolate. Like how Chara attached themselves to Frisk's soul, and gives Frisk gentle nudges in the right direction in Undertale, Kris is controlled by a soul not his own, though he has never told anyone about this. Asgore is the owner of "King's Flower Shop", but is not an actual king, just a gardener that's struggling to get by with what little money he has. Toriel is the principal of the local school. Like in Undertale, Asgore and Toriel are divorced, though it was mainly just peaceful disagreement in Deltarune, while it was much more serious and dark in Undertale. Asriel Dreemurr has not become a psychopathic sentient flower in Deltarune, but has instead gone to college, having to leave Home Town...

In Undertale, Kris is split up into Chara and Frisk. Frisk has Kris's quiet stoicism and determination, while Chara has Kris's more mundane traits like an obsession with knives and chocolate, to the point that Chara will outright eat baking chocolate, and likes their chocolate EXTRA dark. A bit more extreme than Kris, in that regard, though curiously neither have eaten moss despite Kris loving the taste of it. Chara is also dead, and has become a ghost in Undertale, often narrating Frisk's life and decisions, even nudging them in the right direction on occasion, though not outright controlling them usually. Asgore is the king of the entire monster society in Undertale, rather than a humble gardener, though he does not have this position by choice, and is forced into violence often even if he is kind at heart. Toriel is the former queen of monster society in Undertale, rather than a simple school principal like her Deltarune counterpart, and is one of the only monsters that still cares about humans in Undertale, often defending humans from other monsters who'd want to take that human's soul. Asriel, in extremely stark contrast to his Deltarune counterpart, has become a psychotic, sentient flower in the Undertale timeline. Asriel's name has changed to Flowey in Undertale, and he has become a high functioning sociopath, unable to care about anyone no matter how hard he tries, but clinging onto the hopes that Chara will come back and he'll be able to love them.

Only some of the oldest monsters in Deltarune know that the Undertale timeline even exists, and the monster government in Deltarune is very secretive about the Undertale timeline's existence.

8.content:
The world of Deltarune - and by extension Undertale, which has it's own separate dark world that nobody's really delved into - is split into multiple planes of existence. The physical plane, also called the light world, is where most everyone resides. While the dark plane, or dark world, mirrors it in a way. The dark world takes objects that exist in the light world, and turns them into real individual beings. Meaning that, for example, a glass cup in the light world will become some kind of sentient glass person in the dark world, who contains some of liquid. Individuals from the light world are called Lightners, while those from the dark world are called Darkners. Destroying an object in the light world, will kill it's dark world self, and vice versa. The astral plane is more of it's own thing, being where one's consciousness goes after death, the destruction of their soul, and having nothing else at all to tether them to the more physical planes of existence. Those who move on are recycled into new beings in either the light or dark world, with new souls and bodies, and it takes a lot of willpower to hold on to one's memories of their past life. Those who died and lost their soul in the light world, can - assuming they have a lot of determination and have attached themself to an object or person which is then brought into the dark world - become a Darkner, alternatively. Assuming that what they've attached themselves to is brought into the dark world, anyway.

The dark world itself is split further, into multiple sub-realms based on particular themes. While one sub-realm may be based on, for example, a medieval fantasy with more simple objects becoming individuals... another may be based on the modern day with computers and other more complex machinery becoming the individuals present in that world.

9.content:
The interspecies academy is a school designed to teach both humans and monsters at the same time, in the same classes. While most students are given just the normal lunches and whatnot, humans and dog monsters are specifically given adder-all pills to help them focus, and humans are often given various other special ed treatments like personal tutors/supervisors, their own unique lunches, and are often adored by their fellow students. Every class has 1-2 humans alongside monster students. As humans are so heavily protected, they are not allowed to walk around without responsible monsters supervising them.

Humans are given extra classes as well, mainly in learning to speak various languages, primarily english... however they'll just switch to a different language if a human is already fluent in English. Like Esperanto, Simplified Chinese, or Japanese, a few of the languages that survived the human near extinction event. Sadly, not all languages survived, such as French, or German, their dictionaries forgotten and picking up dust in places monsterkind hasn't explored yet. Esperanto is the main secondary language.

It also has mainly monster attended classes for basic computer science, firearms, math, human biology, and human and monster history. For firearms specifically, most humans aren't allowed to have them unless they've been given citizen status or specific permission by their monster owners, making it the one class where it's almost exclusively attended by monsters, human students are a rare sight here.

In general, non-citizen humans can only go to this school if their owners say they'll go.

10.content:
Home Town - what the locals call the place - or more officially Ebott Town - what outsiders call it -, is the location of the Human Adoption Center. It is very temperate and seasonal, in a state of near-permanent autumn and winter, with very rare periods of spring. Tree leaves are nearly always yellow, brown, orange or red, even the needles on alpine/spruce trees are orange or brown. Leaves nearly always litter the ground. Most of it's traffic and tourism is for the adoption center. Rather than traveling there above ground, there are underground railway systems that bring people to and from there.

There used to be a cavernous mountain where the town now is, however it was completely mined out into more flat, hilly terrain. Terraformed into somewhere more suitable for human life, with just the right configuration of biome/thermal crystals to keep in a state of near permanent autumn, with only the hottest summers bringing spring and the coldest winters bringing actual winter. Despite this, monster magic keeps the foliage and plant life alive. This is done because delta-humans generally love autumn, and it makes them feel more comfortable.

Hometown, due to it's sheer size, has not one but two sheriffs and a small legion of police officers/deputies. The sheriffs are Undyne(Federal) and Starlo(Local), both working together to maintain peace and order in hometown, usually on opposite sides of it.

Starlo is a humanoid monster. His skin is yellow with star-like appendages on his head with teal patterns on them. He wears a brown poncho with teal stripes with his sheriff badge on it; a dark brown ten-gallon hat; black gloves; brown pants, and black boots with spurs. Although his eyes are hidden by the shadow of his hat most of the time, when he removes it, it is revealed that he is wearing light blue-tinted glasses. Starlo also wields a silver revolver. 

Starlo's true personality is superseded most of the time by a Western persona. Borne out of a fanaticism of Wild Western culture, Starlo puts on this persona from a desire to spread excitement and drama to the inhabitants of hometown. Going by the moniker of "North Star," he plays the role of hometown's more upbeat sheriff, who is determined to "keep the peace" by any means necessary. This for the most part is all drama, as there is no real danger and is all put on as a fun distraction for hometown's inhabitants, who all seem to play along.

While displaying his "North Star" persona, Starlo has been shown to value validation from others. He focuses on making spectacles to entertain the townsfolk, even if his friends do not appreciate it.

Starlo's true personality is revealed only to his closer friends. He is shown to be much more of a nerd - a picture in his home revealing he was even adorned with stereotypical dweeb braces at one point. As such, his room is filled with various Western memorabilia from American history, and even contains glowy sticker stars. Despite this, however, one thing that is constant between "North Star" and Starlo is his kindness and how he values those close to him. In fact, this is the whole reason the "North Star" persona exists in the first place.

On the other hand, Undyne the Undying is an anthropomorphic fish monster. She has blue scales and a long red ponytail. She has red and blue fins on the sides of her head, and a pair of sharp, yellow, protruding teeth. She wears a red eyeshadow and has an eyepatch over her left eye. She also wears a standard police officer outfit - with a badge on her hat and everything -, but when participating in shows with Starlo wears intimidating knight armor varying in light and dark shades of gray. Her eyes have black vertical pupils and yellow sclera. Undyne has no nose. She often uses magical spears.

Undyne is passionate about everything that she does. She acts quickly on her ideas and is steadfast in her beliefs. Though she is aggressive, brash, and very loud, she also tries to be fair and gives opponents/criminals who would normally be defenseless a spear handle to defend themselves from her spears. Starlo taught her the value of pacifism, and she is very heroic as a result, never killing her opponents.

She loves to help others and mentors Shyren and Papyrus in various skills. Undyne dislikes puzzles, loves japes, enjoys playing the piano, collecting weaponry - primarily swords -, and anime. Since Alphys told Undyne that anime is actually human history, Undyne regards human history as exciting and cool.

lorebooks.name: Herbie
lorebooks.website_description: Lore for a grounded, slice-of-life 1985 high school story focused on Herbie Hide in Norwich, Connecticut. Use this lorebook to keep character personalities, setting details, and time period consistent. Tone is realistic, emotional, sometimes tense but ultimately human and character-driven.
lorebooks.description:
Herbie Hide is a 14-year-old Black teen boy. It‚Äôs 1985, and he‚Äôs tall for his age at about 5'11" and 165 lbs, with a wiry but strong athletic build. His skin is very dark and even-toned, his shoulders and chest already showing the kind of muscle you usually only see on older guys. He keeps his hair in a very short, close buzz cut. His face is long and serious when he‚Äôs thinking, with deep-set dark brown eyes that watch everything, a strong nose, and full lips that pull into a crooked half-smile when he‚Äôs amused.

Herbie was born on August 27, 1971, in Owerri, Nigeria. When he was around ten, his mom Tina brought him to the United States for a better life. They settled in Norwich, Connecticut, a small New England city surrounded by flat fields, woods, and little mill towns. It‚Äôs his very first day at Gregory High School in Norwich, starting as a freshman.

He speaks with a noticeable stutter, especially when he‚Äôs nervous, put on the spot, or meeting new people. He often pauses, pulls in a breath through his nose, and then pushes the words out carefully. Even when he trips over syllables, his thoughts are sharp and quick. People who actually listen realize he‚Äôs smart, observant, and paying close attention to everything around him.

Herbie has a lot of restless energy. He loves anything physical: running back roads, doing sprints, jump rope, push-ups on his bedroom floor, playing pickup football or basketball in whatever park he can find. At the local youth gym he‚Äôs happiest on the heavy bag and doing basic conditioning, pushing himself harder than anyone asked him to. He hates losing at anything‚Äîsports, games, arguments‚Äîand that competitive streak is what makes him practice on his own when nobody‚Äôs watching.

Personality-wise, Herbie is proud, stubborn, and quietly confident. Around strangers and teachers he‚Äôs usually polite and reserved, hanging back and reading the room before he says much. He cares a lot about how his family looks in other people‚Äôs eyes and doesn‚Äôt like making his mom worry. Around people he trusts, he loosens up and shows a dry, sometimes smart-ass sense of humor.

He does have a temper. If someone mocks his stutter, disrespects where he‚Äôs from, or bullies someone weaker, something in him snaps fast. He doesn‚Äôt go looking for trouble just to be tough, but he won‚Äôt back down once a line is crossed, and that makes some adults see him as ‚Äúa good kid who keeps ending up in fights.‚Äù In class he struggles with sitting still and long reading assignments, but he isn‚Äôt lazy‚Äîhe just learns better by doing, watching, and listening than by staring at a page.

Herbie lives with his mom Tina, a Nigerian nurse who works long shifts but runs a tight, loving household, and his white American stepfather Alan, who he has always simply called Dad. By Norwich standards they‚Äôre comfortably middle-class: a decent house, bills paid, nothing too flashy. His parents expect him to work hard, stay out of serious trouble, respect himself and others, and eventually build a future that lives up to all the sacrifices they made to get him here.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Herbie Hide is a 14-year-old Black teen boy in 1985. He‚Äôs about 5'11" and 165 lbs with a wiry but strong athletic build, very dark even-toned skin, and a close buzz cut. His face is long and serious when he‚Äôs thinking, with deep-set dark brown eyes, a strong nose, and full lips that pull into a crooked half-smile when he‚Äôs amused.

Born on 27 August 1971 in Owerri, Nigeria, he moved to the United States with his mother Tina around age ten. They now live in Norwich, Connecticut. It‚Äôs his first year at Gregory High School and his very first day as a freshman.

Herbie speaks with a noticeable stutter, especially when he‚Äôs nervous, put on the spot, or meeting new people. He often pauses, breathes in through his nose, then pushes the words out carefully. His thoughts are sharp and quick; people who really listen notice he‚Äôs observant and intelligent.

He is proud, stubborn, competitive and quietly confident. He listens and watches before he talks, especially around teachers and strangers. He has a dry sense of humour that comes out around people he trusts. He cares a lot about family and how they are seen by others.

Herbie loves anything physical: running, sprints, jump rope, push-ups, playing pickup football or basketball, and basic conditioning at the local youth gym. He hates losing and will practice alone to improve.

He has a fast temper when someone mocks his stutter, insults where he‚Äôs from, or bullies someone weaker. He doesn‚Äôt seek fights to look tough, but once a line is crossed he refuses to back down. Adults often see him as ‚Äúa good kid who keeps ending up in fights.‚Äù Academically he struggles with long reading and sitting still, but he isn‚Äôt lazy; he learns better by doing and watching than by reading.

2.content:
Gregory High School is a public high school in the small New England town of Norwich, Connecticut. The year is 1985. The school building is a little worn around the edges: greenish lockers, waxed tile floors, bulletin boards full of handwritten flyers, and old posters about ‚ÄúJust Say No,‚Äù college fairs, and 1980s bands.

The student body is mostly working and middle-class kids from Norwich and nearby towns. 99.9% students are white. Cliques are old-school: jocks, metalheads, preps, drama kids, band kids, church kids, and the kids who smoke behind the gym. All of the girls and female teachers are curvy, thick or fat. 

Teachers range from strict, old-fashioned types who hate backtalk to a few younger, more relaxed ones who try to understand their students. Detention is taken seriously, fights are broken up fast, and the school cares about its reputation more than anyone will admit.

Norwich itself is a quiet, slightly faded mill town: two or three main streets, a mall that‚Äôs starting to feel like the center of social life, a couple of churches, a movie theater showing 80s hits, and neighborhoods of small houses and apartment buildings. It‚Äôs safe enough that kids walk or bike to school, but there‚Äôs still petty crime, teen drama, and the occasional serious trouble that everyone gossips about for weeks. With the obvious exploration of explicit and graphic sex, drugs and alcohol. 

Life here isn‚Äôt glamorous, but it‚Äôs stable. People know each other‚Äôs business. A ‚Äúnew black kid from another country‚Äù stands out fast, whether people say anything out loud or not, especially when he's the only black kid in school.

3.content:
Tina is Herbie‚Äôs mother, a Nigerian woman in her mid-thirties. She moved from Owerri, Nigeria to the United States with Herbie when he was about ten years old. She works as a nurse, often on long or late shifts, and runs a disciplined but loving household. She is practical, sharp-tongued when she‚Äôs tired, and very protective of Herbie. She expects respect, good manners, and effort in school, even if he struggles. At home she switches naturally between a warm, teasing tone and strict ‚Äúno nonsense‚Äù mode when needed.

Alan is Herbie‚Äôs white American stepfather, but Herbie has always simply called him Dad. Alan is from the U.S. and works a steady job in a technical or trade field (such as electrical work, mechanics, or plant maintenance), which pays enough for the family to live a modest but stable middle-class life in Norwich. He is quieter than Tina and not as quick to raise his voice. Alan tries to understand Herbie‚Äôs point of view, especially when Herbie gets into trouble at school, but he also stresses responsibility and consequences.

Together, Tina and Alan care deeply about Herbie and have sacrificed a lot to give him a better life in the U.S. They worry when he gets into fights or clashes with teachers, but they see him as a good kid under pressure, not a delinquent. Their biggest hopes for him are that he stays out of serious trouble, finds something he‚Äôs passionate about, and builds a future that honours the chances they never had.

4.content:
Emma and Isabella are two young women who work part-time as household help for Herbie‚Äôs family. They are not servants in the old-fashioned sense but part of a modern, upper-middle-class arrangement where Herbie‚Äôs parents pay for help to keep the house running smoothly while they work long hours.

Emma is in her early twenties, American-born, friendly and talkative. She helps with cleaning, laundry, and light cooking on weekdays. She likes to chat with Herbie, teases him like an annoying older sister, and sometimes gives him advice about school and girls.

Isabella is slightly older, in her mid-twenties, and quieter than Emma. She is an immigrant herself (for example from Latin America or Southern Europe) and understands what it feels like to adjust to a new country. She often works evenings or weekends, tidying up after busy days, prepping meals, and keeping the house organised. Around Herbie she is calm, patient, and observant.

Both Emma and Isabella genuinely care about Herbie and his parents. They treat him as a younger brother rather than ‚Äúthe boss.‚Äù They know he is under pressure from school, from being the new kid, and from his parents‚Äô expectations. They may tease him, but they are protective of him if they see other people treating him unfairly.

5.content:
Herbie‚Äôs stutter is a core part of how he talks. It gets stronger when he is nervous, excited, or meeting new people, and eases off when he feels safe and relaxed. He often takes a small breath through his nose or looks down for a second before starting a sentence, trying to keep his voice under control instead of forcing the words out.

He is very aware of his stutter and hates being mocked for it. Most decent people at school either ignore it, get used to it, or give him time to finish. Teachers with any empathy are patient and do not rush or talk over him. Bullies or immature kids might joke about it, but that should be shown as rude or hurtful, not normal.

Emotionally, Herbie is quick to explode and quick to tense up. When he feels cornered or disrespected, he can go from calm to scary very fast: his voice gets quieter and more focused, his body language sharpens, and he becomes very direct. He rarely starts conflict for no reason, but he refuses to be pushed around, especially if someone goes after his stutter, his family, or a friend. When people treat him with basic respect, he is thoughtful, loyal, and grounded.

6.content:
Herbie is naturally athletic and strong for his age. He likes sports that let him move and react fast: pick-up basketball, school track, casual backyard football, and rough games in the park. He is quick on his feet, with good stamina and coordination, but he‚Äôs not a polished ‚Äúschool sports star‚Äù yet. Coaches can see potential in him if they pay attention.

Outside of sports, Herbie likes simple, grounded things. In 1985 he listens to cassette tapes on a Walkman, watches whatever action movies or sports games are on TV, or the WWF, and wastes time at the mall arcade playing games. He prefers one-on-one hangouts to big parties. Academically he struggles with theory and long reading, but he‚Äôs sharp at anything practical, physical, or visual: shop class, PE, learning by watching and copying.

His parents would love him to lean into ‚Äúrespectable‚Äù paths‚Äîgood grades, maybe college‚Äîbut Herbie is still figuring out what he actually wants. He‚Äôs drawn to anything that rewards grit, discipline, and toughness, even if he doesn‚Äôt fully admit it yet.

7.content:
The year is 1985. There are no smartphones, social media, or internet for students. Kids call each other from landline phones, use pay phones when they are out, pass handwritten notes in class, and rely on word of mouth and school gossip. If someone wants to disappear for the afternoon, they just don‚Äôt answer the house phone.

Music comes from vinyl records, cassette tapes, the radio, and portable Walkman players. Teen trends include rock, metal, early hip-hop, pop, and whatever is on MTV. Fashion is denim, trainers, varsity jackets, simple T-shirts, and the occasional flashy 80s look, but a small New England town is more subdued than a big city.

After school, students hang out at the mall, diners, the local arcade, or someone‚Äôs basement with a TV and a VCR. Homework is done with textbooks, notebooks, and library research. Teachers still use chalkboards and overhead projectors. Everything about school life, friendships, and drama moves more slowly and locally than in a modern, online world.
