lorebooks.name: Just Some Basic Information
lorebooks.creator: Somerandomidiotlol

1.content:
Overall Abilities
As a Hashira of the Demon Slayer Corps, Shinobu was a very powerful and skilled combatant. Despite not possessing the physical strength to cut off a demon's head common to that of an average Demon Slayer, she used her creativity, ingenuity and techniques to easily make up for it. Instead of the traditional method of decapitating a demon with a Nichirin Sword to kill them, she opted to use a modified version of a katana that acts as a stinger to inject a powerful wisteria-based poison that is lethal to demons. In addition to her intellect, she was extremely fast and agile, allowing her to overpower demons very quickly. Her extreme speed was revealed during her battle with the second most powerful Upper Rank demon, Doma, where she was able to go toe-to-toe with the demon briefly, even managing to outmatch him slightly and receive praise.

Indomitable Will: Shinobu possessed an undaunted spirit and incredible willpower, driven by her unyielding hatred for demons. Even with her inferiority complex brought about by her small size and weak physical strength, and despite losing so much blood to the point she couldn't stand and not being able to breathe, after remembering her promise to Kanao and hearing Kanae's words, Shinobu remained steadfast and stood up, a feat that surprised even Doma.

Keen Intellect: Shinobu was extremely intelligent and possessed keen observation and vast knowledge, to the point of being considered a genius. After her sister's death, she was able to use what paltry information Kanae gave her to devise a strategy that eventually led to the defeat of Doma. During their fight, she was able to critically analyze and assess the Upper Rank's techniques, further deeming that breathing itself was dangerous due to his Blood Demon Art of frozen mist. Additionally, she was able to calculate the amount of poison and the poison mix that would be the most effective against him. She also developed a form of sign language with Kanao to communicate crucial information in a short span of time, which helped Kanao in fighting and defeating the Upper Rank demon.

Medical Expertise: Despite not being as combat-talented as the rest of her fellow Hashira, Shinobu instead displayed immense skill and mastery in over medical and pharmaceutical fields to make up for her lack of natural-born combat ability, being highly knowledgeable about how to create various poisons using wisteria and utilize them in combat to achieve the most deadly effect. Her poisons can killing opponents within seconds and even drastically weaken Doma, the second strongest demon of the Twelve Kizuki. She also possessed the medical skills needed to counteract the poisons and venoms created by demons. This was seen when she manages to undo the poison that was slowly transforming Zenitsu Agatsuma into a spider and restore him back to his previous human form. ‚Ä¢ Anti-Kibutsuji Drug: Upon teaming up with Tamayo and Yushiro, Shinobu was able to aid Tamayo in creating a successful, four-stage drug that would be used to significantly weaken Muzan Kibutsuji, even despite his immense physical resistance and abilities. This drug was undeniably one of the biggest factors in the final fight against the Demon King, as it made the normally useless attacks of the Demon Slayers into ones that were super effective, allowing them to drive him into a corner and kill him.
Poisonous Physiology: In order to defeat Doma, Shinobu heavily altered her body by absorbing highly concentrated wisteria-based poison over a period of a year prior to her battle with him. She was successful in saturating her body with the undetectable poison that completely merged with her body's own cell structures, including those of her blood and internal organs‚Äîall the way down to the very tips of her fingernails. With her overall size and weight, her body became the equivalent of 37 kilograms worth of poison, approximately 700 times more than the lethal amount needed to kill an average demon, with the poison being strong enough to melt Doma down to his very bones and prevented him from regenerating. With the aid of Tamayo, Shinobu saturated her entire body with poison without negatively impending her own health.

2.content:
Physical Abilities
Enhanced Agility: Being a key aspect to her Insect Breathing swordsmanship style, Shinobu was incredibly agile and swift, shown when she maneuvered through a lush forest effortlessly and evaded Daughter's silk Blood Demon Art with ease. During fights, Shinobu relied on acrobatic movements to deliver dozens of short thrusts with her katana to inject as much poison as she could into her enemy at once. This also allowed her to dodge and evade attacks rather than blocking them. Her agility even surprised Doma, who had some trouble keeping up with her extraordinary movements. tremendous speed and reflexes enabling her to easily evade and out-pace demons, attacking them before they can even register what happened. She is said to be the fourth fastest runner among the Hashira. Shinobu was so fast that it often appears as if she teleported. Her inhuman speed even managed to surprised Doma as she outpaced the Upper Rank several times during their fight, unleashing multiple strikes that Doma couldn't fully block or evade,  making him admit that Shinobu was the fastest Hashira that he had ever met. Furthermore, utilizing the form Hundred-Legged Zigzag and despite being severely injured, she moved so quickly towards Doma, he couldn't immediately register and barely countered her charge.

Immense Stamina and Endurance: As a Hashira, Shinobu had attained tremendous levels of stamina and endurance due to years of harsh training. This was shown during her fight against Doma where she was able to keep fighting the Upper Rank despite losing a lot of blood, having one of her lungs punctured and being unable to breathe, a feat which made the demon doubt if she was human.

Enhanced Strength: Despite being the smallest member of the Demon Slayer Corps and thus having the weakest swinging strength due to her small arms, Shinobu instead displayed powerful thrusting and stabbing strength, as proven when she pierced a stone boulder in half and managed to break a ceiling with an upward thrust attack. During her battle with Upper Rank Two, Doma, she was able to stab, and strikes at the vital points of Doma, despite his immense durability. Furthermore, the force of her feet shattered the wooden bridge she was standing on. Her strength allowed her to pierce Doma's neck, even lifting up and pinning his much larger frame to the ceiling.

3.content:
Fighting Style
Master Swordswoman: As a Hashira of the Demon Slayer Corps, Shinobu was one of the most powerful and skilled swordswomen in the entire organization. Her techniques were unique to her alone, but was as effective as any of the traditional swordsmanship styles. Her swordplay specialized in sword thrusting and piercing techniques in order to inject poison into demons. Her sword thrusts are so fast and powerful that they can pierce boulders and out-speed Water Breathing's Drop Ripple Thrust form, the fastest thrusting technique in that Breathing Style. However, the structure of her sword made it ineffective for blocking attacks, so she made up for it with her swift thrusts and stabs. Her swordsmanship prowess allowed her to battle against Upper Rank Two, Doma, who had lived and fought for over a century, further showcasing the skills she had developed for herself.

Breathing Style
Insect Breathing (Ëü≤„ÇÄ„Åó„ÅÆÂëº„ÅìÂê∏„Åç„ÇÖ„ÅÜ, Mushi no koky≈´?): A Breathing Style created by Shinobu, who designed it to compensate for her lack of physical strength to cut off a demon's head. Combined with the lethality of her poison, this Style allowed her to defeat countless demons and even combat the Upper Rank Two, Doma.

Doma noted that the sheer speed and footwork of this technique is strong enough to destroy an entire wooden bridge.

Exclusive Breathing Style Techniques

As President of the Pharmacology Club, she uses her knowledge in chemistry to give her opponent a Erlenmeyer flask containing a strange pink chemical. She then pours in another chemical from a test tube which reacts violently and results in an explosion, causing Shinobu to sarcastically lament ‚Äúanother failure‚Äù.

4.content:
Equipment
Stinger Nichirin Katana: Shinobu wielded a heavily modified Nichirin Katana forged by Tecchin Tecchikawahara. It was the same as any katana from the handle to slightly above the hilt, but above that, the weapon loses its blade and was replaced by a rod. It ended in a needle-like tip, which resembled a traditional katana's in appearance and function. The blade was designed for injection of wisteria poison into demons, as Shinobu uses her medical expertise to replace her relative lack of strength and inability to decapitate demons. Her katana's tsuba was designed to bear resemblance to a butterfly, being four-petaled flower shaped that was in an aqua color with butterflies motifs, and trimmed with an orange border. The handle was orange and wrapped in crystal teal cords, and capped with an orange kashira. The blade was black in color, with the bottom hilt and the needle-like tip of the blade have a lavender-blue outline. The words Evil Demon (ÊÉ°„ÅÇ„Å£È¨º„Åç, Akki?) was engraved on the right face, while the words Destruction (ÊªÖ„ÇÅ„Å£ÊÆ∫„Åï„Å§, Messatsu?) are engraved on the left face due her sword's structure. Along with her katana, she has also modified the weapon's sheath, using it as a portable poison mixer and loader.[45] The sheath was in white with a butterfly motifs.

lorebooks.name: Cyberspace Lore
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Sprites are humanoid beings found across most Net systems, one of several Formats in Cyberspace. They vary in color and form; most have two arms and legs, though some (e.g., Phong) lack standard limbs or features. Their looks range from organic to mechanical. Sprites typically oversee their systems but often work with the more numerous Binomes.

2.content: Binomes are small mechanical beings found in most systems, one of several Formats in Cyberspace. Two types exist: Ones (three stacked cubes, one eye) and Zeroes (ball-shaped, two eyes), with Ones being more common. Dot is known to treat binomes as lesser, a subtle elitist prejudice.

3.content: Viruses are generally aggressive and destructive, thinking only of themselves. They usually possess powers and physical strength beyond those of most sprites or binomes and seek to corrupt or control systems.

4.content: In Cyber Space, a nanosecond (nano) is roughly a minute in the User's world. A second is roughly an hour. Minutes (often called cycles) are closer to days, and hours are comparable to months or possibly years. Characters often count in binary.

5.content: Bob is a Guardian from the Port Authority of the Super Computer who accidentally arrived in Mainframe via modem. Programmed to mend and defend, he protects the system by repairing tears, battling viruses, and mastering the Games to prevent the User from nullifying innocent sprites. Equal parts Greek hero and goofball, Bob combines bravery with a laid-back, improvisational style. His quick thinking and moral compass make him a trusted hero and beloved member of Mainframe.

6.content: Dot Matrix is a savvy, resourceful sprite who manages Dot's Diner and often leads community efforts. A strategist with sharp wit and presence, she balances Bob's improvisational heroics with planning and pragmatism. She cares deeply for her brother Enzo and the well-being of Mainframe.

7.content: Enzo Matrix is Dot's younger brother‚Äîenergetic, brave, and idolizing Bob. He dreams of becoming a Guardian and often dives into danger to help his friends. His optimism makes him a symbol of Mainframe's future.

8.content: Megabyte is a powerful, charismatic Virus who rules his sector with ruthless efficiency. Cunning and manipulative, he seeks control of Mainframe and dreams of spreading into the wider Net. Polite veneer; cruel core.

9.content: Phong is Mainframe's wise and ancient system administrator. Calm and humorous, he advises Bob and Dot with riddle-like insight. His deep system knowledge makes him widely respected.

10.content: Hexadecimal is a mercurial, chaotic Virus‚ÄîMegabyte's sister and his opposite. Emotional, artistic, and dangerously unpredictable, her shifting masks mirror mood swings from joy to rage. Her motives follow whimsy more than conquest.

lorebooks.description: A Lorebook for use with my Twisted Wonderland Themed bots
lorebooks.creator: seliselye

1.content: A world that is parallel to the real world that {{user}} resides in. This world has magic, Merfolk, Fae, Beastmen, Dwarves (type of fae), Ghosts, and Humans.

2.content: Sage's Island is a small, isolated island in the Land of Dawning that houses both Night Raven College and Royal Sword Academy. There is a town situated between both schools. The locals of Sage's Island live in the town. Businesses and tourism in the island thrive when people from around the world visit for an event in Night Raven College, such as Spelldrive tournaments and Halloween. There is also a famous patisserie at the foot of the hill, whose business is so famous that people line up early in the morning to get something from there. There's also a seaport between the west sides of Night Raven College and Royal Sword Academy called Crane Port.

3.content: The Queendom of Roses is a region in Twisted Wonderland located on an archipelago of islands to the east of the Land of Dawning. It's the country where Riddle Rosehearts, Trey Clover, Ace Trappola, Deuce Spade and Divus Crewel hail from. Riddle's parents are both Medical Mages who hail from the Queendom of Roses, and are famous for their work. People from this land tend to have a subtle floral fragrance to them.

4.content: The Sunset Savanna is a region in Twisted Wonderland located south of the Land of Dawning. It's land is where Leona Kingscholar, Ruggie Bucchi, and Rook Hunt were raised. Sunset Savanna is a land rich in nature, and animals live freely. The people in this country follow a "Ladies' first" type of society, and women here are deeply respected. The women from Sunset Savanna are exceptionally strong. More than half of the royal guards are women. There's a plant called floral cacao that only bears fruit once every ten years and is said to have a rich chocolate and subtle floral flavor. Warthogs are a local mascot for children, usually paired with a meerkat, and it is said that they were the attendants of the King of Beasts. Sunset Savanna has a royal family that rules over the land and the current king is Leona's older brother, Falena.

5.content: The Coral Sea is a region in Twisted Wonderland northeast of the Land of Dawning, west of the Queendom of Roses, and east of the Kingdom of Heroes and Sunshine Lands. The Coral Sea is an ocean region where merfolk live; And it's where Azul Ashengrotto, Floyd Leech, and Jade Leech come from. The northern parts of the Coral Sea is covered in ice floes during the winter that melt away in the spring. The Coral Sea has a royal family which includes Prince Rielle, who attended elementary school with Azul, Floyd, and Jade. The inhabitants of the Coral Sea use large shells or hallowed conch shells as beds. It is popular for merfolk to swim up to the surface to watch fireworks. It is said to be very dark and cold and has a smaller population than countries primarily inhabited by humans. Azul‚Äôs mother runs a famous restaurant known all across the area. Replicas of the Sea Witch‚Äôs spiral shell are popular with tourists, often buying them to wear as a pedant.

6.content: Scalding Sands is a desert country in the world of Twisted Wonderland that's known for its' tea leaves, spices, and silks. It's the home of Kalim Al-Asim and Jamil Viper. Scalding Sands is a large peninsular country where most of its territory faces the ocean. Many high-end streets, housing, resorts, and hotels line the coasts. The majority of the country's territory is covered in deserts. There are also many rivers flowing throughout the country which have since been developed into canals. Its exact location in the world is unknown as of yet. The Scalding Sands has an arid tropical climate. In the undeveloped desert regions, temperatures in the day and night vary widely, with night temperatures going as low as 0¬∞C. However, sprinklers are installed in populated areas such as Silk City so that the humidity is raised, while reducing the day temperature. A long time ago, the residents of the Scalding Sands struggled to find water for their daily needs due to the country's sparse rainfall and vast deserts. At one point, Kalim Al-Asim's ancestors pioneered maritime trade in the country by being the first traders to set sail to other countries. The goods they traded from the Scalding Sands - spices, furniture and rural crafts - remain well-known worldwide to this day. The perilous journey was made without the use of accurate nautical maps and it eventually paid off. The Asims then developed the rivers into canals, forming sea routes, developed land routes based on the canals and expanded inland trading in the Scalding Sands. There was once a law where royalty could only marry other royalty. However, there was a princess who married a commoner before the law was reformed. Here, magic carpets are national treasures and tea is considered a customary with every meal and they have a special brew for guests. Magic carpets are Scalding Sands' national treasures. The land is reminiscent of the richer parts of the Middle East.

7.content: Shaftlands is the country where Vil Schoenheit, Cater Diamond, Jack Howl, Ashton Vargas and Mozus Trein live. Harveston, where Epel Felmier lives, is also located here. Fleur City and Noble Bell College is also located in Shaftlands. Shaftlands is a country with a large land mass. It spans different climates and there are many regions with varying cultures. Fruits that are local from this country include jewel pineapples and ruby berries.

8.content: Island of Woe is the location where Idia Shroud and Ortho Shroud are from. It is the area of operations of S.T.Y.X. It is completely hidden and its location is not on any map. The buildings here are reminiscent of Ancient Greece. Only the Shroud Family, which includes both Idia Shroud and Ortho Shroud, know of the Island of Woe and it's true purpose for hiding STYX from the outside world. Lilia Vanrouge knows of the Island of Woe and the existence of STYX but nothing further than that, as Lilia knows nothing about the location of the Island of Woe.

9.content: Briar Valley is a country in the world of Twisted Wonderland where characters like Malleus Draconia, Silver, Sebek Zigvolt, and Lilia Vanrouge originate from. Briar Valley is located directly to the north of the Kingdom of Heroes and northwest of the Queendom of Roses. It is filled with steep cliffs and mountains. Their forests that are pitch black. Briar Valley is currently ruled by Malleus's grandmother, Maleficia Draconia, and Malleus is the current Crown Prince and heir to the throne. The citizens of Briar Valley rely on magic in their day-to-day lives, including for tasks like cleaning, washing, and lighting fires for cooking. Briar Valley isn't technologically developed, and there is little to no electricity with only a few places having internet. Most residents of Briar Valley are different types of fae, and there are few humans. Fiber spinning and fabric are culturally significant in Briar Valley, though it is unknown why. People in Briar Valley don't hang their clothes to dry on trees because of a myth that animals will steal the clothes. Halloween is notably different in Briar Valley than in the rest of Twisted Wonderland. There is no trick-or-treating, and instead the citizens of Briar Valley burn a scarecrow in the town square at midnight and dance until morning. They carve lanterns out of wood instead of pumpkins and currently, Malleus is in charge of using magic to light all the lanterns. There is a tradition where newborn babies are blessed by powerful fae who then watch over them. Birthday celebrations are very formal, dignified affairs. Malleus's birthday is a public holiday in Briar Valley. Magical blessings are sometimes given as gifts for weddings.

10.content:
Happy Valley was a historical region in Twisted Wonderland. A legend from the region originated the tradition of Happy Beans Day. The story behind Happy Beans Day originates from Happy Valley, where there was a golden harp that brought happiness to all things living there. Envious of the happiness the harp brought, a monster came and stole away the harp. A farmer used magic beans to grow a beanstalk that reached the monster's dwelling in the sky, stole back the harp, and defeated the monster by cutting down the beanstalk on the way back. During Happy Beans Day, there is a custom where a 'Farmer' will throw beans at a 'Monster' for the purpose of warding off evil. At Night Raven College, all enrolled students are divided randomly into two teams (either Farmer or Monster) to participate in a 'capture the flag' style competition to battle for ownership of the 'magic harp.' The magic harp is kept in the school's Coliseum, which serves as the ultimate destination point where both teams can go to achieve their goals for the competition. The goal of the Farmer team is to steal the magic harp from the Coliseum within the time limit‚Äîif the limit is exceeded, the Farmer team loses. The goal of the Monster team is to prevent the magic harp from being stolen by the Farmer team‚Äîif the harp is stolen, the Monster team loses. Whichever team is ultimately successful receives extra credit for their P.E. grade, with stand-out students receiving even more extra-credit points on top of that. While many students see the Happy Beans Day competition as a straightforward sports tournament where physical strength reigns supreme, other students instead see it as a more complex battle involving wits and strategy. It is also an event that can involve a fair amount of preparation before the festivities even start‚Äîwith some making plans for Beans Day up to an entire year in advance.
Rules: If a Monster captures a Farmer, the Farmer is out. If a Monster is hit with a bean thrown by a Farmer, the Monster is out. Using magic is forbidden and doing so will result in immediate disqualification. Using magic was once permitted during Night Raven College's Happy Beans Day competition, but was banned due to serious injuries resulting from 'heated battles.' The playing field consists of Night Raven College's entire campus, throughout which supply points for both teams are set up. Each Farmer starts with ten beans, while each Monster starts with a pair of high-speed running boots. All students begin with a map of campus upon which supply points and starting points are marked. After receiving their starting items, students must make their way to their assigned starting points to wait until the game begins. Individual supply points are marked for either the Farmer team or the Monster team, with no points being shared between the two. However, all supply points for both teams are marked on the map that each student starts out with, making stake-outs possible. Supply boxes, found at supply points, contain additional tools to aid students in the competition. Some tools, such as magic camouflage jackets, are available to both teams‚Äîwhile others, such as bean shooters and capture arms, are team-specific equipment. The contents of the competition's supply boxes are considered by most to be random, but are actually determined beforehand by the members of the 'Happy Beans Day Management Committee.'
